story:
This campaign was moved! If you want to know more go here and discover all the news and perks we have for you!!!

Esta campanha foi movida! Se queres saber mais vai aqui e descobre todas as novidades e prendas que temos para ti!!!
Clica aqui para a versão em Português
1. Who are we?
2. Our Project
3. How?
4. How to attract and interact?
5. The Special Appearences
6. Social Support & Responsibility
7. Portugal
8. Goal, Budget & Expenses
9. When?
10. Perks
11. Thank you all!

- Guilherme, 28 years old, Software Engineer.
- Ivo, 29 years old, Chef.
- João, 28 years old, Product Designer.

But that doesn't answer to the question. We are not our names, age our job, we are what moves and what drives us. We are three old friends from Lisbon, Portugal, who want to do something different. We have known each other for more than 25 years now and we share a lot of interests like traveling, capturing moments and emotions on photographs and film, meeting new people and sharing our stories. And with that we want to embark on amazing adventure and create chain of emotions to help others.


To travel around Europe for 100 days in an RV, visiting more than 20 countries with a main goal: find the best street artists of each city we stop by, helping them out by giving some visibility and spread out the word about how amazing they are.
The best in each city will receive a prize from our hands!

This is our project! This is Hello Europe! Everything starts with hello, and we want that word to be a metaphor of the moments we experience and the word we say the most, every day, to all the people we meet!


How are we going to pull this off and interact with you and all the people who join us in this adventure?
We will use the social media, of course. We have a Facebook page integrated with Twitter, Blogger and a YouTube channel. You won’t be a mere spectator! You will interact!

And how's that?

You will choose the best buskers. We will upload a video with a small performance and interview of the best 3 artists we select from each city. Before we continue our journey the artist with more likes from our followers gets the prize and more visibility! We will repeat this process in checkpoint of our journey, extending our help to more artists and creating cool and artistic content for everybody to listen, see and most of all feel!


We want to get everyone's attention to our social media platforms where everything is going to happen for you to see. The adventure, and the videos, photos and interviews of the best street performers. So here are some simple ideas to achieve our goal:

  • We are going to have a customized RV, Id Cards and clothing with our logos and also distribute leaflets to encourage people to see our project, give their contribution if they want or follow us in the adventure;
  • We will have a giveaway of instant photos to random people in the streets of each city (5000 photos in total) and encourage them to post a photo holding the picture they got from us on our Facebook page. Then all they have to do is get their friends to like the photo. In the end of our journey the photos with the most likes will get gifts too. The photo will be handed with a special frame holder (click the photos bellow to see a video explaining our idea);
  • We are going to promote treasure hunts in each city. How? 100 QR codes will be placed in each city with links to our Facebook page. And here is the twist: one of them will get you to a winner's page. The first person to get there will win the prize (click here to see a video explaining our idea);
  • In each city we will set up a day, hour and place for everyone to meet us up, take some pictures with us, to be posted on Facebook, and also get some instant photos for free!
  • In the end of our trip we will make a draw to give gifts to our followers;

You can click on each photo to see images and videos about the initiatives!


We have contacted Portuguese celebrities to work with us and help us spread out the word and give visibility to our idea. We are proud to say that we already have the full support of Nuno Norte, the winner of the Portuguese Idol (1st edition). He has now a solid career in music and guess what (…?) he was a street musician for many years before going to the show.
We also have the support from Valete, one of the most eloquent and influent Portuguese Rappers, and as Hip Hop has grown to having a steady cultural ground, we wanted to have some representation from that area, getting closer to people.
Additionally, André Nunes, a well-known actor from Portuguese TV and Stages, mainly know by its great sense of humor and comical roles.
Another one is the comedians/musicians duo Homens da Luta, a great TV phenomenon. They base their act mainly on street sketches getting people off guard, and firmly sustain an image of righteousness and voice to the people.
The role of the sponsors will be simple, but of the utmost importance:

  • Share and give project visibility through their contacts;
  • Star on promotional photos and videos to help spread out the word;
  • Share contacts with us and call other artists to help;
  • Give simple gifts as autographed Cd's and ticket shows to give our followers.

You can click on each photo and see the great promotional videos with them:

We will update this section and post photos and videos as we gather the support of more artists too!


Besides the street artists, we also want to give our contribution to a Social Solidarity Institution.  We selected the non-profit organization called "Moinho da Juventude" (Youth Mill).

We chose this Organization for two main reasons:

  • Because they provide an essential care to one of the toughest neighborhoods in Portugal where around 8 thousand people live in, providing day care to all the children and trying to give a purpose in the life of hundreds of youngsters through education, art and culture to give them an opportunity outside of the streets and delinquent life.
  • Because they are our neighbors and we want to help locally and with impact, trying to improve our community and give something back.

You can know more about their amazing mission here.
We are going to donate them 10% of the money raised here and we have a place on our Blog and Facebook page where people can make donations. That money will be converted to formation, material and services and the more money we raise here, the more we’ll be able to help them too!


We want to give a small share to our country in this time of crisis. Thus, we have simple ideas so people can know more about our amazing country and its 900 years of history.

  • In the end, our trip will carry with visiting Portuguese cities where we want to show all our followers how amazing they are and how a great place to visit Portugal is;
  • Show all the great Portuguese gastronomy by selecting the best Portuguese restaurants in the cities we visit and giving them the visibility we can;
  • Show that Portuguese are great people, with initiative and creativity and that the spirit of adventure didn’t end at the time of the Discoveries;
  • Help promote some typical Portuguese products around Europe.

And if everything goes according to plan you will feel an urge to visit us here in Portugal!


For all this to happen we need your contribution, and because we don't like to ask for things without giving anything in return, in addition to our gratitude we set some cool perks for you which you can check out here on the right side of your screen! --->

As you can see in each Perk tier you get all the Perks from the previous tiers!

With the perk "Dress me up!" you win the Hello Europe Super Special T-shirt and here you can see some examples of the designs and colors you can choose from:

When you receive the T-Shirt don't forget to send us a picture of you wearing it so we can post it on our Facebook Hall of Fame so everybody can see you are made this project possible! Show all your friends and get them to like your photo so you can be eligible to other cool gifts in the end of our journey!

With the perk "Condecorate me!" you'll be condecorated by your help with a great Hello Europe Badge. You can pick the color and design. See some examples:

With the perk "Photo Giveaway!" besides the access to the best photos in HD + Photoshop treatment royalty free for you to use, you also receive at your mail an instant photo of us with a very special frame and a personalized thank you note.

With this perk you also can be eligible for another gift and all you need to do is take a picture of yourself holding the perk you received and sent it to us or post it on our Facebook page. Then get your friends to like it and 1 like = 1 vote. In the end of the adventure, prizes for the most liked photos!

Depending on the perk the expected date of delivery to you is the following:

Perk Name

Estimated Delivery
Thank me!!

Credits in the video 2 weeks after the end of the campaign
All the rest in 2 days after your contribution
Condecorate me! In one month after the end of the campaign
Photo giveaway! Day by day after the adventure begins
Dress me up! In one month after the end of the campaign
Serenate myself! During and after the trip
Draw me! Maximum 1 month after the project ends
Make me a VIP! 1 or 2 weeks after your contribution
Take me with you! We’ll schedule the date with 2 weeks’ notice *

* to buy the "Take me with you!" perk you have to live or go to one of the following cities: Madrid, Barcelona, Monte Carlo, Rome, Dubrovnik, Zagreg, Budapest, Vienne, Prague, Krakow, Warsaw, Riga, Tallinn, Vilnius, St Petersburg, Helsinki, Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen, Berlin, Amsterdam, Brugge, London, Paris, Geneve, Oporto, Lisbon. If you live elsewhere in Europe and really want this perk contact us and convince us that your city would be amazing for this project and we will change or route!

So don't miss out this opportunity to make part of our project, earning our eternal gratitude plus a cool and unique perk for you!


To make this happen, with all that comes with it, we need money. The goal we set is the minimum to make this project happens with all that comes to it.
Here you can see the estimation of the expenses we need to cover:

Item

Description

Value
RV rental Average 120€ per day in the planned dates 12.000€
Fuel, tolls and ferries 15.000 km! 3.900€
Camping sites and food We need to sleep and eat 7.100€
Multimedia material 2 instant cameras and 5000 photo paper units 2.500€
Merchandising RV decoration, clothing, 5000 photo frame holders, 2200 QR code stickers. 1.500€
Artists prizes 250€ for each artist, one per city. 5.500€
Perks (estimation) T-Shirts, Instant Photos, Photo Frames, Badges and posting expenses 4.000€
Others Internet, gas cylinders, insurances 1.900€

 

TOTAL

38.400€

On top of this value we want to start with a 10% contribution to the non-profit organization "Moinho da Juventude" and considering the IndieGoGo fee of 4% and 3% for credit card processing applied to our total, we are setting our goal to 45.000€.

It’s quite a lot but you all your help we are confident we can achieve it!

We are also trying to contact some brands to see if we can get any sponsors that help us with money or goods. So even if we don’t reach our goal here in Indiegogo we assure you that you will get all your Perks!
With the extra money that surpasses our goal we will be able to increase the street artist prizes and donate more money to the selected non-profit organization.

So don’t hesitate to give your contribution even if we had already reached our goal!


After we receive your help and reach our goal we will need one month to take off, so we are thinking of starting our adventure in April. It’s a great time to go because it’s cheaper than in the summer peak season, there are less tourists and the street artists raise less money. We also believe that in this time of the year we will encounter the true street performers who make a living out of it all year long.


Thank you in advance for all the help you can give to launch this idea. If you can’t contribute with money, please spread out the word to all of your friends and share this on Facebook. It will be a great help for us!
Best regards and hope you like our project and help us have the trip of our lives while helping others and promoting art and culture around Europe.

Thank you!

Guilherme Duarte
Ivo Tavares
João Mendes
Email: hello.europe.project@gmail.com

Thank you all | Socialize with us and know more about Hello Europe!

Versão Portuguesa
1. Quem somos?
2. O nosso Projecto
3. Como?
4. Como divulgar e interagir?
5. Os Padrinhos
6. Responsabilidade Social
7. Portugal
8. Objectivo, Orçamento e Despesas
9. Quando?
10. Prendas!
11. Obrigado a todos!

- Guilherme, 28 anos, Engenheiro Informático.
- Ivo, 29 anos, Chef.
- João, 28 anos, Designer de Produto.

Isto não responde à pergunta. Isto são os nossos nomes, a nossa profissão e a nossa idade. Não define quem somos. O que define quem somos são os nossos valores, a nossa visão e a nossa missão. Somos de Lisboa, Portugal, e conhecemo-nos há mais de 25 anos e temos muitos interesses em comum tais como viajar, capturar momentos e emoções em fotografia e filme, conhecer novas pessoas e partilhar as nossas histórias. E com esses interesses queremos embarcar numa aventura fantástica onde pretendemos criar uma cadeia de emoções e ajudar outros.


Viajar pela Europa durante 100 dias numa autocaravana, por mais de 20 países com um objectivo principal: encontrar os melhores artistas de rua de cada cidade que visitarmos. Ajudá-los, dando-lhes visibilidade e exposição para divulgar a sua fantástica arte.
O melhor de cada cidade receberá um prémio das nossas mãos!

Este é o nosso projecto! Este é o Hello Europe! Tudo começa com um olá, queremos que essa palavra seja metafórica a todos os momentos que experienciarmos e a palavra que vamos dizer mais vezes todos os dias a todas as pessoas que conhecermos e partilharmos a nossa história.


Como é que isto vai funcionar e como vamos interagir contigo e com todos os que nos acompanharem nesta aventura?
Vamos utilizar as redes sociais, claro! Temos uma página de Facebook, integrada com Twitter, Blogger e canal de Youtube e tu não serás um mero espectador. Vais interagir!

Com dúvidas ainda? Continua a ler...

Vais escolher os melhores artistas de rua! Vamos colocar um vídeo com uma pequena actuação e entrevista dos 3 melhores artistas de rua que encontrarmos em cada cidade. A antes de seguirmos viagem o artista com mais likes dos nossos seguidores receberá um prémio e mais visibilidade!Vamos repetir este processo para todas as cidades visitadas, estendendo assim o nosso contributo a mais artistas, criando conteúdo fantástico e artístico para que todos possam ver, ouvir e principalmente sentir!


Queremos atrair todas as pessoas que conseguirmos para as nossas plataformas de Social Media onde vamos colocar toda a nossa aventura, os vídeos, fotos e entrevistas dos melhores artistas de rua. Podes ver aqui algumas das iniciativas que temos pensadas para atrair o máximo de visibilidade e de interacção com todos:

  • Vamos ter uma caravana personalizada e andar identificados com cartões e roupa com os nossos logos e também vamos distribuir flyers para encorajar as pessoas a verem o nosso projecto, darem a sua contribuição se quiserem ou apenas colocarem seguirem-nos nesta aventura;
  • Vamos oferecer fotografias instantâneas a pessoas aleatórias nas ruas de cada cidade (5000 no total) e vamos encorajá-las a colocarem uma foto delas com a que receberam de nós na nossa página do Facebook. Depois poderão incentivar os amigos a colocarem um like nessa foto e na nossa página também. No fim as fotos com mais likes receberão também prémios. A foto será entregue numa moldura bem especial! (Clica na foto para veres um vídeo que exemplifica o processo);
  • Vamos promover uma caça ao tesouro em cada cidade. Como? Vamos colocar 100 QR codes por cidade que reencaminham para a nossa página de Facebook. E aqui há uma surpresa: um desses códigos levará para uma página especial premiada. A primeira pessoa a descobrir ganhará um prémio! (clica aqui para veres um vídeo onde explicamos melhor a nossa ideia);
  • Vamos querer que participem pessoalmente e se encontrem connosco. Em cada cidade vamos marcar um dia, hora e local onde toda a gente pode aparecer, tirar algumas fotos connosco para aparecerem no Facebook e ainda receber algumas fotos instantâneas como oferta!
  • No fim da nossa viagem vamos fazer um sorteio de um presente entre todos os nossos seguidores.

Clica em cada uma das fotos para saberes mais sobre cada uma das iniciativas!


Queremos que pessoas do mundo do espectáculo apadrinhem a nossa ideia e nos ajudem a divulgar o nosso projecto. Temos orgulho em ter já um padrinho e total apoio do Nuno Norte, vencedor da primeira edição do Ídolos em 2004. Agora com uma carreira sólida na música foi em tempos músico de rua antes de se dar a conhecer no concurso.
Contamos também com o apoio do Valete, um dos mais influentes rappers portugueses e sendo que o Hip Hop nasce nas ruas fez todo o sentido para nós termos um representante dessa área.
Outro dos padrinhos é o André Nunes, uma cara bem conhecida da nossa TV e teatro principalmente pelo seu bom sentido de humor e papéis cómicos! Contamos também com o apoio dos "Homens da Luta" que nos vão ajudar a dar também visibilidade para irmos fazer a luta por essa Europa fora!
O papel de quem nos apadrinha será simples mas de grande importância:

  • Partilhar e divulgar o projecto através dos seus contactos;
  • Participar em fotos e vídeos promocionais para ajudar a espalhar a notícia;
  • Partilhar contactos connosco e chamar outros artistas para participarem;
  • Oferecer presentes simples tais como cds autografados e bilhetes para espectáculos para podermos sortear pelos nossos seguidores.

Clica em cada uma das fotos em baixo para veres os vídeos que fizemos com eles!

Vamos actualizando esta secção e colocando fotos e vídeos à medida que formos conseguindo mais padrinhos e madrinhas para o nosso projecto!


Para além dos artistas de rua, queremos dar o nosso contributo a uma Instituição de Solidariedade Social. Seleccionamos a organização sem fins lucrativos "Moinho da Juventude".

Escolhemos esta organização por duas razões principais:

  • Pela sua fantástica missão que assegura cuidados essenciais num dos bairros mais problemáticos de Portugal, onde mais de 8 mil pessoas vivem, providenciando infantário para muitas crianças do bairro e dando um propósito de vida a centenas de jovens através da educação, arte e cultura para lhes dar uma oportunidade fora das ruas e de uma vida delinquente.
  • Por eles serem nossos vizinhos e nos ser uma realidade muito próxima. Queremos assim ajudar localmente e com impacto tentando dar o nosso contributo à nossa comunidade.

Podes saber mais sobre a sua fantástica missão e história de mais de 25 anos aqui.
Temos uma percentagem de 10% sobre o dinheiro angariado aqui que lhes iremos doar e temos também um local no nosso Blogue e Facebook onde todos lhes podem doar dinheiro, dinheiro esse que converteremos em formação, material e obras e quanto mais angariarmos aqui mais os conseguiremos ajudar!


Queremos fazer a nossa parte pelo nosso país neste tempo de crise. Para isso temos ideias simples para que as pessoas fiquem a conhecer o nosso fantástico cantinho da Europa e os seus 900 anos de história:

  • No fim da nossa viagem vamos visitar cidades portuguesas para mostrar a todos os seguidores que fomos angariando o quão fantástico é o nosso Portugal;
  • Mostrar a nossa fantástica gastronomia descobrindo os melhores restaurantes Portugueses pela Europa e dando-lhes a visibilidade merecida;
  • Mostrar que os portugueses são pessoas fantásticas, com iniciativa e criatividade e que o espírito de aventura não acabou na época dos Descobrimentos;
  • Ajudar a divulgar produtos típicos portugueses lá fora.

E se tudo correr como planeado no fim vais ver o teu amor por Portugal reforçado!


Para tudo isto ser possível precisamos do teu contributo! E como não gostamos de pedir sem dar nada em troca, para além da nossa gratidão e de fazeres parte de um projecto diferente, temos prendas para ti que podes ver aqui no lado direito do teu ecrã! --->

Como podes ver em cada nível estás adquirir todas as prendas dos níveis anteriores!

Na prenda "Dress me up!" recebes a T-Shirt Super Impecável Hello Europe com todas as cores e desenhos que temos à tua escolha:

Quando receberes a T-Shirt não te esqueças de nos enviar uma fotografia tua com ela vestida para a podermos colocar no nosso Quadro de Honra no Facebook para que todos possam ver que tornaste este projecto possível! Mostra a todos os teus amigos e diz-lhes para gostarem da tua foto e ficas assim habilitado a mais prémios fantásticos no fim da nossa aventura!

Com a prenda "Condecorate me!" serás condecorado pela tua ajuda com um fantástico crachá. Podes escolher a cor e o desenho que gostas mais. Vê aqui alguns exemplos:

Com a prenda "See All!" recebes no teu correio uma foto instantânea nossa com uma moldura especial e um agradecimento personalizado.

Com esta prenda podes ainda habilitar-te a mais prémios, para isso basta tirares uma fotografia tua em que mostras a prenda que recebeste e envia-nos ou coloca no nosso mural do Facebook. Chama os teus amigos para gostarem da foto e 1 like = 1 voto. No fim da nossa viagem as fotos mais votadas terão prémios!

Dependendo da prenda que escolheste a data prevista para entrega é a seguinte:

Perk Name

Estimated Delivery
Thank me!

Créditos no vídeo final de agradecimento 1 ou 2 semanas depois do final da campanha aqui no Indiegogo
Tudo o resto, 2 dias depois da tua contribuição
Condecorate me! Num mês depois do fim da campanha aqui no Indiegogo
Photo giveaway! Dia após dia durante a nossa aventura
Dress me up! Num mês depois do fim da campanha aqui no Indiegogo
Serenate myself! Durante e depois da viagem
Draw me! Máximo 1 mês depois do projecto terminar
Make me a VIP! 1 ou 2 semanas após a tua contribuição
Take me with you! Vamos avisar-te com 2 semanas de antecedência *

* para adquirires a prenda "Take me with you!" tens que viver ou conseguir ir até uma das seguintes cidades: Lisboa, Porto, Madrid, Barcelona, Monte Carlo, Roma, Dubrovnik, Zagreg, Budapeste, Viena, Praga, Cracóvia, Varsóvia, Riga, Tallinn, Vilnius, St Petersburg, Helsínquia, Estocolmo, Oslo, Copenhaga, Berlim, Amsterdão, Brugge, Londres, Paris, Genebra. Se vivires noutra cidade da Europa e quiseres muito esta pernda contacta-nos e convence-nos que a tua cidade seria ideal para este projecto e nós alteramos com todo o gosto a nossa rota!

Não percas a oportunidade de fazer parte deste projecto, ganhando a nossa eterna gratidão e já agora uma lembrança fantástica e única para ti!


Para fazemos isto acontecer, com tudo o que é necessário, precisamos de dinheiro. O objectivo está estabelecido no mínimo possível para que este projecto possa acontecer com tudo a que nos propomos.
Aqui podes ver a estimativa das despesas que precisamos de cobrir:

Item

Descrição

Valor
Aluger Autocaravana Média 120€ por dia nas datas que prevemos ir 12.000€
Combustível, Portagens e Ferrys 15.000 km! 3.900€
Campismo e comida Precisamos de dormir e comer 7.100€
Material multimédia 2 câmaras instântaneas e 5000 unidades papel 2.500€
Merchandising Decoração da autocaravana, roupa, 5000 molduras e 2200 autocolantes QR 1.500€
Prémios para artistas 250€ para cada artista, um por cidade 5.500€
Prendas (estimativas) T-Shirts, Fotos instantâneas, Molduras e despesas de envio 4.000€
Outros Internet, botijas de gás, seguros 1.900€

 

TOTAL

38.400€

Adicionando ao nosso total uma percentagem de 10% inicial para o "Moinho da Juventude" e considerando a comissão do IndieGoGo de 4% e taxa de transferência de 3% chegamos ao valor de 45.000€ que estamos a pedir!

É upa upa puxadote, mas com a tua ajuda estamos confiantes que vamos conseguir!

Estamos também a tentar contactar algumas marcas para obter algum tipo de patrocínio, quer monetário ou de material.
Por isso, mesmo que não atinjamos o nosso objectivo aqui no Indiegogo garantimos que todas as tuas prendas estão asseguradas caso levantemos o dinheiro aqui recolhido!
Com o dinheiro extra que ultrapasse o nosso objectivo vamos aumentar os prémios para os artistas de rua e conseguir doar mais dinheiro à Instituição de Solidariedade Social que seleccionámos.

Por isso, não hesites em contribuir mesmo já tendo alcançado o nosso objectivo!


Depois de recebermos a vossa ajuda iremos precisar aproximadamente de um mês para tratar de tudo antes de iniciarmos esta aventura. Estamos portanto a apontar para Abril que é uma altura excelente pois não é tão cara como a época do Verão e não existindo tantos turistas pela Europa faz com que a nossa ajuda faça mais sentido pois não conseguem angariar tanto dinheiro nesta altura. Assim, pensamos também conseguir encontrar os verdadeiros artistas de rua, que vivem da sua arte o ano inteiro!


Obrigado a todos desde já por toda a ajuda que puderem dar para iniciar esta aventura. Quem não poder contribuir com dinheiro pedimos que divulguem o projecto a todos os vossos amigos epartilhem no vosso Facebook, já será uma grande ajuda para nós!
Com os melhores cumprimentos para todos e esperemos que tenham gostado e entusiasmados com o nosso projecto e que nos ajudem a ter a viagem das nossas vidas enquanto ajudamos outros e promovemos arte e cultura por toda a Europa.

Obrigado!

Guilherme Duarte
Ivo Tavares
João Mendes
Email: hello.europe.project@gmail.com

Obrigado a todos | Socializa connosco e sabe mais sobre o Hello Europe!

Hello Europe | 2013
story_txt:
This campaign was moved! If you want to know more go here and discover all the news and perks we have for you!!!
Esta campanha foi movida! Se queres saber mais vai aqui e descobre todas as novidades e prendas que temos para ti!!!









Clica aqui para a versão em Português









1. Who are we?2. Our Project3. How?4. How to attract and interact?5. The Special Appearences6. Social Support & Responsibility7. Portugal8. Goal, Budget & Expenses 9. When?10. Perks11. Thank you all!







- Guilherme, 28 years old, Software Engineer.  - Ivo, 29 years old, Chef.  - João, 28 years old, Product Designer.

But that doesn't answer to the question. We are not our names, age our job, we are what moves and what drives us. We are three old friends from Lisbon, Portugal, who want to do something different. We have known each other for more than 25 years now and we share a lot of interests like traveling, capturing moments and emotions on photographs and film, meeting new people and sharing our stories. And with that we want to embark on amazing adventure and create chain of emotions to help others.

To travel around Europe for 100 days in an RV, visiting more than 20 countries with a main goal: find the best street artists of each city we stop by, helping them out by giving some visibility and spread out the word about how amazing they are. The best in each city will receive a prize from our hands! 

This is our project! This is Hello Europe! Everything starts with hello, and we want that word to be a metaphor of the moments we experience and the word we say the most, every day, to all the people we meet!


How are we going to pull this off and interact with you and all the people who join us in this adventure?  We will use the social media, of course. We have a Facebook page integrated with Twitter, Blogger and a YouTube channel. You won’t be a mere spectator! You will interact!
And how's that?

You will choose the best buskers. We will upload a video with a small performance and interview of the best 3 artists we select from each city. Before we continue our journey the artist with more likes from our followers gets the prize and more visibility! We will repeat this process in checkpoint of our journey, extending our help to more artists and creating cool and artistic content for everybody to listen, see and most of all feel!

We want to get everyone's attention to our social media platforms where everything is going to happen for you to see. The adventure, and the videos, photos and interviews of the best street performers. So here are some simple ideas to achieve our goal:

We are going to have a customized RV, Id Cards and clothing with our logos and also distribute leaflets to encourage people to see our project, give their contribution if they want or follow us in the adventure;



We will have a giveaway of instant photos to random people in the streets of each city (5000 photos in total) and encourage them to post a photo holding the picture they got from us on our Facebook page. Then all they have to do is get their friends to like the photo. In the end of our journey the photos with the most likes will get gifts too. The photo will be handed with a special frame holder (click the photos bellow to see a video explaining our idea);



We are going to promote treasure hunts in each city. How? 100 QR codes will be placed in each city with links to our Facebook page. And here is the twist: one of them will get you to a winner's page. The first person to get there will win the prize (click here to see a video explaining our idea);
In each city we will set up a day, hour and place for everyone to meet us up, take some pictures with us, to be posted on Facebook, and also get some instant photos for free!
In the end of our trip we will make a draw to give gifts to our followers;

You can click on each photo to see images and videos about the initiatives!


We have contacted Portuguese celebrities to work with us and help us spread out the word and give visibility to our idea. We are proud to say that we already have the full support of Nuno Norte, the winner of the Portuguese Idol (1st edition). He has now a solid career in music and guess what (…?) he was a street musician for many years before going to the show.  We also have the support from Valete, one of the most eloquent and influent Portuguese Rappers, and as Hip Hop has grown to having a steady cultural ground, we wanted to have some representation from that area, getting closer to people.  Additionally, André Nunes, a well-known actor from Portuguese TV and Stages, mainly know by its great sense of humor and comical roles. Another one is the comedians/musicians duo Homens da Luta, a great TV phenomenon. They base their act mainly on street sketches getting people off guard, and firmly sustain an image of righteousness and voice to the people. The role of the sponsors will be simple, but of the utmost importance:

Share and give project visibility through their contacts;
Star on promotional photos and videos to help spread out the word;
Share contacts with us and call other artists to help;
Give simple gifts as autographed Cd's and ticket shows to give our followers.

You can click on each photo and see the great promotional videos with them:

We will update this section and post photos and videos as we gather the support of more artists too!

Besides the street artists, we also want to give our contribution to a Social Solidarity Institution.  We selected the non-profit organization called "Moinho da Juventude" (Youth Mill).

We chose this Organization for two main reasons:

Because they provide an essential care to one of the toughest neighborhoods in Portugal where around 8 thousand people live in, providing day care to all the children and trying to give a purpose in the life of hundreds of youngsters through education, art and culture to give them an opportunity outside of the streets and delinquent life.
Because they are our neighbors and we want to help locally and with impact, trying to improve our community and give something back.

You can know more about their amazing mission here. We are going to donate them 10% of the money raised here and we have a place on our Blog and Facebook page where people can make donations. That money will be converted to formation, material and services and the more money we raise here, the more we’ll be able to help them too!

We want to give a small share to our country in this time of crisis. Thus, we have simple ideas so people can know more about our amazing country and its 900 years of history.


In the end, our trip will carry with visiting Portuguese cities where we want to show all our followers how amazing they are and how a great place to visit Portugal is;
Show all the great Portuguese gastronomy by selecting the best Portuguese restaurants in the cities we visit and giving them the visibility we can;
Show that Portuguese are great people, with initiative and creativity and that the spirit of adventure didn’t end at the time of the Discoveries;
Help promote some typical Portuguese products around Europe.

And if everything goes according to plan you will feel an urge to visit us here in Portugal!

For all this to happen we need your contribution, and because we don't like to ask for things without giving anything in return, in addition to our gratitude we set some cool perks for you which you can check out here on the right side of your screen! --->As you can see in each Perk tier you get all the Perks from the previous tiers!
With the perk "Dress me up!" you win the Hello Europe Super Special T-shirt and here you can see some examples of the designs and colors you can choose from:


When you receive the T-Shirt don't forget to send us a picture of you wearing it so we can post it on our Facebook Hall of Fame so everybody can see you are made this project possible! Show all your friends and get them to like your photo so you can be eligible to other cool gifts in the end of our journey!
With the perk "Condecorate me!" you'll be condecorated by your help with a great Hello Europe Badge. You can pick the color and design. See some examples:

With the perk "Photo Giveaway!" besides the access to the best photos in HD + Photoshop treatment royalty free for you to use, you also receive at your mail an instant photo of us with a very special frame and a personalized thank you note.

With this perk you also can be eligible for another gift and all you need to do is take a picture of yourself holding the perk you received and sent it to us or post it on our Facebook page. Then get your friends to like it and 1 like = 1 vote. In the end of the adventure, prizes for the most liked photos!
Depending on the perk the expected date of delivery to you is the following:




Perk Name




Estimated Delivery




Thank me!!

* to buy the "Take me with you!" perk you have to live or go to one of the following cities: Madrid, Barcelona, Monte Carlo, Rome, Dubrovnik, Zagreg, Budapest, Vienne, Prague, Krakow, Warsaw, Riga, Tallinn, Vilnius, St Petersburg, Helsinki, Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen, Berlin, Amsterdam, Brugge, London, Paris, Geneve, Oporto, Lisbon. If you live elsewhere in Europe and really want this perk contact us and convince us that your city would be amazing for this project and we will change or route!
So don't miss out this opportunity to make part of our project, earning our eternal gratitude plus a cool and unique perk for you!

To make this happen, with all that comes with it, we need money. The goal we set is the minimum to make this project happens with all that comes to it.  Here you can see the estimation of the expenses we need to cover:

On top of this value we want to start with a 10% contribution to the non-profit organization "Moinho da Juventude" and considering the IndieGoGo fee of 4% and 3% for credit card processing applied to our total, we are setting our goal to 45.000€.
It’s quite a lot but you all your help we are confident we can achieve it!
We are also trying to contact some brands to see if we can get any sponsors that help us with money or goods. So even if we don’t reach our goal here in Indiegogo we assure you that you will get all your Perks! With the extra money that surpasses our goal we will be able to increase the street artist prizes and donate more money to the selected non-profit organization.So don’t hesitate to give your contribution even if we had already reached our goal!

After we receive your help and reach our goal we will need one month to take off, so we are thinking of starting our adventure in April. It’s a great time to go because it’s cheaper than in the summer peak season, there are less tourists and the street artists raise less money. We also believe that in this time of the year we will encounter the true street performers who make a living out of it all year long.
Thank you in advance for all the help you can give to launch this idea. If you can’t contribute with money, please spread out the word to all of your friends and share this on Facebook. It will be a great help for us! Best regards and hope you like our project and help us have the trip of our lives while helping others and promoting art and culture around Europe.
Thank you!





Guilherme Duarte


Ivo Tavares


João Mendes




Email: hello.europe.project@gmail.com









Thank you all | Socialize with us and know more about Hello Europe!










 
 







Versão Portuguesa







1. Quem somos?2. O nosso Projecto3. Como?4. Como divulgar e interagir?5. Os Padrinhos6. Responsabilidade Social7. Portugal8. Objectivo, Orçamento e Despesas9. Quando?10. Prendas!11. Obrigado a todos!







- Guilherme, 28 anos, Engenheiro Informático. - Ivo, 29 anos, Chef. - João, 28 anos, Designer de Produto.

Isto não responde à pergunta. Isto são os nossos nomes, a nossa profissão e a nossa idade. Não define quem somos. O que define quem somos são os nossos valores, a nossa visão e a nossa missão. Somos de Lisboa, Portugal, e conhecemo-nos há mais de 25 anos e temos muitos interesses em comum tais como viajar, capturar momentos e emoções em fotografia e filme, conhecer novas pessoas e partilhar as nossas histórias. E com esses interesses queremos embarcar numa aventura fantástica onde pretendemos criar uma cadeia de emoções e ajudar outros.
Viajar pela Europa durante 100 dias numa autocaravana, por mais de 20 países com um objectivo principal: encontrar os melhores artistas de rua de cada cidade que visitarmos. Ajudá-los, dando-lhes visibilidade e exposição para divulgar a sua fantástica arte.O melhor de cada cidade receberá um prémio das nossas mãos!

Este é o nosso projecto! Este é o Hello Europe! Tudo começa com um olá, queremos que essa palavra seja metafórica a todos os momentos que experienciarmos e a palavra que vamos dizer mais vezes todos os dias a todas as pessoas que conhecermos e partilharmos a nossa história.

Como é que isto vai funcionar e como vamos interagir contigo e com todos os que nos acompanharem nesta aventura? Vamos utilizar as redes sociais, claro! Temos uma página de Facebook, integrada com Twitter, Blogger e canal de Youtube e tu não serás um mero espectador. Vais interagir!
Com dúvidas ainda? Continua a ler...

Vais escolher os melhores artistas de rua! Vamos colocar um vídeo com uma pequena actuação e entrevista dos 3 melhores artistas de rua que encontrarmos em cada cidade. A antes de seguirmos viagem o artista com mais likes dos nossos seguidores receberá um prémio e mais visibilidade!Vamos repetir este processo para todas as cidades visitadas, estendendo assim o nosso contributo a mais artistas, criando conteúdo fantástico e artístico para que todos possam ver, ouvir e principalmente sentir!
Queremos atrair todas as pessoas que conseguirmos para as nossas plataformas de Social Media onde vamos colocar toda a nossa aventura, os vídeos, fotos e entrevistas dos melhores artistas de rua. Podes ver aqui algumas das iniciativas que temos pensadas para atrair o máximo de visibilidade e de interacção com todos:

Vamos ter uma caravana personalizada e andar identificados com cartões e roupa com os nossos logos e também vamos distribuir flyers para encorajar as pessoas a verem o nosso projecto, darem a sua contribuição se quiserem ou apenas colocarem seguirem-nos nesta aventura;



Vamos oferecer fotografias instantâneas a pessoas aleatórias nas ruas de cada cidade (5000 no total) e vamos encorajá-las a colocarem uma foto delas com a que receberam de nós na nossa página do Facebook. Depois poderão incentivar os amigos a colocarem um like nessa foto e na nossa página também. No fim as fotos com mais likes receberão também prémios. A foto será entregue numa moldura bem especial! (Clica na foto para veres um vídeo que exemplifica o processo);



Vamos promover uma caça ao tesouro em cada cidade. Como? Vamos colocar 100 QR codes por cidade que reencaminham para a nossa página de Facebook. E aqui há uma surpresa: um desses códigos levará para uma página especial premiada. A primeira pessoa a descobrir ganhará um prémio! (clica aqui para veres um vídeo onde explicamos melhor a nossa ideia);
Vamos querer que participem pessoalmente e se encontrem connosco. Em cada cidade vamos marcar um dia, hora e local onde toda a gente pode aparecer, tirar algumas fotos connosco para aparecerem no Facebook e ainda receber algumas fotos instantâneas como oferta!
No fim da nossa viagem vamos fazer um sorteio de um presente entre todos os nossos seguidores.

Clica em cada uma das fotos para saberes mais sobre cada uma das iniciativas!

Queremos que pessoas do mundo do espectáculo apadrinhem a nossa ideia e nos ajudem a divulgar o nosso projecto. Temos orgulho em ter já um padrinho e total apoio do Nuno Norte, vencedor da primeira edição do Ídolos em 2004. Agora com uma carreira sólida na música foi em tempos músico de rua antes de se dar a conhecer no concurso.  Contamos também com o apoio do Valete, um dos mais influentes rappers portugueses e sendo que o Hip Hop nasce nas ruas fez todo o sentido para nós termos um representante dessa área. Outro dos padrinhos é o André Nunes, uma cara bem conhecida da nossa TV e teatro principalmente pelo seu bom sentido de humor e papéis cómicos! Contamos também com o apoio dos "Homens da Luta" que nos vão ajudar a dar também visibilidade para irmos fazer a luta por essa Europa fora! O papel de quem nos apadrinha será simples mas de grande importância:

Partilhar e divulgar o projecto através dos seus contactos;
Participar em fotos e vídeos promocionais para ajudar a espalhar a notícia;
Partilhar contactos connosco e chamar outros artistas para participarem;
Oferecer presentes simples tais como cds autografados e bilhetes para espectáculos para podermos sortear pelos nossos seguidores.

Clica em cada uma das fotos em baixo para veres os vídeos que fizemos com eles!

Vamos actualizando esta secção e colocando fotos e vídeos à medida que formos conseguindo mais padrinhos e madrinhas para o nosso projecto!

Para além dos artistas de rua, queremos dar o nosso contributo a uma Instituição de Solidariedade Social. Seleccionamos a organização sem fins lucrativos "Moinho da Juventude".

Escolhemos esta organização por duas razões principais:

Pela sua fantástica missão que assegura cuidados essenciais num dos bairros mais problemáticos de Portugal, onde mais de 8 mil pessoas vivem, providenciando infantário para muitas crianças do bairro e dando um propósito de vida a centenas de jovens através da educação, arte e cultura para lhes dar uma oportunidade fora das ruas e de uma vida delinquente.
Por eles serem nossos vizinhos e nos ser uma realidade muito próxima. Queremos assim ajudar localmente e com impacto tentando dar o nosso contributo à nossa comunidade.

Podes saber mais sobre a sua fantástica missão e história de mais de 25 anos aqui. Temos uma percentagem de 10% sobre o dinheiro angariado aqui que lhes iremos doar e temos também um local no nosso Blogue e Facebook onde todos lhes podem doar dinheiro, dinheiro esse que converteremos em formação, material e obras e quanto mais angariarmos aqui mais os conseguiremos ajudar!
Queremos fazer a nossa parte pelo nosso país neste tempo de crise. Para isso temos ideias simples para que as pessoas fiquem a conhecer o nosso fantástico cantinho da Europa e os seus 900 anos de história:


No fim da nossa viagem vamos visitar cidades portuguesas para mostrar a todos os seguidores que fomos angariando o quão fantástico é o nosso Portugal;
Mostrar a nossa fantástica gastronomia descobrindo os melhores restaurantes Portugueses pela Europa e dando-lhes a visibilidade merecida;
Mostrar que os portugueses são pessoas fantásticas, com iniciativa e criatividade e que o espírito de aventura não acabou na época dos Descobrimentos;
Ajudar a divulgar produtos típicos portugueses lá fora.

E se tudo correr como planeado no fim vais ver o teu amor por Portugal reforçado!
Para tudo isto ser possível precisamos do teu contributo! E como não gostamos de pedir sem dar nada em troca, para além da nossa gratidão e de fazeres parte de um projecto diferente, temos prendas para ti que podes ver aqui no lado direito do teu ecrã! --->Como podes ver em cada nível estás adquirir todas as prendas dos níveis anteriores!
Na prenda "Dress me up!" recebes a T-Shirt Super Impecável Hello Europe com todas as cores e desenhos que temos à tua escolha:


Quando receberes a T-Shirt não te esqueças de nos enviar uma fotografia tua com ela vestida para a podermos colocar no nosso Quadro de Honra no Facebook para que todos possam ver que tornaste este projecto possível! Mostra a todos os teus amigos e diz-lhes para gostarem da tua foto e ficas assim habilitado a mais prémios fantásticos no fim da nossa aventura!
Com a prenda "Condecorate me!" serás condecorado pela tua ajuda com um fantástico crachá. Podes escolher a cor e o desenho que gostas mais. Vê aqui alguns exemplos:

Com a prenda "See All!" recebes no teu correio uma foto instantânea nossa com uma moldura especial e um agradecimento personalizado.

Com esta prenda podes ainda habilitar-te a mais prémios, para isso basta tirares uma fotografia tua em que mostras a prenda que recebeste e envia-nos ou coloca no nosso mural do Facebook. Chama os teus amigos para gostarem da foto e 1 like = 1 voto. No fim da nossa viagem as fotos mais votadas terão prémios!
Dependendo da prenda que escolheste a data prevista para entrega é a seguinte:




Perk Name




Estimated Delivery




Thank me!

Créditos no vídeo final de agradecimento 1 ou 2 semanas depois do final da campanha aqui no Indiegogo Tudo o resto, 2 dias depois da tua contribuição



Condecorate me!
Num mês depois do fim da campanha aqui no Indiegogo


Photo giveaway!
Dia após dia durante a nossa aventura


Dress me up!
Num mês depois do fim da campanha aqui no Indiegogo


Serenate myself!
Durante e depois da viagem


Draw me!
Máximo 1 mês depois do projecto terminar


Make me a VIP!
1 ou 2 semanas após a tua contribuição


Take me with you!
Vamos avisar-te com 2 semanas de antecedência *


* para adquirires a prenda "Take me with you!" tens que viver ou conseguir ir até uma das seguintes cidades: Lisboa, Porto, Madrid, Barcelona, Monte Carlo, Roma, Dubrovnik, Zagreg, Budapeste, Viena, Praga, Cracóvia, Varsóvia, Riga, Tallinn, Vilnius, St Petersburg, Helsínquia, Estocolmo, Oslo, Copenhaga, Berlim, Amsterdão, Brugge, Londres, Paris, Genebra. Se vivires noutra cidade da Europa e quiseres muito esta pernda contacta-nos e convence-nos que a tua cidade seria ideal para este projecto e nós alteramos com todo o gosto a nossa rota!
Não percas a oportunidade de fazer parte deste projecto, ganhando a nossa eterna gratidão e já agora uma lembrança fantástica e única para ti!

Para fazemos isto acontecer, com tudo o que é necessário, precisamos de dinheiro. O objectivo está estabelecido no mínimo possível para que este projecto possa acontecer com tudo a que nos propomos. Aqui podes ver a estimativa das despesas que precisamos de cobrir:





Item




Descrição




Valor




Aluger Autocaravana
Média 120€ por dia nas datas que prevemos ir
12.000€


Combustível, Portagens e Ferrys
15.000 km!
3.900€


Campismo e comida
Precisamos de dormir e comer
7.100€


Material multimédia
2 câmaras instântaneas e 5000 unidades papel
2.500€


Merchandising
Decoração da autocaravana, roupa, 5000 molduras e 2200 autocolantes QR
1.500€


Prémios para artistas
250€ para cada artista, um por cidade
5.500€


Prendas (estimativas)
T-Shirts, Fotos instantâneas, Molduras e despesas de envio
4.000€


Outros
Internet, botijas de gás, seguros
1.900€



 


TOTAL


38.400€




Adicionando ao nosso total uma percentagem de 10% inicial para o "Moinho da Juventude" e considerando a comissão do IndieGoGo de 4% e taxa de transferência de 3% chegamos ao valor de 45.000€ que estamos a pedir!
É upa upa puxadote, mas com a tua ajuda estamos confiantes que vamos conseguir!
Estamos também a tentar contactar algumas marcas para obter algum tipo de patrocínio, quer monetário ou de material. Por isso, mesmo que não atinjamos o nosso objectivo aqui no Indiegogo garantimos que todas as tuas prendas estão asseguradas caso levantemos o dinheiro aqui recolhido! Com o dinheiro extra que ultrapasse o nosso objectivo vamos aumentar os prémios para os artistas de rua e conseguir doar mais dinheiro à Instituição de Solidariedade Social que seleccionámos. Por isso, não hesites em contribuir mesmo já tendo alcançado o nosso objectivo!

Depois de recebermos a vossa ajuda iremos precisar aproximadamente de um mês para tratar de tudo antes de iniciarmos esta aventura. Estamos portanto a apontar para Abril que é uma altura excelente pois não é tão cara como a época do Verão e não existindo tantos turistas pela Europa faz com que a nossa ajuda faça mais sentido pois não conseguem angariar tanto dinheiro nesta altura. Assim, pensamos também conseguir encontrar os verdadeiros artistas de rua, que vivem da sua arte o ano inteiro!

Obrigado a todos desde já por toda a ajuda que puderem dar para iniciar esta aventura. Quem não poder contribuir com dinheiro pedimos que divulguem o projecto a todos os vossos amigos epartilhem no vosso Facebook, já será uma grande ajuda para nós! Com os melhores cumprimentos para todos e esperemos que tenham gostado e entusiasmados com o nosso projecto e que nos ajudem a ter a viagem das nossas vidas enquanto ajudamos outros e promovemos arte e cultura por toda a Europa.
Obrigado!





Guilherme Duarte


Ivo Tavares


João Mendes




Email: hello.europe.project@gmail.com












Obrigado a todos | Socializa connosco e sabe mais sobre o Hello Europe!










 
 







Hello Europe | 2013

story:
About us

Art Metropole is a non-profit organization founded by artist collective General Idea in 1974. It fosters and facilitates dynamic structures of artist-initiated publication in any media, especially innovative formats predisposed to sharing and circulation. 


The Space

AM opened its new shop locale at 1490 Dundas Street West, in downtown Toronto, on 01 August 2012. After 25 years in a hidden walk-up location, the new storefront is accessible, allows for chance encounters and is situated in a neighbourhood where many of the artists that AM collaborates with or represents are based. In the short time that we have been open, we have had a noticeable increase in attendance at events and exhibition projects. While the shop is a spot for the circulation of information and materials, AM also works from the specifications of the actual space to refine the mechanisms of the shop.


The Window

For the transformation of the new street front location, a special emphasis has been put on the window area. Consisting of large storefront windows, a stage-display-seating-podium and two walls, this space can accommodate a multiplicity of projects and events by local and international contributors. 

Our Indiegogo page is dedicated to support these Window Projects, which alternate monthly.

Your pledge will help us pay for the material and production costs of this window exhibition series as well as paying the contributors for their hard work and dedication. With your help, Art Metropole will be able to continue to make its window a unique and accessible space for the production and dissemination of art through new forms of display: Here on the street, in this moment, towards the future!

Moving in, May 2012

Robin Cameron: T-R-U-T-H,  June 2012 

VsVsVs Moves In, October 2012 

Tracy Ma: BLOG, October 2012 

AM satellite window installation, December 2012 

Hazel  Meyer : No Theory No Cry, February 2013

There's more to life than books, but not much more, May 2013

Nearness, May 2013

Palimpsest: What Do We Do Now Now We Wait,  June 2013 

Nieves Zine Library + Innen Shop, August 2013


The Sign

This September, AM's window space acts as an extension of our newly installed street sign designed by Toronto artist Jesse Harris. The sign is a mirror reflecting the community and neighbourhood surrounding us in our new location.



September 2013: Jesse Harris, Sign as Mirror > Mirror as Sign

Jesse Harris'  Window Project, opening Sept. 4th, will feature a new banner to be displayed for the month accompanied by a matching poster series and back patches designed especially for Art Metropole. The printed poster will be available free of charge as well as a downloadable .pdf file here:

http://www.artmetropole.com/download/Peace_Work_Poster_Printable.pdf


Banner and poster image by Jesse Harris


Backpatch for Art Metropole, 12 x 14", screen print on primed canvas, 2013, Edition of 15 + 2 A.P.


The Perks!

Zines Set

Along with the free poster, we have a set of zines by Jesse Harris available featuring: How To Look Punk; Idyeahs #3; and Jesse Wars Here; for $20.


Poster Edition

Earlier this year, Art Metropole published a poster series with Bernadette Corporation, Claire Fontaine and Masanao Hirayama. These limited edition posters are silkscreened on reflective mylar in a signed and numbered edition of 45 + 5 AP. They are also available as a litho print 'street' version on paper in an unsigned edition of 250 available for $15/copy or $35/set in our shop or on our website. This mylar edition 'mirrors' our new sign. 


Ceiling Tiles

For $250 or $500, you can adopt a ceiling tile in our new space. The tile will be inscribed with your name, reflecting the signage outside and our invaluable community of supporters. 

White tiles are available at $250 and mirrored tiles at $500


And last but not least...

The Banner

Hand-painted banner, gesso on canvas, 88" x 64.5"

story:
Chuanita Diary

How do we, urban animals of the 21st century, relate to other animals? Whatever the relationship, the dominant idea is that man is a superior species. However, increasingly it appears that we have abused our position as ‘top species’. What can we learn if we really try to listen to, collaborate with or put ourselves in the animals’ place? And how can we use these insights, to our benefit too, to build a more acceptable and sustainable future? [source: KAAI THEATER catalogue 03/2013]

*

The project comprises many approaches to the topic of animals, but also to the medium of photography itself. In my research I document and collect material about animals being humanized by different societies around the world. The final work will take the form of installation and publication – offering the many possible faces and roles embedded within the image material. Another aspect of this process involves virtually sending images taken or chosen for the project to my little niece Chuanita when I am not able to communicate with people. It is some kind of non-verbal answer to her questions: why do I have to travel? What am I searching for?

I find this combination of approaches very inspiring and surprising, due to the huge gap between nature and subsequent documentation of it. In essence, it speaks to the idea that the reality of the world around us is never a given, it is something we have to create.


--

Book will be published in October 2013.

story:
UPDATE... Today I was contacted about participating in the Grand Marché de Noel de Créateurs!   I really want to do it and the booth fee is a little more than I anticipated, (220€) so I'm hoping that with the time left on this campaign I can exceed my goal.  (We can't revise our goal once we launch the campaign).  Thanks so much to everyone and I hope that you all enjoy your Polyflavour perks !!!


In 2011 I started making jewelry inspired by old cartoons and comics from the 1920s, 30s and 40s.  There's so much about the drawings from that time that fascinates me.  I love making things inspired by those images that people can wear and display and share.  I'm especially interested in off-model merchandise from this time and I consider what I make to be in the off-model spirit.  I want people to know the source of my inspiration and to look it and and enjoy it and learn more about it and hopefully share my fascination.  I want people to love their Polyflavour wares forever.

The goal of this campaign is to raise enough money for the materials and accoutrements that I need to participate a craft show this holiday season and to sell my work wholesale.  If this campaign is successful, I will have everything I need to reach a bigger audience.

In order to do this, I need:

polymer clay and supplies (findings such as metal chains, wires, magnets, barrette bases, bracelet bases, ring bases, button bases, etc.) to create stock for each design that I will include in a line sheet for retailers.

a dremel and bits for bowls  I currently sand all of my pieces by hand which can take several hours for bracelets and several days for a large bowl or box; and I know that a machine would speed up the production of my work a great deal.


material for a stand including standing frames for photos, jewelry displays, lighting and other things to decorate my stand for craft shows

printed materials including post cards and business cards, packaging for retail stores, gift boxes, line sheets and a look book

I set my goal at the amount that I will need to make 25 of every piece in my collection and to make larger pieces such as bowls and boxes without worrying about running out of the color polymer clay that I'm using for a pattern or design.  There can be a great deal of trial and error when making polymer clay canes and it would be amazing to have the freedom to try patterns that might not go exactly as planned. (I use scraps for the bases of large pieces so nothing is ever wasted).

Earrings
Choose 2 pairs of earrings from the 9 designs pictured here.  The ear wires are made from surgical steel.



Fight Cloud Bowl
This bowl is made entirely from polymer clay with a black, white and silver interior and crazy grins and zany eyes on the exterior in primary colors.


Here's the bowl upside down.


Brooches
Manic Felix or troubled monkey-mouse face with starry backgrounds, approximately 35mm in diameter, and Flip the frog with a stripey background, 27mm wide.


Refrigerator Magnets
Right and left gloved hand, flip the frog's face, and 2 versions of mouse shorts.


Ball Pendants
I have hell's bells devil, mouse shorts, nancy, flip the frog, troubled mouse, creep rat, (from kaz's underworld comics) and secret society leader.






Bracelets


Yelly Mouth Barrettes
Candy colored french style barettes, 60mm long. 



40mm Barrettes
Messed up nancy, felix and his hallucination with stars, or bimbo and the secret society members

Fight Cloud Barrette
This one is 95mm x 55mm

story:
Al Davison: a.k.a The Astral Gypsy

One morning in 1988 I woke up to find I'd gone blind. At the time I had no idea that it was temporary. I just knew that along with the blindness I was losing my visual memory, the ability to visualize my family's faces, even simple shapes, and that the partial paralysis I'd had as a result of being born with Spina-Bifida had returned.
I was blind for three months on two occasions that year. My reaction to my visual memory fading was to continue to draw, even though I had no idea if the pen contained ink or whether the paper was blank or not. When my sight returned I began to analyze the drawings I'd produced, and what I'd leaned about tapping into the unconscious, perception, dreams, and drawing. I have been teaching art based on that knowledge for over twenty years.


The book, the workshop and the Exhibition

Now seems like a good time to put all this on paper. But a typical 'how to draw' book doesn't seem appropriate, given the subject. The process of creating the book should embody the techniques I've developed. So what we have now is part autobiography part 'how to draw' and part dream showcase. I've taught everyone from school children to senior art students, from dream researchers to teenagers at risk and abuse survivors. I plan to launch the book with an exhibition and a workshop. I hope it will become a tool that others can also use to develop alternate approaches to the nurturing of creativity.


The art of the book and how you can help

We are committed to the idea of the book as an art object in itself, as well as the book as a medium for reaching as many people as possible, our project combines both. We want to produce a limited edition collectors item. 200 hardback copies with a quarter cloth spine, cover litho printed with vegetable oil based ink, interiors printed in high quality digital, in a an outsized format 31cm x 22cm printed by Calverts containing an original black and white drawing in each copy and priced at $49.00 All the proceeds of the limited edition will then used to print an affordable trade paperback edition. Our Indigogo campaign last year raised $3,096.00 We still need a further $3500.00. We aim to launch the limited edition at Kapow in May.

So what happens if we don't meet the target? well, if the money raised isn't enough to create the deluxe edition but is enough to produce the trade paperback then we will do that, and contributors will receive a copy of that plus artwork to the value of their contribution. If we fail to raise enough for even the trade edition, the money will go into a pot until we can explore other funding opportunities. Contributors will receive artwork to the value of their contribution anything from a pencil sketch to a archival art print to a full color acrylic painting. Should we reach our goal, and have money left over after printing the trade edition, that money will go towards equipment to help run art courses for young people in Coventry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially you can still help, if this project captures your imagination then put the word out, tell your friends send links to the campaign out with all your e-mails, it all helps. Thank you.

story:
Help me raise funds for UNICEF

I'm Glyn Macey, a British artist and serial fundraiser. I'm pretty well known for my work in the U.K. with organisations such as RNLI and National Trust.

I love to get as many people involved with my projects as possible and over the last 3 years, with the help of many beautiful people around the world have managed to raise over £40,000 ($65,000) for some great causes.

Well, next up I am crossing the pond to paint my way across the USA, and the resulting 100 original studies will be auctioned to help fund the vital work of UNICEF.

This is where I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

In a nutshell I need to raise $4,900 to cover travel costs and fuel, and in return I have a delectable range of juicy goodies for you including Limited Editions, Original Drawings, Books, DVD's and Vouchers...

And if I don't reach my goal?

Well, I'm going to do the project anyway, but it's much more fun for me to have you guys involved too!

Oh, nearly forgot, the whole trip is being filmed for DVD and television, and if you can help, you could even find your name in the credits!

In fact, if you're up for it, I'll even fly you to LA to join me painting at Mulholland Drive!

UNICEF

My goal is to paint 100 original studies whilst traveling from Chicago to Los Angeles, every one of which will be auctioned for UNICEF.

My last road trip saw me travel and paint the whole of the English Coast, the resulting works raised the RNLI (lifeboats) over £24,000 ($38,000).

To find out more about me and my work check out www.glynmacey.com or simply google 'glyn macey'

To find out more about the vital work of UNICEF check www.unicef.org 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you could share this project with your friends, I will love you forever :)

story:
My name is nixie. I'm a young aspiring artist working to expand my horizons.

Photography is my primary art form. I LOVE photography. Photos of prop manipulators, children, bands, carnivals, performers, marches, models,  protests, portraits, animals, fashion, plants, sports. I love it all.
So one of the most exciting places for me to be taking photos are festivals.
 
For years I've been asked if I've ever been to Shambhala music festival in Salmo BC, and when I've said no people have been appalled.
"But you're MADE for Shambha-love!" they say.
Up until this year, though, I've not felt prepared. Emotionally, mentally nor physically.  From what I can tell about Shambhala, while being a very open, loving, fun environment, it is a very busy, tiring, overwhelming one as well.
I'm ready now, though.
I've toured with an Edmonton band over Northern Alberta and BC, marched in countless protests, Lived in 3 of Canada's provinces, sacrificed having a home for my art, cared for small children, moshed in crazy moshpits, worked with the carnival..

And now, I've even got a mentor helping me learn, willing to take me to Shambhala to show me around and keep me sane in the ocean of awesome.

So what I'm asking is for some financial help. I'm currently in BC honing my skills, working on my photography. But my funds are verrryyyy limited.
While I've got a friend willing to take me to Shambhala, it's very last minute and I'm not financially prepared.
I need money for things like gas, camping supplies, food, the ferry ride off the island, and various photography type things.
 
I won't bore you with the exact equipment I'm still lacking, but know that any few dollars you are able to donate will help me get to Shambhala, stay fed, and get home safe.
Your donation will allow me to continue doing what I love, and support not only my artistic endeavours but the endeavours of the community in Shambhala, and Edmonton as well.
 
Please help.
<3

story:
Summary
 
The foundation of the Grand Midway Hotel is in serious need of repairs. A few friends have generously offered to complete the needed repairs at a fraction of the cost that a contractor would quote – they have asked only that materials be paid for. The materials come to around $3000.00, which we are hoping to raise with this campaign.
 
The gentlemen who have offered to complete these repairs are more than qualified to do so (a nuclear engineer and a solar engineer by trade). 23 support posts will be installed in the foundation, along with other structural work and repair.
 
Blair Murphy and The Grand Midway Hotel are an important part of our lives, and if you are reading this, chances are they’ve played a role in yours as well. Without Blair and the Midway we would not have Kerouac Fest, we would not have DraculaCon, we would not have Chattering Bones, we would not have the Wednesday night coffee shops or any of the other plethora of amazing events that occur there every year. More than that, though, we would not have the man and the space that have brought us all together and made a big family/tribe of us. These repairs may be the difference between having the Midway with us or not in the next few years. 
 
We all like to talk about how much we love each other, how much we love Blair, how much we love the hotel. Let’s show that now by preserving the place that has given so much to us and asked so little in return.
 
Any amount is helpful!
 
Other ways to help

If you cannot give monetary assistance (many of us are starving artists), there are definitely other ways you can help! Please do pass along the link to this campaign, though we would prefer if you do so privately as we don't wish to push the monetary aspect of these repairs on Blair. 
 
Also, when the time does come to complete the repairs, we may very well need some manual labor. Someone's got to dig 23 holes.

story:
My name is Joelle Circé and I’m a Queer woman artist. I began drawing as a young child and never looked back really. Back in the early 1980’s, I studied traditional drawing and oil painting techniques for about four years in Montreal, Quebec Canada.  I have participated in a few Women’s Art Festivals and shows as well as having my paintings showcased in a duo exhibition at the Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art in Soho NY for a few months just recently. I am an emerging artist who is becoming know for her women and centered art.

 

You can view my  art, resumé and Artist Statement on my Official website at: http://www.circesart.com

 

Imagine an art exhibition dedicated to the celebration and exploration of Queer women and their lives, this is what I'm working on and I know I'll see it through and that it will be something of a first. I’m doing this campaign in order to get that extra push I think is needed to fullfill this project that I have already begun and which consists of creating a series devoted to Queer women and their lives and that I now wish to see exhibited in the context of the Toronto International Pride Event which is coming for June 2014. In oder to accomplish this, I will need to produce some 20+ paintings, above and beyond what I already have created to date. Of course,no matter the outcome of this fundraising effort, I will push forward and find a way of making this unique exhibition celebrating and exploring queer Women's lives a reality.

 

Because I create paintings that deal with women’s lives and issues and often with queer life as well as some erotic art, this project is a big step for me as an artist because it reaches directly into the LGBT / Queer / Women communities at a time when there will be just about the largest ever Pride event held in Toronto, it can and will be a huge platform to promote and have my art known in this niche. 

 

Your support and donations will definitely help me achieve a greater presence in the women’s and LGBT/Queer art circles and communities and that is something important to me.

Every bit helps.  For ten dollars or more, I thank you deeply for that. Your name will be mentioned in my thanks! I feel the support in the gesture more than you know.

If I can raise the full campaign amount, this funding will pay for many things in my studio for a while and so help me keep producing the art. Any extra will carry me further on, the funds will be used to buy supplies, and be put toward my transportation and costs around me working from my studio. 

It's always tricky to sell and stay afloat in bills with my sales in flux, so the impact for me is that I will be able to push forward steadily. I am so grateful for that freedom to push without fear, feeling your support.

If you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, please keep in mind that I am working as an artist full time.  I love communication about my work. Please follow it through all those networking ways I try my best to use for that reason. 

Indiegogo has share tools! Maybe you know someone that might donate? Please pass this request along.

Sign up to follow me on Facebook, and /or Twitter. It's free and fun!
