story:
The Theme - Destruction and Revival

In light of recent events in Israel, destruction resonates many meanings. Lives disappear, buildings buckle  windows shatter and hopes for peace can fade.  Yet out of ashes rises the phoenix and the metaphor serves to remind us that barriers to peace can once again be overcome.

Once I Was a House is a combination of new and old, art and science and spontaneous innovation reflective of the ever evolving Israel that currently stands at a tense juncture. This transformation can stand as a fitting reminder of how creative endeavour can potentially override conflict.

As the end of the year approaches, so will the end of the house as it moves inexorably towards its demolition. However, the spirit of cooperation will remain; the innovative conjoining of diverse goals, ideals, and people under one roof; and the histories of birth, growth, experiences, and transitions will co-mingle in the charged physical space before it moves onto a house with a new structure and a new beginning.

Why we need help?

Both of the charities the project supports Misholim and HaLev Project are incredibly worthwhile, treating babies, children and young adults who struggle with emotional, social and mental difficulties in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv. They are well established and offer unique treatment programmes. As well as essential medical and mother-baby support they offer creative therapy programmes that involve sculpture, drawing, painting, music, movement and drama.  The group-based non-verbal means of expression allows the participants to express their thoughts and feelings and develop their social skills that will compound their healthy integration into society. 

We are so looking forward to unveiling this incredible transformation and would love for you to collaboarte and be a part of the process together with us!!

To DONATE and be part of the cause please click below: http://www.indiegogo.com/onceiwasahouse?c=home

story:
INTERARTS CENTRE FOR MAKERS

is being developed as a comprehensive facility for artists, makers, designers, creatives and capable people in Victoria, BC.


By consolidating the equipment and resources of several arts cooperatives, InterArts will allow members access to an unprecedented amount space, equipment, resources and opportunities to create nearly anything.

Screenprinting, letterpress, filmmaking, photography, laser cutting, 3D printing, PWYC colour copying, A/V editing, wood & metal shops, large format printing, projection and performance space, resident artist studios, affordable office space for non-profits, gallery space and more housed under one roof.

InterArts strives to create a living network between disciplines in a central an singularly useful space – a cooperative of cooperatives that will allow makers to transition from do-it-yourself to do-it ourselves.




InterArts is a cooperative of cooperatives - arts and equipment groups consolidating equipment, resources, facilities and experiences to create a singular resource where nearly anyone can learn or create nearly anything.

OLIO ARTISTS & WORKERS COOPERATIVE

Specializing in screenprinting and offering members access to both textile and flatstock printmaking facilities as well as large format giclee printing, letterpress equipment, button presses, colour copying and more.
www.oliocooperative.ca

CINEVIC SOCIETY OF INDEPENDENT FILMMAKERS

For over 20 years, Cinevic have fostered some of Victoria's most capable filmmakers and independent productions by offering equipment and resources to auteurs.
www.cinevic.ca


MAKERSPACE VICTORIA

MakerSpace offers access to specialty equipment and resources such as laser cutting, 3D printing, woodworking and metalworking shops, vinyl cutting and more.
www.makerspace.ca





By consolidating equipment and providing an accessible and effective home for new equipment, InterArts will allow anyone & everyone access to an unprecedented amount of resources most makers would otherwise not have.

Artists and creators can move freely between disciplines and pieces of equipment with one membership, allowing them to foster larger projects through many mediums and manufacturing processes without having to raise capital and create space to do it themselves. Think bigger, think better, get it done quicker, more easily and cheaper.

SCREENPRINTING

Full textile and flatstock screenprinting shops, including 6 colour 4 station Hix press, 4 colour 4 station Riley Hopkins press, vacuum flatstock printing presses for up 36x48", large format film output, UV exposure units, prepared screens, squeegees, water-based inks, drying racks, pressure washers & chemicals.


FILMMAKING

Cinevic houses enough film, video, lighting and editting equipment to enable filmmakers to see their projects through. 8mm, 16mm & Super 16mm film cameras, HD & 3K digital cameras, audio recording equipment, field monitors, jib arm, dollies & tracking, green screen, full editting suite, lighting kits, gels, stands and everything in between.


3D PRINTING

Victoria Makerspace are a prototyping co-op. With a wide range of equiment to help create something from nothing, none do it more literally than their MakerBot 3D printer. If you have an idea, it can help make it, from small parts and components to solid objects for molding to complex objects.



LETTERPRESS & PAPERY SHOP

InterArts will house a unique, publicly-accessible letterpress shop consisting of 2 Chandler & Price presses (10x15" & 8x10"), a Challenge proofing press (15x22"), an Excelsior platen press (5x8"), a hot foil press, Challenge paper cutters, binding blocks and presses, bookbinding facilities & more.


LASER CUTTING

Cuts, etches and engraves acrylic, wood, metal & many other thin substrates with incredible accuracy. Create parts, prototypes, signage, tools, or setup and cut custom wood type and bring it by the letterpress shop for easy wood block printing without the typesetting. 



WOOD & METAL SHOPS

Full wood & metal shops consisting of CNC cutter, welding & ironwork equipment, table saw, lathe, drill presses, circular saws, jigs, drills, routers and much more. Pair with screenprinting, laser cutting & 3D printing for myriad fabrication, manufacturing & prototyping possibilities.


A/V EDITING SUITE

Sound proof Mac & PC editing suite. Quad core Mac tower w/ Final Cut Pro 7 & X and Adobe Premiere for editing HD video, HD Cam deck for transferring video, 5.1 audio mixing, Shure & Sennheiser mics for on & off site recording, 16mm Telecine for digital film capture, even film editing decks for film aficionados.


COLOUR COPYING & LARGE FORMAT PRINTING

Pay-what-you-can colour copying for posters, handbills, cards, booklets (w/ folding & binding), buttons & anything in between. Large format giclee printing for posters & archival art prints 24" wide by any length. Film output for screens up to 36"x60" or litho plates. Pairs perfectly with the letterpress & book binding equipment.


BUTTON PRESSES

Print and press 1", 1.5", 2.25" & 2.5" buttons on site for next to nothin'. Pair with the laser cutter, letterpress or screenprinting presses for wood, embossed, or fabric buttons. Parts on-site & available through InterArts wholesale.

 



InterArts has the benefit of many pre-existing components, such as an abundance of equipment, personnel and experience. So we're not starting completely from scratch. But we need a space, which is where you come in; we need helping funding a space, we need help creating the space and we need help using the space. Using the space will be the easy part, though we're hoping you can help with funding and creating the space.

"CREATE and DESTROY"
2 colour screenprint
$25

Nothing says "I support the arts" like a clever and attractive print. 16x22" 2 colour metallic screenprint on charcoal stock.

Watch them being printed at www.vimeo.com/54104740


"CREATE and DESTROY"
Print + shirt
$50

Nothing says "I support the arts" like a clever and attractive print, either on your wall of on your chest! 16x22" 2 colour metallic screenprint on charcoal stock and soft charcoal heather shirt.

Watch them being printed at www.vimeo.com/54104740
story_txt:
INTERARTS CENTRE FOR MAKERS

is being developed as a comprehensive facility for artists, makers, designers, creatives and capable people in Victoria, BC.

By consolidating the equipment and resources of several arts cooperatives, InterArts will allow members access to an unprecedented amount space, equipment, resources and opportunities to create nearly anything. Screenprinting, letterpress, filmmaking, photography, laser cutting, 3D printing, PWYC colour copying, A/V editing, wood & metal shops, large format printing, projection and performance space, resident artist studios, affordable office space for non-profits, gallery space and more housed under one roof. InterArts strives to create a living network between disciplines in a central an singularly useful space – a cooperative of cooperatives that will allow makers to transition from do-it-yourself to do-it ourselves.

 

InterArts is a cooperative of cooperatives - arts and equipment groups consolidating equipment, resources, facilities and experiences to create a singular resource where nearly anyone can learn or create nearly anything. 
OLIO ARTISTS & WORKERS COOPERATIVE
Specializing in screenprinting and offering members access to both textile and flatstock printmaking facilities as well as large format giclee printing, letterpress equipment, button presses, colour copying and more.www.oliocooperative.ca
CINEVIC SOCIETY OF INDEPENDENT FILMMAKERS
For over 20 years, Cinevic have fostered some of Victoria's most capable filmmakers and independent productions by offering equipment and resources to auteurs. www.cinevic.ca
MAKERSPACE VICTORIA
MakerSpace offers access to specialty equipment and resources such as laser cutting, 3D printing, woodworking and metalworking shops, vinyl cutting and more.www.makerspace.ca


By consolidating equipment and providing an accessible and effective home for new equipment, InterArts will allow anyone & everyone access to an unprecedented amount of resources most makers would otherwise not have.Artists and creators can move freely between disciplines and pieces of equipment with one membership, allowing them to foster larger projects through many mediums and manufacturing processes without having to raise capital and create space to do it themselves. Think bigger, think better, get it done quicker, more easily and cheaper.

SCREENPRINTING
Full textile and flatstock screenprinting shops, including 6 colour 4 station Hix press, 4 colour 4 station Riley Hopkins press, vacuum flatstock printing presses for up 36x48", large format film output, UV exposure units, prepared screens, squeegees, water-based inks, drying racks, pressure washers & chemicals.

Pairs perfectly with the letterpress & book binding equipment.

story:
What Are The Omen?

The Omen is a collection of symbols, interpretations, dreams, and premonitions appearing in my first official Gallery show.  

The collection of prints, drawings, sculptures, paintings, and themes being presented are all interconnected, and work symbiotically as a key. The gallery of artwork represents a transformation over a span of three years, and animates the past, present, and imminent future of my experiences here in Ithaca, NY. The pieces are a series pathways and snapshots to my realizations and fears, all within the context of each medium, forever chained to the existence of our never-ending story.

The artwork for sale can be found below, and are matched up with their donation amounts on the right by name.

What I Need & What You Get

It is important for me to show, and sell people my artwork. Although I am emotionally connected to my work, and respect my process enough to charge for it, most of the artwork for sale is underpriced.

As a donor, what you will be paying for is

  • My time
  • Supplies to make the work
  • Shipping (this is a pretty big deal if you live outside NY state, getting my work safely to you will be more expensive than if you live locally)

I have broken down most of my pieces to a simple equation considering these factors, in order to charge appropriate amounts for my work, and make sure it is affordable. I believe that artists who overcharge for their work end up devaluing it in the long-run. My goal is to share my work affordably, and make sure my patrons are happy to become connected to my experience as an artist. 

What you will recieve when you buy a piece of my artwork is:

  • A sticker from my Gallery show (shown below)
  • A Certificate of Authenticity (bill of sale)
  • A personal letter detailing the background and meaning of the work
  • The artwork itself
  • (Optional) A spot on my patron list to receive discounts and updates on my future work 

My goal is to share my work, and build a closer connection to those who help support me. By donating to this campaign you are investing in my future, I want to develop relationships with the people who help me achieve this dream of mine, and hope to do so with as many people as possible.

Here is some pictures of my work for sale, you can find my other work on my Tumblr (www.itfellfromthesky.tumblr.com)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, there are still things you can do to help me!

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Follow my Tumblr, and help connect me to other artists and investors on the internet (www.itfellfromthesky.tumblr.com)
  • Email me and tell me your compliments and criticisms ( leoaoliva(at)gmail(dot)com )

 

Thank you for taking your time to look over my campaign, if you'd like to look into the rest of my artwork and projects here are some links:

www.itfellfromthesky.tumblr.com

www.voiceofthevision.com

www.facebook.com/thevictorybanner

 

Artwork and Donation Compensation:

 

3 Stickers and a thank you note ($10)

Stickers - 2.25" x 2.25"

 

 

Screen Print, Poster, 2 Stickers ($20)

Print - 18" x 24" Poster - 11" x 17" Sticker - 2.25" x 2.25"

 

Live Painting: Greenpoint Gallery ($36)

Acrylic and spray paint on canvas

11" x 14"

 

Live Painting: Sullivan Hall ($40)

Acrylic and spray paint on canvas

18" x 24"

 

Live Painting: 111 S Cayuga ($50)

Acrylic and spray paint on canvas

18" x 24"

 

Live Painting: The Haunt ($60)

Acrylic paint on canvas

18" x 24"

 

Resurgam ($60)

Modge podge cut-out, stencil and spray paint

18" x 24"

 

Dangerous Waters ($60)

Acrylic and spray paint

18" x 24"


Live Painting: Culture Shock (SOLD!)

Acrylic and spray paint on canvas

18" x 24"

 

New York (SOLD!)

Spray paint on canvas

18" x 24"

 

Inertia: Charcoal Study ($90)

Charcoal on wood

17" x 34"

Mark of Cain (SOLD!)

Acrylic and spray paint on canvas

(2)18" x 24"

 

Creep ($120) [Locals to NY State only]

Wax

Spray paint on canvas

16" x 20"

story:
Melanoma is a cancer that has no boundaries on whom it invades.  It matters not your age, your skin color or your gender.  It can kill you quickly but if found, you can manage it and live a long and wonderful life.

For Julia Knight, melanoma came unannounced.  It was only through a phone conversation with a friend, who had just learned that she had melanoma, did Julia decide to take action and get her skin checked.  As it turned out, this action saved her life.

Living with melanoma has reshaped Julia's life. This disease has not only challenged her physically, but also emotionally -- balancing the chaos caused from multiple surgeries, along with summoning the inner strength needed in order to curb this guaranteed promise of death if any mole is ignored.

_____________________________________

The inspiration for SKIN comes from Julia's story.

With SKIN, we want to raise awareness on how to pay attention to your skin -- how to care for it, celebrate and honor its ephemeral nature -- and we want you to learn more about Melanoma. Melanoma is one of the deadliest forms of cancer, but, a simple trip to the dermatologist to get your skin checked can ensure many years of a fulfilling life.

_____________________________________

THE INSTALLATION

We intend to raise awareness by creating a multi-media installation that invites the viewer to immerse themselves into a visceral and sensory meditation on SKIN.  The installation will include film, spoken word, photography, and surround sound. Interactive elements will also be included to encourage the viewer to express their feelings about how they relate to their skin and to other's skin.

We will also provide reading materials so that those who attend can walk away with information on melanoma.

_____________________________________

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We ask for your support in our quest to raise funds so that we may realize this project.  Funds given by you will be invested into the completion of the film (production + postproduction) and the audio design (recording the two poems + SKIN soundtrack + surround sound design).  And, if we pass our goal, we can then purchase materials for the installation and create the interactive design.

HOW YOU CAN BE INVOLVED

Your support is vital in helping us raise awareness.  By contributing to our campaign via Paypal or credit card and/or sharing our SKIN teaser with others through social media (Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr), email or word of mouth, you could be saving the life of a friend and/or sharing SKIN'S message about loving and respecting one's skin.

_____________________________________

Much love, passion and hard work went into creating our SKIN teaser. We are excited about realizing this work and we are thrilled to have you join our journey.

 

juliaknight + valeriebarnes

co-creators + co-producers of SKIN

_____________________________________

Our SKIN project could not be realized without the contributions of the talented: kimiarahgozar, photography, timothycramer, sound design, josevargas, installation design

story:
Everyone gets angry, sometimes.

It might be that guy who cut you off on exit 5. Maybe they ran out of glazed donuts. Maybe you run an advice podcast and someone sent you their math homework. It happens. People get angry.

A lot of different people have come up with a lot of different solutions for dealing with anger. Yoga, tea, alcohol, any number of remedies can be good for some people. Some people however, just need to flip a table.

The Portable Flipping Table

Flipping tables can be hazardous. Sometimes the table can take a strange trajectory while airborne and take an eye out. Sometimes it might hit a wall and put a hole in it. They're unwieldy beasts, and they're not very portable.

We've developed a small, portable table that is made for one true purpose, to flip. And how glorious it feels to flip that table. Got an F on that social studies test? Flip this table. That pretty lady turned you down? Flip this table. Milk went bad because you didn't drink it fast enough? Well, stop buying gallons, start buying half gallons. Oh, and flip this table.

Incentives






The Cost

We're working with Trendex, the company behind great products like the Minecraft Foam Swords / Pick Axes, the Portal 2 Cookie Cutters, the Talking Turret toys, and a slew of other well-manufactured toys. We want to make something that isn't going to break after a couple of flips. Making a quality toy isn't cheap. 

The mold itself is the most expensive part of the process. The mold for our table is going to cost $3,300, and the tables themselves are going to cost even more. So. that's why we need to raise at least $5,330. We've got a number of great stretch goals that will make the product more fun, and in the event of great success, we'll also be making some of our other pet projects a reality.

Stretch Goals

  • $5,850 - All tables will get an additional optional keychain attachment. EDIT: DONE
  • $6,500 - All tables will get a deluxe art box for safe keeping. EDIT: DONE
  • $7,000 - We'll buy a low-end Mac and port Love+ to Linux and Mac OS X. note: I've decided that if we can hit the $7K mark, I'll pay the rest out of my own pocket.
  • $8,500 - We'll get a print run of James Bennet's Moon Dogs & Other Toy Animals, and everyone who donates over $35 to the project will get it added to their order for free.

Free Bonuses

Everyone who donates at least $5 to our cause will be receiving a nice little slew of free downloadable content, including but not limited to:

  • A DRM-Free copy of Love+
  • James Bennett's 2006 EP "Moondogs & Other Toy Animals"
  • Sure to be Ban'D Year One (in PDF format)
  • Exclusive Bancast Clips that were just a little to rough to broadcast.

Other Ways You Can Help

We at the Bancast can relate when it comes to not to having expendable income, so we understand that not everyone can chip in. That doesn't mean you can't help out, though.

  • Tweet the link "igg.me/at/table", use the HashTag #FlippingTable.
  • Spread the link "igg.me/at/table" on Facebook and Tumblr!
  • Tell your friends to check us out!
  • Subscribe and listen to the Bancast! Okay that's unrelated, but it helps our self esteem!

We hope you'll support us

story:
Thank you!

Thank you everyone for your reaching our goal!  

You can still pre-order your copy of the booklet.

About the Booklet

Many who have read Michelle Alexander’s The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness or know the harsh and vast prison industrial complex have wondered, “What can I do to help stop mass incarceration?”  This 45-page booklet takes on that question.  It's not about suggesting one simple answer, but teaching the skills of organizing, through stories of what the movement is already doing to overcome this crisis.

Whether you’re already involved in organizing on mass incarceration, part of a small group who wants to tackle the issue, or just an individual wanting to make a difference, Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow will provide assistance.  Alongside teaching skills, this book is about laying down a long-term vision of a movement -- one that isn't just about ending mass incarceration but ending the cycle of caste in the United States.

Through stories and examples, this booklet will cover:

  • How to create a group when it's just you starting out
  • How your group can grow and create campaigns to win meaningful change
  • How your campaigns can add up to a real movement


Author Daniel Hunter Teams with the Veterans of Hope Project

Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow is a collaborative project bringing together author Daniel Hunter and the Veterans of Hope Project. 

Daniel Hunter is a veteran community organizer and group facilitator with Training for Change. He is author of the widely acclaimed book, Strategy and Soul, in which he writes self-reflectively about a dynamic, long term direct action campaign. Hunter brings a keen eye to how movements can learn from their own successes and failures.

Founded in 1997 by Vincent and Rosemarie Freeney Harding, the Veterans of Hope Project is a multifaceted educational initiative on religion, culture and participatory democracy. VoH encourages a healing-centered approach to community-building that recognizes the interconnectedness of spirit, creativity and citizenship. Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow is a natural and frequently requested follow-up to VoH's New Jim Crow Study Guide and Call to Action, which has been distributed to hundreds of schools, re-entry centers, faith communities, and study groups throughout the United States. Vincent Harding has agreed to write the Foreword to Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow, and VoH as a whole is thrilled to be teaming with Daniel Hunter on this exciting next step in their movement-building efforts.

Please offer your support to Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow.  By doing so you can ensure you get a copy of the book as soon it comes out!


Activists Need to Tell Our Story.

In some ways our movement may be akin to the Civil Rights movement in the early 1900s.  Most of us know of the later iconic images of men and women doing sit-ins at lunch counters or the massive March on Washington in 1963.  But those mass events did not just happen – there were many decades of organizing that led up to them.

Early on the movement had robust arguments about its goals, wondering if it should focus on ending segregation or pouring energy into black institutions.  The movement experimented with tactics, with small groups trying sit-ins, bus boycotts, freedom rides, and even threatening to march on Washington decades before '63.  

Those numerous local experiments were the testing ground for ideas and strategy, allowing people to see what worked and to learn from mistakes.  While it may or may not take as many years, our movement also needs to conduct such experiments, many of which are already well underway. This booklet does not presume to offer neatly packaged answers. Rather, it holds up the good work and learning that's happening now, and encourages the process of reflecting, questioning, and boldly experimenting as we continue to build a dynamic, multifaceted mass movement to end the new Jim Crow.

(If you want to make a 501c3 donation to support this project, please be in direct touch with Daniel Hunter via e-mail: daniel@trainingforchange.org.)

A Special Message from Michelle Alexander

Dear friends,

I was excited to learn that the Veterans of Hope Project (VoH) has teamed with Daniel Hunter, a talented community organizer and author, to begin laying the groundwork for the writing of this much-needed booklet: Building the Movement to End the New Jim Crow. Thisnew resource will serve as a powerful and useful follow up to VoH's previous publication, the New Jim Crow Study Guide and Call to Action, which has been distributed nationwide to hundreds of congregations, re-entry centers, book groups, and schools.

In recent years, I've become acutely aware of the need for a booklet or guide that will help people take action to end mass incarceration. As I've traveled around the country spreading the message of The New Jim Crow, I've met countless people who are ready and willing to join the movement -- people of faith, people behind bars, formerly incarcerated people, mothers and fathers of incarcerated children, judges, teachers, community activists, health care workers, unemployed people, and the very rich. I've received hundreds of emails and letters from people of all colors and backgrounds who have awakened to the horror and crisis of mass incarceration in the United States and who want to take action. They all ask the same question: What can I do?

This booklet aims to answer that question by lifting up the heroic and inspiring efforts of ordinary people around the country who are building an extraordinary new movement -- a multi-racial, multi-ethnic human rights movement that seeks not only to end mass incarceration, but also to break our nation's habit of creating caste-like systems in America.

The tactics, strategies, and forms of advocacy undertaken in this movement undoubtedly will vary across the nation, depending on our circumstances and locales. There will be successes and failures. But we will remain inspired to persevere if we listen to each other's stories and learn from each other's victories and challenges. I'm thrilled that people like Daniel and organizations like Veterans of Hope are stepping up to offer much-needed guidance and inspiration. 

Thanks so much for supporting this project, and for all that you do to help build this movement.

Sincerely,
Michelle Alexander

story:
The Story

I'm 18. I'm in college in visual arts. I don't have a job so I live with my mom, who is also in her studies. But since she has to pay for the university, my supplies are usually not the best. Where I live, good paint and brushes are really expensive and good canvases are hard to come by. I used to cut because me and my mother aren't in the best of terms. But I found an old canvas and painted. The more I painted, the more I felt liberated. I started a series I named the Flow series, because of the flowing hair and the impression that they seem to be floating. 

What I need

I need money for supplies as they are rather expensive and I have to pay for them alone. I chose 500$ because it was the lowest number. I really need to continue painting and I want to get the series exposed in an arts gallery once it's done. No matter how much I make in this campaign I'll only use this money to try and finish the series.

Your impact

I can't buy supplies on my own, so I really need money for it. By contributing to this, you contribute not only to the creation of new works of art, but also to he well-being of a fellow human. Painting is my life and I really don't want it to be over...

Risks

I may not make enough money to finish the series, there may not be much time to finish the paintings with college and homework. I try to finish a painting every 1-2 weeks, but it's getting hard.

How you may help

Even just giving 5$ helps. 5$ equals a small canvas or a cheap brush, which is always helpful.

story:
Hi, my name is Melissa and I'm from Brooklyn, NY. The reason I started this campaign is to help me raise some money for some essential tools that I need to create art. Currently I work at the Museum of Natural History but my passion is art. I have a vision that one day I could rent or possibly own a space where I can teach others how to create art. Art programs have been cut from a lot of schools and I believe there's a need for a place in the "ghetto" where people can be creative. Teaching others to create, make profit from it and in turn donate to those who are in need. 
  • If I don't reach my goal it would slow me down significantly but it wouldn't stop me. Recently I participated in my first show and it was a success. 
  • I'd would use what I make here to buy a computer and some much needed art supplies, these would not only help me connect with other easily but create other things that at the moment I can't do by hand. Check the perks I have so you can get a chance to see my talent. If you can't donate, I urge you to please share my campaign on any social media outlet that you may have.

story:
The Giving Lens + Picaflor House Peru

We have been honoured to send two teams to Peru, with a third team about to be announced. Picaflor House is based outside of Cusco, and takes in kids from more rural areas who need access to education, health care, good food, and other support. 

Having sent two teams, we have successfully installed a photography club within the Picaflor compound, allowing children the freedom to express themselves, explore the world around them, and find their own voice and vision.

So now, Picaflor is hosting their very first Gallery Exhibition! And they need $500 to make it happen. 

  • They've already paid upfront for the cost of prints, and renting the space
  • They've invited all the families and friends of the students
  • They've arranged transportation, accommodation, etc, for the students
The Giving Lens is sponsoring this event, but we get asked all the time how people who can't come on our trips can help. This is how! Here's a great chance to help out these kids in Peru, using photography as a tool to better their lives. 

If we raise "too much" it will be donated to Picaflor for the next photo project!


The Impact

The look on a child's face, when they see their photo - their work - hanging up on a wall is beyond priceless. But the impacts are far greater than this:

  • The exhibition will build self-confidence and identity in the students
  • The exhibition will raise awareness for all the other amazing things Picaflor House is doing in Peru!
  • The exhibition will open doors for future funding, volunteers, awareness, attention, and more. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Make some noise! Please Share on your social media outlets. 

What Is The Giving Lens?

We believe that photography can make a difference. We build teams of photographers looking to combine their greatest passion with a worthy cause overseas. We travel overseas where we not only do amazing workshops in country, but spend up to half the trip volunteering with an amazing, local, grassroots non-profit. 

So, we build trips that connect teams of passionate photographers with worthy Non-Profit doing incredible work. We get a whole team of willing photographers to a nation and facilitate your experience on the ground. We volunteer our camera, hearts, time, and energy in whatever way the Non-Profit needs most. Sometimes this is by documenting their work for media and website purposes. Other times it is by teaching photography classes to kids who need creative outlets to express themselves. And yet other times it can be physically getting our hands dirty and helping out. There is no limit to what we are capable of. Each trip is different and offers a unique, once-in-a-lifetime experience - from impactful volunteer work, to incredible photography workshops at unbelievable locations. 


By participating in a TGL (The Giving Lens) Trip you are allowing yourself the opportunity to explore, grow, document and work hand in hand to help make a difference with the local communities, NGO organizations and countries we will be working in. As you grow in your photography you might also be working with school children, helping to protect an endangered species, or empowering women. The ways in which photography can make the world better are limitless. 

By partnering with us, an NGO receives:

- high quality images for their use

- photo-education for a community, staff, or both

- up to 50% of the profits from our paying participants!


Join us, and Picaflor House, today!

story:
Short Summary

  • Starr Stultz, Chris Hartsell, and Megan Lee three early 20 somethings who have a dream, a dream to be able to experience their favorite band at Red Rocks Amphitheater. Not only that, but taking a life changing road trip along the way with lots of stops at natural treasures and historic sites along the way. Red Rocks isn't the only part of this trip that is a dream, it's the experience of learning and exploring parts of the US we've never dreamed of seeing before. Something none of us have had the chance to do so far in our lives.
  • We originally had another person who was going to come along on this trip that would allow for more to be done, but due to unfortunate circumstances they can no longer come along on this life changing journey. This however, affects what we can and cannot do along this trip. We don't want to ask for a handout, more along the ways of giving the chance to take you along on the trip with us. Let's be honest we've become more and more excited for the trip itself over the concert, the stops we have planned are stuff that is close to our hearts, Native American Historical sites which plays into (Starr's future degree and career), Chris's interest in Alien's and all this supernatural, and Megan's thirst for adventure.
  • We would have asked for less but 500 is the min indiegogo sets. I know these kinds of trips are amazing for everyone and I know a lot of people cannot even think about going on them, heck we tried last year we entertained the idea even though we knew there was no way possible to make it, so in order to make sure we can do all we want to on our trip, we want to offer others a way to go along on the trip with us.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Basically this is to help us with gas.
  • Our perks are from any of the stops along the way places including Angel Mounds, Cahokia, Sauer Castle, Manitou Cave Dwellings, The Grand Canyon, Graceland, Red Rocks Amphitheater, Cadillac Ranch (the car grave yard not the bordello),  Woody Guthrie Statue, Henry River Ghost Town (filming location of The Hunger Games), Zion National Park, Garden of The Gods, Valley of The Gods, Navajo National Monument, Elephants Feet, Desert View Watchtower, Sunset Crater, Petroglyph National Monument and who knows where else we will end up.
  • If we don't reach our goal we may not get to go to all these places but that is ok we just want to expand this trip as much as possible, and we want to share where we are going along the way. 

The Impact

  • Basically by helping out you are helping some young adults do something none of us have been lucky enough to have a chance to do in our lives, travel. Starr has never been further away from NC (home) than Georgia which just happened last month. Chris and Megan haven't been as far as Colorado either. Not to mention you are helping us learn about the country we live in. 
  • Honestly, we don't expect much from this. We don't want to seem like jerks for asking either but we do want to share our trip with others because it's so important to us personally.

Risks & Challenges

  • Risks are like the car breaking down in the middle of no-where Oklahoma, or any other state, perhaps needing a room for a few hours to nap between the 35 hour drive home, gas money in case we get a little lost (we will have maps and a GPS so I really hope this does not happen because we do not need a Hills Have Eyes thing happening here or another  interpretation of The Wrong Turn).
  • We have a lot of tenacity, we will make this trip amazing no matter what.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Hey if you can share we'll appreciate it too!

story: Pour jouer du synth.
story_txt: Pour jouer du synth.

story:
We believe the best design is transformative.  It beautifies boring. It magnifies good. It intensifies connection. Design incites action. But the best design in the world is typically only accessible to those with  big budgets. We want to bring Madison ave. to Main st. by making the transformative power of great design accessible to churches and the communities that surround them. #designforall

Why Churches? Because we personally believe that, communicated effectively, their message is the most important message of hope the world could ever hear. This is the core of our passion. Why their Communities? Because we believe churches and the people that make them up should be devoted to the good of their communities. Church leaders and small business owners both need help to become more visible and memorable to the people they are trying to reach. Church leaders and small business owners both need to incite action. Great design can do this. We do great design. 

My name is Aaron. I've spent 10 years pursuing my dream in a variety of professional capacities. I've served on staff as the lead designer at a 15,000 member church in Woodstock, GA. I've pursued business ownership once before and failed. And most recently I enjoyed the privilege of serving several roles at innovative juvenile brands company called Kids II. Those 4 years gave me exposure to world class design and marketing for multi-million dollar brands. They showed me what real business looks like on the inside. They positioned me alongside some of the most incredible creative talent in the world. Most importantly they prepared me to take a legitimate shot at succeeding with this dream. 

Throughout my career, I have maintained a thriving freelance pipeline doing the work I love for the causes I care so deeply about. In June of this year, that business reached a critical mass and my wife and I made the exhilarating decision to leave the security of the Atlanta sky rise and go hard after my design agency dream from my home studio.



We call this dream CANVAS. A non-traditional creative agency for the main street community of churches and small businesses made up of a collection "Canvases". These Canvases are accessibly priced flat-rate and subscription packages that provide brilliant design aimed at building successful brands. Right now we emphasize 4.


 A monthly subscription to custom designed "ad campaigns" for the messages  a pastor preaches throughout the year. This is where CANVAS started. Each campaign includes a tool kit 8 deliverables promoting and enhancing the weekly message.  

The business counterpart to SermonCanvas that provides presentation and info graphic design for sales calls, social media and annual reports.

Flat rate design and project management packages that transform lifeless spaces into experiences that speak. If you've ever renovated a room or building before you know that while it is a great opportunity to communicate brand and vision, but it is also time-intensive and prone to not turning out the way you envisioned it. We can fix that. Our project management may be more valuable than our design. 

Multiple flat rate packages that offering comprehensive re-consideration of all visual and verbal aspects of your brand at various price points  We develop a clearly valuable tool kit of deliverables that you can use to build your organization from a name or a logo to a legitimate brand. 

As we encounter new customers and changing needs, we expect our model and our offerings to evolve.

Bottom-line we care about HELPING OTHERS TO BE SUCCESSFUL. Our unflinching commitment is to making Madison Ave creative more accessible to the Main Street coommunities. 


What We Need & What You Get

We've experienced 5 months of rapid growth which just reminds us daily that we can't do this alone. We need your help! Here are some of the ways your generosity will take us further, faster. 
1. EQUIPMENT & WORKSPACE: $5600 I'm using a 5-6 year old computer that can barely keep up with the demands of the latest design software. It gets the job done...slowly. Every minute is money. My wife is project managing her butt off from an iPhone. To insure quality design we need to be printing quality proofs, not just making judgments based the screen. Here is a list of supplies and equipment that would drastically streamline our workflow and improve the quality of creative and service we offer our clients:
  • Updated Computers: $3200
  • Pantone Swatchbooks $500
  • Updated Screens $1000
  • Large format Proof Printer $400
  • Premium Fonts and Stock Imagery $299/mo. 
  • Collaborative shared office space in Woodstock or Marietta (long term vision)

2. MARKETING: $3400 We need to be able to do for us what we do so well for others. This requires capital for printing, for placement, and for travel to market CANVAS effectively. Here are some of the specific needs. 
  • Finished interactive Website at canvasagency.com that supports our virtual team $1000
  • Twitter & Facebook Marketing $300 (2 mo)
  • Collateral Printing $500
  • Conference Exhibit Fee ($1000)
  • New Client Welcome Kits ($600)


3. Working Capital: $6000. A month's worth of cash to work on the business rather than just in the business.

Research and development to insure that our products are optimized for the needs and interests of our audience.  

Explore and vet design talent to begin building our curated crowd. 

Work with a virtual CFO or Bookkeeping company to establish sound financial systems strategies


Fortunately if you decide to exceed our $15K dream, CANVAS will get all of the funds you donate minus the commission taken by IndieGoGo. 

PLEASE DON'T BE INTIMIDATED BY OUR TOTAL NEED. EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. WE ARE EXCEEDINGLY GRATEFUL FOR EVERY CONTRIBUTION!!!!
There are incredible causes out there to give to and overwhelming needs in the world today. We don't pretend to be more worthy they, but we believe that there is immediate AND ETERNAL impact in the services we are providing and we would be HONORED to have your support. 


Our invitation to give is not without incentives. Here's what you can expect to receive for your contribution.


  • For gifts $50+:  A Canvas T-Shirt

  • For Gifts $150+ A shirt + a hand screen printed and framed edition of the talented Keith Rosemond's boom box artwork that hangs in our office.

  • For Gifts $500+: All of the above + a Thule Back Pack containing a few of our favorite things.  

  • For Gifts $1000+: All of the above + the amount of your investment discounted from ANY CANVAS SERVICE. 

  • For Gifts $10000+: You can pay my medical bills too because I will probably have a heart attack with gratitude!!!


    The Impact


    In Riverside, CA after 18 months of partnership with SermonCanvas and now BrandCanvas, Pastor Jonathan Bilima has seen growth from 250 attendees to 900+. The process we have launched a thrift store for the community and seen countless lives CHANGED. 

    In Kenessaw, GA, we helped Dr. Cris Welsh rebrand her family chiropractic business from Eaton Chiropractic to WHI (Whole Health Institute). The immediate result was a 30% increase in visits within the first month. 

    That's just two snippets of our many success stories. 

    When churches become more visible and memorable, more people attend, more lives are changed, and communities around them are transformed through their love and generosity. 

    When small businesses become more visible and memorable, more people engage them, communities become more vibrant, local economies become stronger, lives of owners and lives of residents are literally made better. 

    By contributing to this campaign, you are not only helping my family and enabling our dream. You are transforming communities. You are giving creatives around the world the chance to do the work they love for causes they care about. And you empowering a business with aspirations to change the world. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute. Totally cool but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Your voice matters!!!! Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign and this business
    • Twwet. Instagram. Facebook. Call. Door to Door...WHATEVER IT TAKES. 

    We have 30 days to do this. Starting now.
story_txt:
We believe the best design is transformative.  It beautifies boring. It magnifies good. It intensifies connection. Design incites action. But the best design in the world is typically only accessible to those with  big budgets. We want to bring Madison ave. to Main st. by making the transformative power of great design accessible to churches and the communities that surround them. #designforall
Why Churches? Because we personally believe that, communicated effectively, their message is the most important message of hope the world could ever hear. This is the core of our passion. Why their Communities? Because we believe churches and the people that make them up should be devoted to the good of their communities. Church leaders and small business owners both need help to become more visible and memorable to the people they are trying to reach. Church leaders and small business owners both need to incite action. Great design can do this. We do great design. 
My name is Aaron. I've spent 10 years pursuing my dream in a variety of professional capacities. I've served on staff as the lead designer at a 15,000 member church in Woodstock, GA. I've pursued business ownership once before and failed. And most recently I enjoyed the privilege of serving several roles at innovative juvenile brands company called Kids II. Those 4 years gave me exposure to world class design and marketing for multi-million dollar brands. They showed me what real business looks like on the inside. They positioned me alongside some of the most incredible creative talent in the world. Most importantly they prepared me to take a legitimate shot at succeeding with this dream. 
Throughout my career, I have maintained a thriving freelance pipeline doing the work I love for the causes I care so deeply about. In June of this year, that business reached a critical mass and my wife and I made the exhilarating decision to leave the security of the Atlanta sky rise and go hard after my design agency dream from my home studio.




We call this dream CANVAS. A non-traditional creative agency for the main street community of churches and small businesses made up of a collection "Canvases". These Canvases are accessibly priced flat-rate and subscription packages that provide brilliant design aimed at building successful brands. Right now we emphasize 4.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Sarah, and back in 2010 I used to post nail tutorials on YouTube. I had a lot of fun with it, and I even gained a decent following. Some of my videos had millions of views, and I was so proud of the content I shared, and how much other people seemed to enjoy it.

Eventually, real life got in the way, and I stopped making videos. I stopped doing nail art altogether.

Now, as an adult, I want to start making tutorials again.

The only problem is that I got rid of all my nail supplies years ago. I don't even own a single bottle of nail polish anymore.

I'm just a student and I don't have a job, so it's going to be a struggle to get all the supplies I need without help.

What I Need & What You Get

No matter how much money I raise, I'm going to start making videos again regardless. I started making videos back in 2010 with nothing but a handful of nail polishes and some toothpicks, so if need be, I can start at that point again.

However, if you guys help me to buy supplies, I will deliver a much higher quality of video. My artistic skills have developed over the past few years and I have some great ideas for nail tutorials.

One thing I definitely need to purchase is a model hand and some false nails, because for my own personal reasons I can't wear my nails long anymore, so I'll be doing all my new designs on false nails.

I would also like to get a decent selection of nail polish, some acrylic paints, detailing brushes, glitters, rhinestones, striping tape, etc.

The perks for this campaign are as follows:

- Everyone who donates more than $10 AUD will get a shout out in my first new video.

- The first 5 people to donate $50 AUD or more will be able to have their channels featured on my channel, where they will be seen by over 38,000 people.

- If anyone is generous enough to donate $100 AUD or more, as a token of my gratitude I will mail you the very first set of fake nails I create for a tutorial.

The goal I have set for this fundraiser is $500, because it's the minimum amount you can set on this website, however, realistically, if I get around $100 that should be enough for me to deliver a high quality of video.

Your contributions would mean the world to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, I completely understand. As a poor uni student I know what it's like to not have any money to spare!

However, if you could share this page around to anyone you know who might be interested in nail art, I would be so grateful.

Thank you for taking the time to read about my fundraiser, and I look forward to making videos for you all!

story:
Jayamangala dancers from Maryland USA, will go on their first international tour to Africa in March 2013.  Out of the $12,000 expense, we have only raised half by means of grants, corporate sponsorships and self financing.  Air tickets are booked, rehearsals and preparations are in full swing.  Please help us bridge the gap in our budget by financing the remaining travel, costumes, lights and sound needs.

Jayamangala is 501c3 non profit registered. So all your contributions are tax-deductible. And if you can, kindly spread word about our campaign among your friends.

story:
Summary

This is a fundraiser for my husband Desmond Rouse, one of the Yankton4. He was set up by the FBI 20 years ago because he was fighting corruption. The FBI abused the small children in his family and accused him of their own crimes. He never stood a chance. Desmond was sentenced to 33 years in federal prison...he is an innocent man and a indigenous political prisoner. Desmond is also a great artist - his dream is to one day see the Mona Lisa at the Louvre in Paris and to have enough money to create enough paintings for an exhibition to bring attention to his story.

Desmond paints to stay alive and to keep his heart strong and loving. Only when he paints can he forget that he is in prison and feel like a free man once more. His art is his way to be free, His paintings express that place inside of his beautiful soul that no chain and no oppressor can ever touch. Please help him. He needs your help to succeed in his struggle to prove his innocence to the world.


What Desmond Needs & What You Get

What your money will do:

  • Desmond will be able to buy enough canvas pads and paints to create 20 pieces or original art and be able to exhibit his work
  • He will develop a range of romantic scenes for novelty cards
  • All funds will go directly to Desmond Rouse and exclusively to fund his dream

Your Impact

Desmond has spent 20 years in prison innocent. We have n money for a good attorney - so artwork is all he has to keep himself sane:

  • Help an innocent man to succeed against evil
  • Stand up against the genocide in South Dakotas court rooms
  • Reach out and make a difference in this warriors life
  • Please folks get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • If you want to get involved in any other way please contact us via facebbook Freedom4Yankton4 or https://www.facebook.com/dezrouse?fref=ts
  • AND please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Mitakuye Oyasin - All are related

story:
Greetings world,

My name is Muhammad Hafeez, age 34 , an active VFX and 3D Generalist born in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia. Have been in the creative industry for 15years, an ex- Digital Compositor TD at Rhythm and Hues, which is a hollywood post production studio and now seeking for an opportunity to start my own project as a "stepping stone" for my business towards the form of art that i love. For now, im a freelancer artist, not attach to any studios or a company and neither have one :P. 

Currently, i develop only one character that is the hero himself - the goat name ROY

ROY's walkcycle;


One of my friend has donated his creativity in music scoring, this movie will expose more of asian culture, so this is some kind of "sound" to it.


The whole project is about a talking animal show, adaptation of south east asian culture jokes and scenario, most of it come from my country, Malaysia. Targeted for teens and above audience as an alternative flavour to my local scene, that is animation feature is just not for kids. I targeted ROY as a feature FILM, but open to any path if media (webisodes, tv series etc) when things might or might not change from time to time
A quick summary about the story:
  • hero character name ROY-goat and bunch of other animals within his barn.
  • action-romantic-comedy genre
  • computer generated images (3D ANIMATION)

The first step is for me to create one or two 30 seconds video teaser with great length of quality and professional look for the output. I might need some of my talented friends in this project as i am ambitious to level up it's quality more than what has been presented here in Malaysia. 


Another benefactor for crowd funding is the cost for digital "rendering". The final animation will be generated as a sequence of images using a rendering farm technology. It needs a super-high-end computers to complete that task. For that i located a place to rent per day or week for that task.
Kick start budget of est. 14,000 USD "which is est. 49k in Ringgit Malaysia . It covers many aspects for me to start up an animation and multimedia company. Most of the budget will go to the computers and softwares.


... on the pitching bible (pitching materials) itself there will be.
a. a concept art of the whole story
b. paperwork's on target audience, objective and essential pitching needs.
c. detail explanation of characters with single frame 3d render
d. lay out all the characters including the non-hero in the story
e. a sample of walkcycle (character walking sample),a gimmick act for each characters (for pitching purpose).
f. Voice act sample for characters and etc.


With your contribution, this will help the independent creative community grow and be part of the commercialization. 

 


As a token of appreciation you'll be receiving a fullHD of the 30secs itself as soon its been completed, with a graphics from the pitching bible in a "cute booklet format" :). Your name will be on the ending credits too.. For this, will be in computer format for digital downloading. 

I sincerly, thank you for your time reading this. tq



Thank you indiegogo.com.. thank you world for listening.

HAFEEZ and team

from
MALAYSIA
with love.

visit the faceook page below :
FB ROYanimatedfeature

story:
Armed with a paintbrush, kids can transform the course of their lives. With passion and creativity, no dream is too big. 

Since 2010, Hearts of the World, a 501(c)(3) non-profit, has been fostering creativity, self-exploration, and freedom of expression for children around the world through painting workshops. Light and lively discussions help participants open up in a comfortable and safe environment as they quiet their minds from the chaos of daily life and tune in to the beat of their own hearts. Partnering with schools, orphanages, and arts organizations, Hearts of the World spreads the healing power of creativity that transcends international borders. 

We are excited to announce that we are now planning projects in twelve countries over the next five years - Starting with India this spring, 2015!




    "In my heart are my family and education; I want to go to
school and fly an airplane, so I can see the world from the sky."
                                  ~ Staisy, age 4. Haiti.






During a three-hour workshop, each child is given a panel with the outline of an anatomical heart and encouraged to paint whatever is inside his or her own heart: wild dreams, intense passions, favorite past-times, even deep dark fears. While some simply let loose on the panel in a flurry of energy, others intently paint with delicate dedication.  





When they finish painting, the children are photographed with their work and asked to reflect on the meaning of their painting. We carefully transcribe their unique stories and insight to share with the world.



“What’s in your heart?”
“The darkness.”
“Why?”
“Because the darkness is very beautiful, there are many colored lights in the darkness; it's so beautiful!"
~ Michael, age 9 (born blind)
Beijing, China. Bethel Orphanage for Blind Children.



This Spring, Hearts of the World will travel to India to embark on an ambitious series of workshops throughout the country. This will be the organization's biggest tour yet, aiming to host at least TWELVE workshops.

Our needs are relatively simple, but to reach as many children as possible requires the generous help of supporters like you.

Your donation provides a child with the following:
  • paint and paintbrushes
  • panel with a heart outline
  • snacks and goodies
  • photos of the child during the workshop for them to keep

Total cost: $8. We can't do this alone! For every $8 donated, another heart is unleashed.


FROM OUR HEARTS TO YOURS, WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

Interested in additional ways to help? We can always use help spreading the word, so make sure to share our campaign through social media. 

We are also looking for any helpful advice and contacts within India along our route, If you know organizations, family, friends or any one that might be interested in getting involved on the ground in India, Please let us know. 


Estimated expenses for two team members, 105 days, 12 workshops, 360 + kids, see more info at   http://heartsoftheworld.org/  


With the power of art and a passionate heart, anyone can paint a brighter future.


"HEART HIVE" by Nicolina

Framed, signed archival 30in by 30in prints available for donors of $5,000
story_txt:
Armed with a paintbrush, kids can transform the course of their lives. With passion and creativity, no dream is too big. 


Since 2010, Hearts of the World, a 501(c)(3) non-profit, has been fostering creativity, self-exploration, and freedom of expression for children around the world through painting workshops. Light and lively discussions help participants open up in a comfortable and safe environment as they quiet their minds from the chaos of daily life and tune in to the beat of their own hearts. Partnering with schools, orphanages, and arts organizations, Hearts of the World spreads the healing power of creativity that transcends international borders. 
We are excited to announce that we are now planning projects in twelve countries over the next five years - Starting with India this spring, 2015!




    "In my heart are my family and education; I want to go to school and fly an airplane, so I can see the world from the sky."                                  ~ Staisy, age 4. Haiti.







During a three-hour workshop, each child is given a panel with the outline of an anatomical heart and encouraged to paint whatever is inside his or her own heart: wild dreams, intense passions, favorite past-times, even deep dark fears. While some simply let loose on the panel in a flurry of energy, others intently paint with delicate dedication.  



When they finish painting, the children are photographed with their work and asked to reflect on the meaning of their painting. We carefully transcribe their unique stories and insight to share with the world.






“What’s in your heart?”“The darkness.”“Why?”“Because the darkness is very beautiful, there are many colored lights in the darkness; it's so beautiful!"~ Michael, age 9 (born blind)Beijing, China. Bethel Orphanage for Blind Children.









This Spring, Hearts of the World will travel to India to embark on an ambitious series of workshops throughout the country. This will be the organization's biggest tour yet, aiming to host at least TWELVE workshops.


Our needs are relatively simple, but to reach as many children as possible requires the generous help of supporters like you.



Your donation provides a child with the following:

paint and paintbrushes
panel with a heart outline
snacks and goodies

photos of the child during the workshop for them to keep


Total cost: $8. We can't do this alone! For every $8 donated, another heart is unleashed.


FROM OUR HEARTS TO YOURS, WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
Interested in additional ways to help? We can always use help spreading the word, so make sure to share our campaign through social media. 
We are also looking for any helpful advice and contacts within India along our route, If you know organizations, family, friends or any one that might be interested in getting involved on the ground in India, Please let us know. 





Estimated expenses for two team members, 105 days, 12 workshops, 360 + kids, see more info at   http://heartsoftheworld.org/  

With the power of art and a passionate heart, anyone can paint a brighter future.

"HEART HIVE" by Nicolina

Framed, signed archival 30in by 30in prints available for donors of $5,000

story:
Get 500 unique royalty-free vector icons designed by illustrator Ray Noland for use online or in-print.


Who is Ray Noland?

American artist and graphic illustrator formerly known as CRO. I currently design data-driven info-graphics in Berlin at: http://ilovestatz.com

I'm looking to create a stylish, colored, super-flat icon set based on topics that are more specific and unique. Ultimately, I'd like to give the library a permanent domain online that is accessible to the world for all-time to come at an inexpensive price.


Why a Super-flat icon set?

I'm trying to supply you with something a bit different. Not your typical web beveled icons. I stay true to the Super-flat 2-3 tone style characteristic of my work.

Have you seen an icon set based on House Music?

Where else are you gonna find a clean vector of an Ortofon needle?

What about Medical Marijuana icons?

With Colorado and Washington State both legalizing the drug and more states in the U.S. on the way...  there seems to be a high interest for the subject but not a lot of good corresponding visual material online.

My icon sets are NOT the run of the mill generic one color You Are Here icons you find everywhere. (As a designer, I have those too.) With these sets I'm breaking-down specific topics AND giving you a bit more detail. You can keep them as is or easily modify in Adobe Illustrator.

Examples of the House Music set...


The Super-flat Icon Library includes the following sets:

Each Set = 100 icons / Entire Set 500 icons

  • Berlin vs. Chicago
  • House Music
  • Democracy
  • Medical Marijuana
  • Technology


Pledge your support and receive

  • One individual set of icons you select.
  • The entire Super-flat icon library.
  • A custom set of icons you propose.
Each icon set contains a Master AI file which means they're vector-based so modifying or rescaling up or down is a breeze!


Nowadays, there’s a high demand

For inexpensive vector icons to customize for blog post, marketing campaigns, websites, event promotion, buttons or logos for social media links on facebook, twitter, soundcloud and other websites. These vector icons were designed specifically with that in mind saving you time... and money.

I look at this as a way to simply service my supporters by giving you the tools you need to help you say whatever you want visually.

  • Low Cost
  • High Quality
  • Unique


If this campaign is successful

My official goal is 2000 €. If I reach that mark, I'll make the entire library easily available to the world for purchase by giving the library a permanent domain online.

  • Permanent domain


Extended Goal

My extended goal is 5000 €. As an extra incentive to get the word out... If I reach the extended goal every backer receives:

  • 30 additional icons based on topics VOTED ON BY YOU!


Help get the word out!

If you can’t support financially, PLEASE INVITE 10 friends or colleagues to my campaign… spreading the word helps just as much!


Currency Conversion Rates

10 € = $14
25 € = $35
50 € = $69
100 € = $138
500 € = $690

story:
The Windy City Burlesque Fest is back and it's bigger and better then ever!

We are bring you world renowned headliners and show stopping acts from around the globe. Are you ready Chicago?  Because we have a week worth of glitz, glamour and  a whole lot of glitter coming  your way!

But before we can shimmy our way into your heart we need your help making this fabulous event happen. 

Your donations will not only snag you some great swag but all the money we raise will go directly towards paying for our venue - 773 theater. 

This multi-stage theater will not only be home to our six amazing main stage shows, it will also house vendors, classes, a welcome party and our media relations. 

The $4,000 you help us raise will help cover about 1/2 the cost of renting out all of the 773 theater for a week.

Check back often as we will be adding new perks as others sell out!

If you are interested in providing a perk for our fund raising please let us know. 

Please share!

http://windycityburlesquefest.com/

story:
Our Rhythm

An artist whether dancer, musician, actor or singer uses his or her body to communicate. 

TREES joins these languages in innovative collaborations performed throughout New York City.We seek to bring together these individuals and create connections of artistic communication while establishing opportunities for artists to speak their voices, in any form, to any audience.  

Hopes

  • Relationships among musicians and dancers for further artistic works.
  • Igniting a sense of collaboration for artist to feel inspired to make art works of all types. 

How you can join

Your money makes our music stronger in these ways:

  • Supporting the artists monetarily.
  • Providing for costs of production.
  • Publicity needs such as postcards and fliers. 

Our premiere performance is August 28th at Spike Hill Brooklyn, New York, and it is only the first note in the beginning of a beautiful song. 

Your donation will not only support this premiere performance, but it will also create a foundation for TREES to further our artistic endeavors to have more performances throughout this year. Share this link with friends and family everywhere so they too can join the rhythm and feel the music.

story:
What is The Scene?

WHRO has teamed up with PBS Digital to launch a new web series called "The Scene". You may wonder what The Scene is and why we are doing this. Our goal is to make an impact in our community by producing video series that will capture and and give prominence to underground, unknown or just under-appreciated artists in Hampton Roads.

Along with our companion website, each episode will tell a unique and positive story about local artists and their craft.  Digital storytellers are documenting specific stories covering a variety of art themes such as street-art, tattoo, sculptures, music, painters, photographers, performance artists, improv performers, and more.

We've created The Scene series so that local artists can tell their own stories as an insider’s perspective about art in our community.  They will share what they want locals and visitors to know about how the art scene is a big part of what Hampton Roads really is.

We have already interviewed over a dozen local artists from Hampton Roads and started putting together their stories that they are excited to share with you and the community.  We narrowed our first series down to eight webisodes based on their story ideas and art, video clips and passion for the project.


Each webisode, once produced, will be shared via WHRO and The Scene, and also through the PBS Digital Studios YouTube Channel.  The series will premiere in September 2014 with the release of a new video each week.




What We Need & What You Get

But we need your help! In order to fully fund this project and make it a success, we need to raise at least $20,000 to fund the production and editing for each digital episode.

So let's exceed our goal!  Additional funds raised will help WHRO producers get out into the community and capture these amazing hardworking artists and give them the exposure they deserve and create a sense of art in the Hampton Roads community.

So we're asking you to support this project, and help share these creative and unique stories about all art in our community.

Plus- we have a lot of rockin' thank you gifts for your donations including:

$1 | Good Karma

That's right, for just $1, great karma can fall on you!  Virtual hi-fives are coming your way!


$5 | Arts Aficionado


Every dollar counts! We will send a thank you email, shout-out on social media and keep you updated on our progress.


$10 | Stick it to me!

Get a sticker with The Scene logo to put on your laptop, your water bottle, or car or wherever your stickers go.


$15 | Steal the Pint

Well, you don't have to steal it, but take one home and show your love by drinking your favorite cold beverage from The Scene & O'Connor pint glass. Plus, you still get the awesome Scene sticker to flash around!


$25 | T-Shirt Please

Show your love around town by wearing the coolest t-shirt, sporting The Scene logo. Doesn't get much cooler than that. As always, a sticker will come in handy!



$25 | Dive into The Scene

Gather your closest friends and come to the newest gallery in Norfolk (Paint Gallery on Colley Avenue) for a themed night of painting. You and your friends will be guided through the process of painting an abstract ocean scene and leave with a finished masterpiece to hang on your wall and remind you of the night you "Dive into the Art Scene." Session includes refreshments, materials and instruction by local resident artist from The Paint Gallery. Sept 26th from 6:30 - 8:30.



$25 | Growler Power + Pint

Pull up to any one of the several craft brew locations in town with your personal O'Connor Growler and The Scene / O'Connor Pint Glass. drink one for us! Plus, remember, you still get that awesome sticker!

   


$25 | Party Pass

We’re throwing a huge party with the help of O’Connor Brewing as a giant thank you for our supporters and of course, all the artists who helped us make this happen.  Your pass comes with one drink ticket – so have one on us as a way to say thanks!


$25 | Out of the Box Picks by Paul - SOLD OUT


WHRV’s very own Paul Shurgrue will hand pick 5 of his favorite new cd’s from the Out of the Box vault!


$25 | Sinnett is now in Session - SOLD OUT


WHRV’s very own Jae Sinnett will hand pick 5 of his favorite new cd’s from the Sinnett in Session vault!


$25 | Desk Top Art from Makers757


Want a cool place to put your business cards or a cool little design for your desk? Look no further than this artsy business card holder with The Scene logo, cut for you out of wood from our friends at 757 Makerspace.


$75 | Laser Your Love


Get a personal session at 757 Makerspace and make your own Scene branded laser-cut plaque.


$100 | Album Grab Bag

Paul Shugrue has opened up his musical library once again, but going old school. He put together a few randomly selected “grab bag” collections of 10 vinyl albums. None have been played & some are still in the shrink wrap. A few samples: Neil Finn, Sleater-Kinney, John Mayer Trio, Weezer, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Dum Dum Girls, Cake, Modest Mouse, Pete Yorn & Scarlett Johanson, Daughn Gibson, Damien Rice (picture disc), Foster the People, Bruce Springsteen, The Strokes, The Jayhawks, Beck & more!



$100 | Two Faces Are Better Than One


Take home an original, just for The Scene, limited print created by Newport News local artist Asa Jackson.


$100 | Box 64

Be one of the cool kids with a limited edition print from local painter Mark Smithwick.


$125 | Dinner with Friends


What would be better than a home cooked meal from local chef while sitting around talking about art with Asa Jackson, Mark Wroblewski and Michah Davis at the home of Robert Roman & Claus Ihlemann in Virginia Beach. Join us on Oct 4th for great conversation and food! 


$500 | Shout-Outs


Bring your best banner to The Scene appreciation party and hang it proudly as a supporter. Plus expect to get some love from the stage in the form of some cool shout-outs and mentions on social media



$2500 | You're The Director


Do you know an artist that you feel is deserving the spotlight?  For $2,500, we will send our Scene production team to produce and shoot a package about the artist of your choice.  You’ll get a copy of the video for you to share, and we’ll post it to our YouTube channel. capture and bring to life an awesome 3-5 minute story.  Jump on this once in a lifetime opportunity to get your favorite artist some much needed exposure




$3000 | Extreme Sponsor - SOLD OUT

Extreme Sponsor

~ Recognition at the end of each of the 8 web episodes (up to 15 seconds), recognition as a sponsor in the weekly Scene eNewsletter and media communications regarding the project ~ Banner ad on The Scene website, 2 pair of tickets to The Scene party, signage at event, recognition from the stage, Tag on all broadcast spots promoting The Scene


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially, but there are other things you can do.  Share the love, check out the site and tell all your friends about The Scene.  If you know of an artist that should be recognized in Hampton Roads, tell us about them.  Even if you don't personally know them, tell us their name and we will find them.
