story:
<<טקסט בעברית אחרי האנגלית>>>


Dear friends and supporters,
After 10 years of collaboration and four years of Glasshouse activities, including exhibitions, live performances, artists-in-residence program and special events that were attended by many thousands of art lovers and fans, we are now working on our book, The Glasshouse In Retrospective.

The Glasshouse is an artistic home-laboratory promoting experiments that are based on art in the domestic space of artists Lital Dotan & Eyal Perry. The book provides an extensive understanding of our artistic activity, and the philosophical, sociological and conceptual processes that accompany it.

The Glasshouse In Retrospective includes texts that deal with key issues in art, culture and society, an interview by world renowned performance artist Marina Abramovic and an essay by sociologist and cultural reearcher Prof. Moshe Zuckerman. Fragments from our own recorded dialogues are also integrated into the book and for the first time shed an intimate light on the processes of this innovative art initiative. All these allow an in-depth view of our art, ideology and philosophical approach that can inspire art lovers, students and cultural researchers.

Rather than seek institutional funding we look to you for support in allowing this project to reach a wider and more thoughtful audience. Supporting this book through this website is fun, rewarding and easy. You can start by getting the book.

Please support our efforts in bringing artistic experimentation to the public. 


We hope you will join us and be part of this journey.
Thank you,
Lital & Eyal

www.glasshouseTLV.com

------------------

שלום לכל החברים והתומכים שלנו
לאחר 10 שנות עבודה משותפת ו 4 שנות פעילות של בית הזכוכית: תערוכות, מיצגים, אירוח אמנים, אירועים מיוחדים ואלפי מבקרים שחוו את בית הזכוכית אנחנו מפיקים את הספר המסכם את העשור הראשון של פעילותנו האמנותית והתרבותית המשותפת

בספר אנחנו מציגים את פרויקט בית הזכוכית, מודל ייחודי המשלב חיים, יצירה, תפישת חלל ומרחב, פעילות חברתית ותרבותית, ובניית רשת אמנים בינלאומית. מודל זה מציע אפשרויות עבודה, שגשוג ויצירה לאמנים עצמאיים וביטול התלות בממסד ומנגנוני הכוח של שוק האמנות. אנחנו רואים חשיבות חברתית ואמנותית עליונה לקידום והפצת הרעיון והמודל של בית הזכוכית ומקווים באמצעות ספר זה להגיע לאמנים, חוקרי תרבות ואוהבי אמנות רבים שימצאו בו לצד חווית האמנות גם מדריך רעיוני לכיוונים עתידיים אליהם אנו מאמינים שאנו מתווים דרך האפשרית לרבים אחרים

הספר שנמצא בשלבי הפקה אחרונים, כולל מאמרים הנוגעים בשאלות מפתח בנושאי אמנות, תרבות וחברה, מאת מרינה אברמוביץ', פרופ' משה צוקרמן ועוד, לצד טקסטים מתוך דיאלוגים שלנו המאירים את תהליכי היצירה והאמנות, אשר ביחד עם כל שאר היבטי הספר יתנו פריסה של שדה מחקרי והגותי מעמיק

בחרנו בחירה אידיאולוגית לא להסתמך על כספים ממסדיים ולכן אנחנו מבקשים את תמיכתכם בהפקת הספר והפיכתו לאבן יסוד חשובה על מדף הספרים של האמנות העכשווית
תמיכה בספר דרך האתר כאן היא פשוטה ומתגמלת- תוכלו להתחיל ברכישה של הספר

תודה
ליטל ואיל

﻿www.glasshouseTLV.com﻿
story_txt:
<<טקסט בעברית אחרי האנגלית>>>



Dear friends and supporters,After 10 years of collaboration and four years of Glasshouse activities, including exhibitions, live performances, artists-in-residence program and special events that were attended by many thousands of art lovers and fans, we are now working on our book, The Glasshouse In Retrospective.The Glasshouse is an artistic home-laboratory promoting experiments that are based on art in the domestic space of artists Lital Dotan & Eyal Perry. The book provides an extensive understanding of our artistic activity, and the philosophical, sociological and conceptual processes that accompany it.The Glasshouse In Retrospective includes texts that deal with key issues in art, culture and society, an interview by world renowned performance artist Marina Abramovic and an essay by sociologist and cultural reearcher Prof. Moshe Zuckerman. Fragments from our own recorded dialogues are also integrated into the book and for the first time shed an intimate light on the processes of this innovative art initiative. All these allow an in-depth view of our art, ideology and philosophical approach that can inspire art lovers, students and cultural researchers.Rather than seek institutional funding we look to you for support in allowing this project to reach a wider and more thoughtful audience. Supporting this book through this website is fun, rewarding and easy. You can start by getting the book.
Please support our efforts in bringing artistic experimentation to the public. 
We hope you will join us and be part of this journey.Thank you,Lital & Eyal



www.glasshouseTLV.com

------------------

לאחר 10 שנות עבודה משותפת ו 4 שנות פעילות של בית הזכוכית: תערוכות, מיצגים, אירוח אמנים, אירועים מיוחדים ואלפי מבקרים שחוו את בית הזכוכית אנחנו מפיקים את הספר המסכם את העשור הראשון של פעילותנו האמנותית והתרבותית המשותפת

בחרנו בחירה אידיאולוגית לא להסתמך על כספים ממסדיים ולכן אנחנו מבקשים את תמיכתכם בהפקת הספר והפיכתו לאבן יסוד חשובה על מדף הספרים של האמנות העכשווית

תמיכה בספר דרך האתר כאן היא פשוטה ומתגמלת- תוכלו להתחיל ברכישה של הספר

תודה

ליטל ואיל


﻿www.glasshouseTLV.com﻿

story:
Help Microtopia flourish!


In a collaboration with the city's kids, a  miniature, interactive city and skate park made from recycled wood with graffiti murals has been designed and installed, built and rebuilt, and decorated and played with by kids (and adults!) who visit FIGMENT's Sculpture Park on Governors Island. 

Since our opening weekend on May 25, we've already had hundreds of visitors, served dozens of youth, and the mini-city is flourishing!

We need paint, wood and other materials and resources to keep the progress going!


Community connections have been forged -- we've collaborated with students at the New York Harbor School on the island, with Bronx youth via buildOn, and with a graffiti art class at the Educational Alliance in the Lower East Side.  (Visit our main website at http://www.microtopianyc.com to see lots of photos and news!)

We've been so successful, in fact, that we need to re-up on paint, hardware, wood, weatherproof mural paper, and other supplies. The installation will be open on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays through September 25th -- that means we need a LOT of paint!

**Please help us stock up, and help us to deliver great public art opportunities to youth!** Since many of the materials are recycled, we are conservatively asking for our second round of $1,500. (We will simply scale down the number of workshops and simplify the mediums used to paint the city if we do not reach our funding goal, or scale them up if we exceed it.)

Put your name on our Microtopia Heros map!

Gifts of $50 or more now earn persistent online thanks, including a link for contributions over $100, in our online "July 2011 Microtopia Heros" map. For $50 a virtual flag is planted on the parade grounds with your name on it. For $100 you will be thanked with a "condo in Fort Jay" (including your name and a link) and for $200 or more you will "purchase" a gorgeous historic home on Colonels Row! (also with your name and a link) Please check out the map which is also a satellite view of our beautiful installation site.


What your money will buy:

10 DOLLARS buys the kids a quart of brightly colored acrylic paint for painting and repainting our mini-city and creating their graffiti artwork.

20 DOLLARS buys a half gallon of piant or a couple of spray cans, and kids will paint your name on the city!

50 DOLLARS buys a 30' roll of spray mural paper and enough paint to write on it, so more youth will have a chance to create full-scale graffiti murals, AND your name will be placed on a flag (map pin) on this map!

100 DOLLARS will buy several sheets of plywood so we can continue building, AND you will be "given a condo in Fort Jay" (with a link to your web site) on this map!

200 DOLLARS will help us rent transportation to move materials to our Manhattan studio space for sawing and building, will enable us to keep up our successful outreach to community groups, youth centers, and schools, will help defray the cost of this web site, AND you will be "given a house" in your name (with a link to your web site) on Colonel's Row on this map! (Click on the yellow-colored houses to see what we mean.)

More about our plans:

As this city is meant to be shared place, please visit us (with your kids, or just bring your inner kid) and create and play in the city. On Sundays from noon to 4 pm we will be available to work with you. At other times, additional programs will be run with guest school groups, artists, environmentalists, and educators. On several weekend days throughout the summer, NYC graffiti artists who make some measure of their living from graffiti will teach or otherwise lead a presentation to the youth about their craft, and this work will end up in our city. We will be making a video archive of these as a way to document the legacy of these artists and their contribution to future generations of youth.  With the potential dissolution of 5Pointz in Long Island City http://5ptz.com/graff/about/, we believe it's crucial to find any and all ways to preserve legal spaces to paint and the positive impact this community can have.

A final workshop (with details to follow)  will be held the weekend of October 1st-2nd where kids will be part of the de-installation and will be able to take home their own individual miniature buildings,helping to bring MICROTOPIA to a sustainable conclusion.


Visit, Paint, Collaborate, Spread the Word!

Please get the word out to your friends about Microtopia, and let us know (info@microtopianyc.com) if you want to be involved with this public project in some way!

story:
WE ARE HOMECOMING!

We are an artist collective based in Fort Worth, Texas.  Our goal is to create interactive art events in the DFW area to foster the creation of a community of like-minded individuals and offer artists an alternative means of making and showing their work.

HANDS ON AN ART BODY

HOMECOMING! presents the one-night competitive art acquisition "Hands on an Art Body." 

On May 19th at 6pm at Oliver Francis Gallery, HOMECOMING! will offer its blue-chip collection of contemporary artworks to the public so to explore the intrinsic value of art within the context of competition. 

Inspired by the film "Hands on a Hard Body", where twenty-four contestants compete in an endurance/sleep deprivation contest in order to win a brand new Nissan Hardbody truck, attendees are invited to place their hands on any work they desire on display within the gallery and remain with it throughout the evening. The last participant left in contact with the piece at the end of the night acquires the work at the end of the exhibition. The participants will endure bizarre installation, social deprivation, and artwork that is designed to resist the contact of the viewer. 

A pre-reception viewing of the work up for grabs will be May 12th – 18th by appointment and the night of the reception at 6pm for three hours before the start of the competition at 9pm. During this time, those wanting to compete for work in the show will need to register and be briefed before the 9pm start. Referees, coaches and cocktail waitresses will be on-hand to mediate and assist contestants. The competition will continue until each work is left in contact with one triumphant contestant, be it hours, days or weeks.

"Hands on an Art Body" explores the object/viewer relationship and evaluates the culture of ownership and value within the context of the art economy, collectors, auctions and competition. Amplified since the era of mechanical reproduction and modern social connectivity, the art object has enjoyed a level of mythos imbued upon it through insurable values, condition reports, guarded display, and published auction results. This stands to compete with the value of the object’s original artistic statement, not often connected to its trophy status and lost in the shadow of its provenance. 

"Hands on an Art Body" creates a platform where the included work is only allowed to function as an “art object” when in contact with its prospective owner. The relationship between the viewer and the object is no longer exclusive but essential. The show’s closing acquisition ceremony becomes less social ritual and more spectacle, as ownership of a given work is not measured by monetary capacity, but by sheer will and determination. The show’s system of acquisition would seemingly decommodify the object through constant contact while at the same time activating its purpose and commodifying it though competition for its possession.

Hands on an Art Body is organized by the experimental art collective HOMECOMING! based in Fort Worth, Texas.

Oliver Francis Gallery is located at 209 South Peak St. in Dallas, Texas. 

The closing reception and participatory acquisition of work will be Saturday May 19th starting at 6 pm. Show previews will be arranged by appointment only between May 12th and May 26th.

Exhibition: May 12th-26th
Reception: May 19th 2012, 6pm - ???
Gallery hours: By Appointment

story: I am so excited to be able to debut several images from my grad school thesis project!  The event will be held at Azul, one of Palm Springs' premiere entertainment venues.  There will be a viewing reception followed by a drag show starring several performers featured in the series.  This is a thrilling undertaking, and it is also an expensive one.  Each print costs nearly $100 to produce, each performer needs to be paid for their time and talent, fliers and promotional materials need to be produced, and so on.  To make this the perfect event requires substantial financial backing, which is where Indiegogo comes in!  Any contribution, in any denomination, will be a crucial part of the success of this endeavor!

story:
LADY Zine Volume 2

LADY is a donation-based zine for the female identifying entrepreneur. LADY exists to prove that we all can infuse our values into our business, workplace, and lifestyle. By publishing honest stories and artwork from our feminist community of change-makers, risk-takers, and believers, we encourage womxn to pursue their dreams. We see ourselves as a reservoir of communal consciousness; embracing connection, sharing resources, and inspiring small steps towards larger change.

Last Summer, we successfully launched LADY Vol.1 "Reclaiming the Body," which featured four entrepreneurs from the Seattle community. We celebrated the release with a launch party at Pruf Cafe & Bar! The LADY community has grown exponentially since then and with our expanded network, we have developed a second zine packed with more stories, more resources, and more art. LADY Vol.2 invites contributors and collaborators to explore the topic "Feminism in Food." We are featuring interviews with three female entrepreneurs in the Seattle food industry, two essays, an open submission art section, and more.

As the LADY team interviews entrepreneurs and designs the zine, we are committed to the feminist value of reimbursing collaborators for their time and energy. We also aim to keep our publication a free and accessible resource for the entrepreneurial community. Your donation will help us cover printing costs, as well as compensate the incredible womxn who have put in time and effort to bring this zine to fruition. If you'd like to know more about our finances, a brief cost breakdown has been provided below.

We feel now more than ever it is our duty to empower womxn and fuel positive relationships. By providing resources for one another through this zine and beyond, we show support for our fellow womxn and encourage each other to pursue our dreams.

What We Need & What You Get

LADY is committed to remaining a free and accessible resource for the community, while amplifying and connecting female-identifying entrepreneurs. At this point, we rely solely on volunteers. Please help us compensate our collaborators and printing costs by making a donation. Below is a brief breakdown of some basic costs we've covered, or are estimated to cover, for this second zine. With your help, we can usher in a new business paradigm that lifts up communities and creates a more abundant world for all!

  • Zine Printing (150 copies): $1,400.00
  • Reimburse Over 20 Female Collaborators: $1,800.00
  • Marketing Expenses: $334.00
  • Total Cost Estimate: $3,534.00
  • This year we will be donating 5% of the funds raised to the CD Forum and another 5% to Northwest Harvest

The Perks

We are offering a perks in exchange for your donation. You can find more in-depth descriptions on the right side of the page. Each perk is paired with a donation tier.

  • $10: You get a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed LADY zine.
  • $25: You get a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Weekly Donor Round-up Instagram story.
  • $50: You get a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1, along with a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine, and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Donor Round-up Instagram story.
  • $100: You get a set of  LADY stickers mailed to you, a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1, a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine, and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Donor Round-up Instagram story.
  • $200: The first three donors get a virtual cooking class with Two Peas In A Pod, a local food blog run by Leia Parker and Sonya Pien. Together, Sonya and Leia will lead you through one of their recipes and have fun creating in the kitchen! You will also receive a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 on the release date.
  • $300: You get your own Instagram story highlighted on our @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. One story includes up to two photos of your profile picture, team, and/or workspace, paired with a description of your business and your values.
  • $500: You get a LADY Care Box! This is a specially packed box filled with goodies from local womxn run businesses. Boxes will be delivered in September when the zine launches. You will also get your own Instagram story highlighted on our @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. One post includes up to two photos of your profile picture, team, and/or workspace, paired with a description of your business and your values.
  • $1,000: You get one dinner outing with LADY’s founder, Stephanie. You’ll also get your own Instagram post to the @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. You will  receive a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 on the release date. And we will mail you some LADY stickers!

The Impact

LADY exists to prove that we all can infuse our values into our business, workplace, and lifestyle. Our current capitalist economy convinces us that we have to compromise our values to survive. That is not true. LADY serves as a reservoir of collective consciousness, reminding us what can accomplish as female-identifying entrepreneurs: more connection, more healing, more equity. 

LADY offers a space of exploration in anti-capitalist business practices and methods. We choose to highlight female entrepreneurs and small business owners based on their feminist approach to business models, often embodying a sense of curiosity, determination, healing, and truth. Building a platform of honesty and vulnerability, womxn are invited to share their truths, their experiences, and their resources. Through sharing, we lift one another up and make collective strides towards an abundant and equitable future. The stories and art published in LADY are invaluable to our Seattle community and to the world.

Risks & Challenges

Entrepreneurs are brave. Carving a new path for society, means stepping away from security and comfort. LADY has been a venture in entrepreneurship and has faced these same risks. Without enough financial support from the community, we risk losing the ability to publish the zine. The published zine has proven to be an important and meaningful outlet for womxn’s stories of triumph in entrepreneurship and a catalyst for empowering a female community on and off line. 

LADY holds two core values in regard to finances:

  • Womxn, and especially womxn of color, must be paid fairly for their work, time, & energy
  • LADY will remain a free and accessible resource, in the spirit of equity and community

To accomplish both these goals, we need your support. We invite you to join us in stepping into a new paradigm of doing business.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that many people in our community are experiencing financial challenges at this time. There are other ways you can support LADY and help us out:

  • Spread the word about our Indiegogo fundraiser. Email this campaign to your friends and network and share why you would encourage their support.
  • Repost LADY's fundraiser Instagram posts to your own feed and story. Include the campaign URL in your bio for easy access.
  • Indiegogo offers sharing tools to make these steps easy for you!

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
LADY Zine Volume 2
LADY is a donation-based zine for the female identifying entrepreneur. LADY exists to prove that we all can infuse our values into our business, workplace, and lifestyle. By publishing honest stories and artwork from our feminist community of change-makers, risk-takers, and believers, we encourage womxn to pursue their dreams. We see ourselves as a reservoir of communal consciousness; embracing connection, sharing resources, and inspiring small steps towards larger change.
Last Summer, we successfully launched LADY Vol.1 "Reclaiming the Body," which featured four entrepreneurs from the Seattle community. We celebrated the release with a launch party at Pruf Cafe & Bar! The LADY community has grown exponentially since then and with our expanded network, we have developed a second zine packed with more stories, more resources, and more art. LADY Vol.2 invites contributors and collaborators to explore the topic "Feminism in Food." We are featuring interviews with three female entrepreneurs in the Seattle food industry, two essays, an open submission art section, and more.
As the LADY team interviews entrepreneurs and designs the zine, we are committed to the feminist value of reimbursing collaborators for their time and energy. We also aim to keep our publication a free and accessible resource for the entrepreneurial community. Your donation will help us cover printing costs, as well as compensate the incredible womxn who have put in time and effort to bring this zine to fruition. If you'd like to know more about our finances, a brief cost breakdown has been provided below.
We feel now more than ever it is our duty to empower womxn and fuel positive relationships. By providing resources for one another through this zine and beyond, we show support for our fellow womxn and encourage each other to pursue our dreams.

What We Need & What You Get
LADY is committed to remaining a free and accessible resource for the community, while amplifying and connecting female-identifying entrepreneurs. At this point, we rely solely on volunteers. Please help us compensate our collaborators and printing costs by making a donation. Below is a brief breakdown of some basic costs we've covered, or are estimated to cover, for this second zine. With your help, we can usher in a new business paradigm that lifts up communities and creates a more abundant world for all!

Zine Printing (150 copies): $1,400.00
Reimburse Over 20 Female Collaborators: $1,800.00
Marketing Expenses: $334.00
Total Cost Estimate: $3,534.00

This year we will be donating 5% of the funds raised to the CD Forum and another 5% to Northwest Harvest

The Perks
We are offering a perks in exchange for your donation. You can find more in-depth descriptions on the right side of the page. Each perk is paired with a donation tier.

$10: You get a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed LADY zine.
$25: You get a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Weekly Donor Round-up Instagram story.
$50: You get a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1, along with a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine, and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Donor Round-up Instagram story.
$100: You get a set of  LADY stickers mailed to you, a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1, a “Special Thanks” listed in the printed zine, and a shout-out on our @ladyzine Donor Round-up Instagram story.
$200: The first three donors get a virtual cooking class with Two Peas In A Pod, a local food blog run by Leia Parker and Sonya Pien. Together, Sonya and Leia will lead you through one of their recipes and have fun creating in the kitchen! You will also receive a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 on the release date.
$300: You get your own Instagram story highlighted on our @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. One story includes up to two photos of your profile picture, team, and/or workspace, paired with a description of your business and your values.
$500: You get a LADY Care Box! This is a specially packed box filled with goodies from local womxn run businesses. Boxes will be delivered in September when the zine launches. You will also get your own Instagram story highlighted on our @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. One post includes up to two photos of your profile picture, team, and/or workspace, paired with a description of your business and your values.
$1,000: You get one dinner outing with LADY’s founder, Stephanie. You’ll also get your own Instagram post to the @ladyzine feed, featuring your womxn-run business and any feminist practices you integrate. You will  receive a digital pdf download of LADY Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 on the release date. And we will mail you some LADY stickers!


The Impact
LADY exists to prove that we all can infuse our values into our business, workplace, and lifestyle. Our current capitalist economy convinces us that we have to compromise our values to survive. That is not true. LADY serves as a reservoir of collective consciousness, reminding us what can accomplish as female-identifying entrepreneurs: more connection, more healing, more equity. 
LADY offers a space of exploration in anti-capitalist business practices and methods. We choose to highlight female entrepreneurs and small business owners based on their feminist approach to business models, often embodying a sense of curiosity, determination, healing, and truth. Building a platform of honesty and vulnerability, womxn are invited to share their truths, their experiences, and their resources. Through sharing, we lift one another up and make collective strides towards an abundant and equitable future. The stories and art published in LADY are invaluable to our Seattle community and to the world.

Risks & Challenges
Entrepreneurs are brave. Carving a new path for society, means stepping away from security and comfort. LADY has been a venture in entrepreneurship and has faced these same risks. Without enough financial support from the community, we risk losing the ability to publish the zine. The published zine has proven to be an important and meaningful outlet for womxn’s stories of triumph in entrepreneurship and a catalyst for empowering a female community on and off line. 
LADY holds two core values in regard to finances:

Womxn, and especially womxn of color, must be paid fairly for their work, time, & energy
LADY will remain a free and accessible resource, in the spirit of equity and community

To accomplish both these goals, we need your support. We invite you to join us in stepping into a new paradigm of doing business.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that many people in our community are experiencing financial challenges at this time. There are other ways you can support LADY and help us out:


Spread the word about our Indiegogo fundraiser. Email this campaign to your friends and network and share why you would encourage their support.
Repost LADY's fundraiser Instagram posts to your own feed and story. Include the campaign URL in your bio for easy access.
Indiegogo offers sharing tools to make these steps easy for you!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi, I am Judith Kornett, sculptor. I live and create in the greater metro Washington DC area, My studio is in the Montpelier Arts Center, where I also teach both children and adults. I would love for you to visit my website JudithKornettArts.com to learn more about me. I have an MFA in printmaking, and have been focusing on ceramic sculpture for the last six years. I my years as a printmaker have had a tremendous influence on my ceramic work relating to my use of the human form, texture, line and color.
I have been  offered the opportunity of having a solo show at Clay Arts Vegas in Las Vegas, Nevada. This is a dream opportunity for me, not only because it is a solo show in a venue far from where I live, but also because the venue will expose my work to an entirely new market of both artists and collectors. I am hoping this show will open many new doors of opportunity for me.
I am asking you to help me make this show  possible.  
I have estimated that I am going to need ten thousand dollars. The major expense will be truck rental: almost $6000 round trip, motels and meals during both trips. In addition I will need money for gas and tolls. Also I will need airfare home for myself and the person driving with me after the reception and then back at the end of the show to bring the work back home. And of course there is the cost of the packing materials themselves. 
Here comes the fun part- there are wonderful and fun perks perks for donating to my campaign!                          
For $10  you get a big fat THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart
For $20  you get a hand made, hand signed card, suitable for framing (remember my masters is in printmaking).
For $35  you get a hand made netsuke-like porcelain pendant, with my personal chop.
For $50  you get a hand made ceramic tumbler with my personal chop.
For $100  you get all of the above.
If you are feeling really generous and want to contribute even more, let me know and we will figure out something very special.
If you can't contribute at this time but would like to help, please help me get the word out! You can use the Indiegogo share tools, or post this on your face book page, or twitter. I appreciate all the help I can get. Get creative for me.

If I don't reach my goal, my priorities will be focused on getting my work and myself to Las Vegas for the show.  Upon my return from the reception I will then explore options such as grants and loans to complete the financing of this project.
I believe that this is a worthy project for you  to support because:
  • Supporting the arts in any way is the ultimate good deed.
  • I have worked very hard during the past year to produce an exciting new body of work for this show.
  •  I am a productive artist who has always worked hard to give back to the community through both career teaching and community outreach.
  •  I have worked hard to put my work out there for people to see and enjoy professionally and personally.  My vitae (see my website) will confirm that I have been consistent in my pursuit of my career as an artist.
  •  I believe that my work has a lot to say to people on emotional, political and personal levels.
Again, Thanks you in advance for all your help. I can't wait to hear from you!
And if you are in Las Vegas Saturday November 8, be sure and come to the reception!
Judith

story:
Hello!

My name is Colleen Friel and I am an embroidery artist from Glasgow.
Graduating with an Honours degree in embroidery from Manchester School of Art in 2010, I have undertook a variety of work placements around the UK surrounding textile art, 3D installation, animation and illustration, grasping an understanding of working freelance. I have recently relocated back to my hometown of Glasgow where I have been working on building my embroidery business.
My work is hand and machine based, and until recently, has been rather restrained in size, focusing solely on intricate detail and composition. A key area for development is for me to push boundaries within my work and expand on the areas I haven't touched on ; a larger scale, new aesthetics and completely different themes. I want to create a brand new platform for my work; to expand the viewer's perception on the stereotypical outlook on embroidery and exhibit a collection of embroidery within an exciting, unusual and eye-catching space.

I am pledging for £5,583 to buy a VW Camper van and use this as a blank canvas for the foundations of my project. Embroidery will be key theme surrounding the Camper van : steering wheel covers, curtains, pillows , gear stick covers , driving gloves and suitcases containing stereotypical holiday clothing will be displayed inside the van, detailing and exhibiting the vibrancy of my skills in hand and machine embroidery and embellishment.
My adoration for my friends, music, film and travelling has led me to a colour pallet of bright blue, orange, red and gold. This finalised the theme and name of my project as Indian Summer. 

This project is incredibly personal to me, as it is primarily showcasing my work to the world; giving my audience a truthful and poetic insight into my life and what I love through embroidery. I thrive to express myself though my work and I feel that this project will act as a significantly important aid into the success of my business.

Camper van's aesthetics are predominantly related to summer, sun, holidays and general happiness and I feel these themes directly relate to myself and my work which was the first thing that I was attracted to for starting the project.

Once everything is made and complete the Camper van will then act as a platform for 3 important stages within my artistic practice. It will be used as a home to showcase my work within my community, be the base for a series of images and short films, detailing my progress through social media, and finally as a mode of transport to travel to summer music festivals in 2014.

Audiences will be constantly involved throughout the making of this project, as I want to create a strong relationship between my contributors and myself.
If a donation of £500 is made, I am promising a special reward to 4 donators. Once the project is complete, every item inside the Camper van will be a separate, finished product. I am offering my contributors to receive a bespoke embroidered piece of their choice which can be designed by them, and made by me!
If a donation of £100 is made, 6  contributors will each receive a handmade cushion which play an important part in the the aesthetics of the Camper van. Personalised details will be added to each cushion for each person prior to making, enabling the contributor to be a part of the project.
And finally, if a donation of £50 is made, 20 contributors names will be hand embroidered intricately throughout all of the products found within the Camper van. Details of exactly where and on what product will not be unveiled until the showcase of the project : where will your name be? On a cushion? On the curtains? A quilt? Or maybe even on the Camper itself!
 Ultimately, once the project is complete, the touring of its success will begin, but if the desired amount is not met, I plan to take what is met to match funding in order for it to be completed.

story:
We need your help!! We have put together a really FANTASTIC event, we just need a few more (thousand) dollars to help take it over the top! Help us change Houston for the better with this one of a kind life altering art event. As you can imagine, bringing in artists from all over the WORLD, giving them a wonderful place to stay, great food, and a great time while they share their brilliant art with us costs a little money. We have already received a lot of local volunteer support in our fundraising efforts but we would love to meet our fundraising goal. With this money we can award our local artists with a stipend for their hard work, create a catalogue with high quality documentation and show the incoming artists the southern hospitality that they all so richly deserve. 

About the festival:

Lone Star Explosion 2014 is Houston’s second international performance art biennale. It is taking place on February 20th-22nd, 2014 in three of Houston’s venerated performance art venues, Box 13 Art Space, Art League Houston and Notsuoh as well as online and in public space. Lone Star Explosion 2014 seeks to showcase performance art that pushes the artists and audience in new ways, especially performance art that questions fundamental assumptions about the way we experience time, space, relationships, the self, society, and sexuality. Visiting artists from around the world have been hand picked because their work offers insight and expansion on themes and practices currently explored by Houston Performance Artists. Houston’s rich and diverse performance art scene will also be featured in the Biennale. The unique, rebellious, beauty of Houston’s own performance art will join with the brilliant expression of our visiting artists, creating an exchange of epic proportion. We intend for every participant to leave the festival full of new inspiration and greater possibility.

Lone Star Explosion 2014 is curated and directed by Jonatan Lopez and Julia Wallace. Ryan Hawk is serving as the Education Opportunity Coordinator and the artist board consists of Kelly Alison, Emily Sloan, Ryan Hawk, David L Davis, Koomah, Y. E. Torres, Jonathan Jindra, Hilary Scullane, David McClain, Daniel Bertalot, Evan McCarley and Unna Bettie. This project is fiscally sponsored by HIVE Village. For information about the founders and history of Lone Star Explosion please visit our Home Page.

Lone Star Explosion 2014 featured artists:

Abel Azcona (Spain), Miao Jiaxin (China/US), Elia Arce (Costa Rica), Carlos Martiel (Cuba), Marcel Sparmann (Germany), Emilio Rojas (Mexico), Aisen Caro Chacin (Venezuela/US), Fito Segrera (Colombia), Autumn Hays (Chicago), Jill McDermid (NYC), Erik Hokanson (NYC), Jim Pirtle (Houston), La Pocha Nostra, featuring Roberto Sifuentes and Erica Mott (US/Mex)  J. Morrison (NYC), David Graeve (Houston), Michael Anthony Garcia (Austin), Emily Sloan (Houston), Daniel Adame (Houston),Nestor Topchy (Houston), Ryan Hawk (Houston), Autumn Knight (Houston), Daniel Bertalot (Houston),Joshua Yates (Houston), Hilary Scullane (Houston), Josh Urban Davis (Houston), Unna Bettie (Houston), Robert Rosenberg (Houston) Continuum (Houston), Performance SW (Dallas), Countercrawl (Houston), Southmorehouse (Houston).

Please visit our website for more updates www.lonestarlive.org

Thank you, 

LSX 2014 Artist Board member Josh Urban Davis (Aka, The Carrot) and The Lone Star Explosion Team

About The Carrot: 

The carrot is the carrot. Some say he only exists in the fleeting cries of orphan children stolen by the wind. Legends tell that he wanders from town to town stealing the essences of widows who have lost his faith in him. A weathered, dust soaked tomb in a sunken library swallowed by the desert describes that he is composed of the vibrations of mischief. Loki would make copious references to him in graduation speeches and eulogies. He is the patron saint of the independent spirit and the shepherd of eccentrics. And if you contribute to Lonestar Explosion, he will love you. Forever.

story:
What the what?

You're probably thinking; Sarah, what the blazes are you going on about? Well, okay, let me lay it out. 

I moved to Chicago about a year ago. Ever since, I've been looking for some type of place I could volunteer and contribute to the local community. And, of course, everyone who's met me knows the "Star Wars Problem" you all like to pretend doesn't exist. Soon I found the 501st Legion. You can find them here. 

Basically what the 501st does is try to promote Star Wars by building high quality costumes, then put those costumes to good use by appearing at charity fundraisers, Make-A-Wish events, kids' libraries, parades- you name it- to raise awareness, excitement, publicity, and fun. I mean, how pressured are people to donate to things when Darth Vader is standing behind them with a lightsaber? 

Unfortunately, there aren't a lot of female characters to choose from, (thanks for nothing, George Lucas!), but one of my favorites was an option! Zam Wesell, the bounty hunter! Remember, she was the ooky spooky bounty hunter who almost killed Padme, then Anakin and Obi Wan with a high-speed chase throughout Coruscant? Cool.

So, I set about making my costume! Turns out, it's extremely difficult. And costly. And time-consuming. So I need a little help.


  • The Costume

This is the crazy getup I'm trying to put together


  • Of course, there's no where I can go out to buy this stuff, so I have to make it by hand, and it has to be high quality enough to be 'movie-ready'.
  • The materials I'm using are pro-grade pleather, custom neoprene, hand fashioned metal links, and heavy duty sewing kits.
  • So far I've got boots, the belt chain, gloves, and various trinkets attached to the outfit! It's about 1/5 of the total outfit.
  • But I've been at this for several months now and can't budget the rest of this costume. Anything you can do to help me would be amazing and appreciated!

Ever since, I've been looking for some type of place I could volunteer and contribute to the local community. And, of course, everyone who's met me knows the "Star Wars Problem" you all like to pretend doesn't exist. Soon I found the 501st Legion. You can find them here. Basically what the 501st does is try to promote Star Wars by building high quality costumes, then put those costumes to good use by appearing at charity fundraisers, Make-A-Wish events, kids' libraries, parades- you name it- to raise awareness, excitement, publicity, and fun. I mean, how pressured are people to donate to things when Darth Vader is standing behind them with a lightsaber? Unfortunately, there aren't a lot of female characters to choose from, (thanks for nothing, George Lucas!), but one of my favorites was an option! Zam Wesell, the bounty hunter! Remember, she was the ooky spooky bounty hunter who almost killed Padme, then Anakin and Obi Wan with a high-speed chase throughout Coruscant? Cool.So, I set about making my costume! Turns out, it's extremely difficult. And costly. And time-consuming. So I need a little help.
The Costume
This is the crazy getup I'm trying to put together
Of course, there's no where I can go out to buy this stuff, so I have to make it by hand, and it has to be high quality enough to be 'movie-ready'.

The materials I'm using are pro-grade pleather, custom neoprene, hand fashioned metal links, and heavy duty sewing kits. So far I've got boots, the belt chain, gloves, and various trinkets attached to the outfit! It's about 1/5 of the total outfit.
But I've been at this for several months now and can't budget the rest of this costume. Anything you can do to help me would be amazing and appreciated!

story:
¡LO LOGRAMOS!

Ayer, 24 de Septiembre, publicamos el libro VIVOS, Desnudos contra el VIH.

¡MUCHAS GRACIAS! ¡LO LOGRAMOS!

Toda la información del proyecto AQUÍ.

Para comprarlo, solo debes entrar a nuestra tienda y comprarlo en línea. Llegará directamente a tu casa.

¡GRACIAS GRACIAS GRACIAS!


¡ACTUALIZACIÓN DEL PROYECTO! 27 DE JULIO DE 2015

¡Hay muchas cosas! Así que primero lo primero:

1. Agradecer a tantas, tantas personas que han colaborado (y siguen colaborando) para que el libro vea muy pronto la luz.

2. El libro ya está prácticamente listo y muy pronto haremos pruebas de impresión, de modo que nos aseguremos de que quede tal y como esperamos: un producto de alta calidad.

3. Estamos FELICES por el resultado de las fotos. ¡Esperamos que ustedes también cuando las vean!

4. También estamos montando el sitio web con toda la información del proyecto, incluyendo -por supuesto- el lugar donde podrán adquirir el libro.Recuerden que al comprar el libro (en formato impreso o digital) estarán colaborando con Adhara Sevilla (www.adharasevilla.org) y su labor en relación al VIH/SIDA.

5. Lo más complicado ha sido planificar las formas a través de las cuales podemos llegar a la mayor cantidad de personas posibles. ¿Tienen sugerencias? ¿Cómo hacemos para promocionar de manera efectiva el proyecto? ¡Queremos escucharos! ¿Quieren ayudar? ¡Tanto mejor!

6. La presentación del libro será en Septiembre. Muy pronto confirmaremos el lugar y la fecha, crearemos un evento para celebrar este acontecimiento y por supuesto ¡TODOS ESTÁN INVITADOS!

7. Otros eventos y posibilidades de difundir el trabajo también se están conversando desde ya...

Esta página de facebook nos permitirá tener un contacto más directo con todos y mantenerlos informados de los avances del proyecto. ¡DALE ME GUSTA A LA PÁGINA Y COMPARTELA! Como ven, no es poco todo lo que se está cocinando alrededor del libro, así que ¡no dejen de estar pendientes de cuanto pase por estos lares!

¡TAMBIÉN TENEMOS TWITTER!

¡MUCHAS GRACIAS POR TODO EL APOYO!


¡ACTUALIZACIÓN DEL PROYECTO! 25 de MAYO de 2015

Varias son las novedades al día de hoy:

1. La más importante de todas: ¡TERMINAMOS LAS FOTOS! Estamos felices de haber contado con la participación de 34 modelos en 24 sesiones de fotos para un total de 55 fotografías que formarán parte de nuestro libro. Calculamos que tendrá unas 90 páginas.

2. ¡COMIENZA EL DISEÑO DE LA PUBLICACIÓN! Gracias a nuestro amigo RAÚ (quien también se desnudó para el libro), esta semana comenzamos el proceso de diseño. ¡PRONTO LO TENDREMOS EN LAS MANOS!

3. ¡LAS RECOMPENSAS HAN SIDO ENVIADAS! ¡Muchísimas gracias por colaborar con nosotros y esperamos que las fotografías que les hemos enviado sean de su agrado. Queremos que las atesoren tanto como lo hacemos nosotros. Nos encantaría ver dónde las colocan en su casa, así que sería genial recibir alguna foto vuestra recibiendo nuestros envíos. O dejen al menos un mensaje por aquí...

¡MUY PRONTO EL LIBRO ESTARÁ EN SUS MANOS!

¡ACTUALIZACIÓN DEL PROYECTO! 16 de MARZO de 2015

¡Saludos! Seguimos avanzando con el proyecto. Las fotografías están prácticamente listas y para fin de mes debemos haber terminado, para comenzar con el proceso de maquetación del libro.

Por tanto, hemos comenzado también a imprimir las fotografías prometidas en las recompensas. Además, ya nos hemos puesto en contacto vía correo electrónico con la persona que también ha obtenido como parte de su recompensa un reportaje fotográfico con nosotros...

¡Muy pronto tendrán más noticias!

Saludos,

Jogreg y Richard

¡ACTUALIZACIÓN DEL PROYECTO!

Primero, queremos agradecer a todos los que han colaborado con este proyecto, por su apoyo y confianza.

Como han visto, hemos recopilado poco dinero, pero tal y como hemos dicho desde el principio, seguiremos avanzando como podamos para alcanzar nuestra meta.

En ese sentido, al día de hoy 09 de febrero de 2015 ya hemos trabajado con 12 modelos, quienes de forma desinteresada, se han desnudado y prestado su imagen para esta campaña. Ya tenemos unas 60 fotografías preseleccionadas para el libro y estamos muy contentos con ello.

Tenemos en agenda trabajar con por lo menos otras 10 personas y llegar a unas 150 fotografías, de las que podamos escoger las necesarias para el libro. Este proceso debería culminar en marzo, por lo que deseamos poder presentar el libro en abril.

Será entonces cuando enviaremos las recompensas prometidas a todos ustedes. De nuevo agradecemos su paciencia y estamos seguros de que el resultado será mucho más interesante y apasionante de lo que se han imaginado.

¡Muchos saludos!

Dick & Joe Photography

"La tasa global de nuevos diagnósticos de VIH en España es superior a la media de la Unión Europea." Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

English - Française - Italiano

¿Qué queremos lograr?

Publicar y vender un libro de desnudos artísticos donde se refleje lo hermoso de la diversidad y que esta sea nuestra principal bandera.

Este proyecto permitirá colaborar con la ONG sevillana Adhara, que trabaja en el área de la prevención del VIH/SIDA, incluyendo la divulgación de información por parte de la propia organización a través de este libro.

"La infección por VIH es una infección que se transmite mayoritariamente por vía sexual. Es necesario implantar y reforzar actuaciones eficaces para prevenir la transmisión por esta vía". Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

Quién es Dick & Joe Photography

Somos una pareja de fotógrafos venezolanos de larga trayectoria en el mundo de la fotografía artística, y en particular en los retratos y desnudos masculinos. Nuestro trabajo puede ser visto en www.dick-joe.blogspot.com.es.

Dick es Richard Torres, estudió Artes, Cinematografía y Fotografía en Venezuela. Ha sido director, camarógrafo, postproductor y productor durante más de 20 años tanto en grandes empresas del sector audiovisual venezolano como en su propio proyecto empresarial.

Joe es Jogreg Henríquez, periodista y profesor universitario, la fotografía es una de sus pasiones. Junto con Richard, ha desarrollado proyectos audiovisuales y fotográficos propios desde hace más de 10 años. Además, ha trabajado en diversos proyectos con organizaciones no gubernamentales venezolanas a lo largo de su carrera.

"Las relaciones sexuales no protegidas entre hombres ocupan el primer lugar en cuanto al mecanismo probable de infección."


Dick & Joe: Desnudos contra el VIH

Con este proyecto unimos al menos dos de nuestros sueños:

  • Siempre hemos querido ver cristalizado nuestro trabajo fotográfico en un libro y una exposición, en una experiencia que la gente pueda ver, compartir, buscar y disfrutar.

  • Deseamos que, a través de nuestro trabajo, podamos colaborar también con causas tan importantes como los derechos LGBT y la prevención de la transmisión del virus del VIH.

Ahora que vivimos en Sevilla, España desde finales de 2013, y que estamos en el lugar propicio para desarrollar libremente nuestras ideas y proyectos artísticos, hemos puesto en marcha la maquinaria necesaria para concretar estos sueños. Y para ello, sabemos que podemos contar con la colaboración de todos.

Adhara, en Sevilla, es una organización con una trayectoria y un trabajo que vale la pena apoyar y valorar, por lo cual, como fotógrafos y como parte de la comunidad GLBT, nos sentimos comprometidos a aportar nuestro trabajo y talento para colaborar con los programas que realiza la organización.

¿Qué queremos lograr?

Queremos editar un libro de fotografías de desnudos artísticos que muestre la enorme diversidad que existe cuando de sexualidad se refiere, para reflejar la belleza que cada uno de nosotros lleva en sí mismo aunque no responda a los cánones establecidos por la moda y el fashion tradicional.

El libro consta de 60 páginas a todo color, que pueda ser adquirido a través de internet tanto en versión impresa como digital. Lo más importante es que el 50% de las ganancias de las ventas del libro serán destinadas a los programas que desarrolla Adhara en el área de la información, prevención y tratamiento del VIH/SIDA en Sevilla, España.

El libro también contará con espacio para que Adhara pueda difundir toda la información que considere pertinente y relevante a través de esta publicación.

Queremos que este libro venga acompañado y promovido también a través de una exposición fotográfica de al menos 20 fotografías que pueda ser llevada a algún espacio público sevillano y/o en toda Andalucía, en el que podamos continuar dando promoción, apoyo y difusión al mensaje y trabajo de Adhara.

English - Française - Italiano


"El colectivo de Hombres que tienen Sexo con Hombres es prioritario para los programas de prevención, especialmente el grupo entre 20 y 35 años."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

¿Qué es Adhara?

Adhara  se constituyó legalmente el 29 de Junio de 2004, siendo fundada por personas afectadas o afines a la realidad del VIH/SIDA, que contaban con una extensa  experiencia en servicios de atención y apoyo a personas seropositivas en otras entidades.

Adhara trabaja actualmente como centro comunitario de atención e información sobre el VIH, hepatitis virales y otras Infecciones de Transmisión Sexual (ITS), siendo la única asociación que trabaja con pacientes seropositivos/as de Sevilla y su provincia y, por tanto, la única entidad que proporciona en dicha área geográfica una atención integral a personas con VIH/Sida.

Para más información sobre sus programas y alcances, visita www.adharasevilla.org

    "En España la prueba del VIH es gratuita y confidencial para todos. Sin embargo, casi el 50% de las personas diagnosticadas de infección por primera vez en 2012 presentaba indicios de diagnóstico tardío."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

    ¿Cómo colaborar? ¡Siempre puedes colaborar!

    1. ¡Apóyanos económicamente! No solo tendrás la satisfacción de colaborar en una campaña para prevenir la transmisión del VIH sino que te esperan interesantes recompensas por ello. Estos incentivos cambian si vives en Sevilla, o si vives fuera de Sevilla, en algún otro lugar de España o del mundo. Además: Adhara recibirá el 15% de lo recaudado para el proyecto directamente y el resto lo utilizaremos como explicamos más adelante.

    2. ¿Quieres ser modelo? ¡Apúntate a la lista de personas que aparecerán voluntariamente en el libro! Dirígete a este vínculo en nuestro blog, rellena el formulario y te contactaremos. Recuerda que estarás cediendo los derechos de uso de tu imagen tanto para el libro de Dick & Joe como para el uso de Adhara para que forme parte de sus programas y servicios.

    3. ¡Apóyanos en la producción del libro! ¿Eres estilista, maquillador, vestuarista, tienes una tienda de ropa o complementos, tienes un bar o un local de ambiente o gay friendly? ¡Tu trabajo puede acompañar este libro! Mientras más personas colaboren, menos dinero necesitaremos. Contáctanos a través de 664 244 651 y conversamos sobre cómo quieres ayudarnos a concretar este sueño...

    4. Difunde en tus redes: comparte nuestra campaña en Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin y cualquier otra red social para que más y más personas colaboren con nosotros en este proyecto.

    5. Y cuando terminemos el proyecto, puedes comprar el libro (el 50% de las ganancias irán para la organización), ir a la exposición y ser voluntario de Adhara. ¡No hay excusas!

    Queremos recompensar adecuadamente el trabajo de los profesionales que nos acompañan en este proceso. Su trabajo es valioso y ellos también deben recibir lo adecuado a su esfuerzo. Si no logramos recaudar los fondos para el libro, lo recaudado será administrado de modo tal que podamos compensar en lo posible a quienes colaboren con la producción de este libro. En todo caso, si eres un profesional del maquillaje, el estilismo, el vestuario, o tienes una tienda de ropa o complementos; y deseas colaborar con nosotros, ¡Eres bienvenido!

    English - Française - Italiano

    "Durante el periodo 2007-2012 el diagnóstico tardío no ha disminuido en ninguna categoría de transmisión."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

    ¿Cómo usaremos el dinero recaudado?

    IMPORTANTE: El 15% del monto recaudado será destinado directamente a Adhara, de modo que garanticemos algún ingreso para la organización, sea cual sea el monto recaudado. Otro 4% iría a Indiegogo como política de funcionamiento de la plataforma de crowdfunding  y un máximo de 5% por el procesamiento de Paypal.

    En resumen, esto es lo que necesitamos para lograr nuestros objetivos:

    1. Campaña para el Crowdfunding: 

    Lanzamiento, eventos, RRPP, Redes Sociales, Medios de Comunicación, etc. 

    (10% del monto)

    2. Producción fotográfica: 

    Estudio fotográfico y equipos

    Modelos, catering, vestuario, accesorios y complementos 

    Escenografía, iluminación, maquillaje y estilismo

    (30% del monto)

    3. Postproducción fotográfica: 

    Edición y revelado digital 

    (5% del monto)

    4. Diseño y maquetación del libro. 

    (5% del monto)

    5. Mercadeo y promoción del libro: Páginas web, redes sociales, carteles, material POP, eventos y RRPP.

     (16% del monto) 

    6. Exposición fotográfica: Impresión y montaje de fotografías, curaduría, lanzamiento y promoción del evento. (10% del monto)

    En el caso de que no alcancemos la cifra que esperamos, el 9% del monto que recaudemos será para Indiegogo, por lo que tendríamos que ajustar el presupuesto planteado.

    Recuerden que lo importante es que el libro se venda ya que el 50% de las ganancias obtenidas serán para que Adhara siga recibiendo recursos para sus proyectos.

    ¡CONTAMOS CON VOSOTROS! ¡MUCHAS GRACIAS POR AYUDARNOS A LLEVAR ADELANTE ESTE PROYECTO Y A HACERLO REALIDAD!

    "La tendencia de las tasas de nuevos diagnósticos de VIH en el periodo 2007-2012 aumentan claramente los en HSH, aunque las cifras podrían estar estabilizándose en niveles altos."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España

    English - Française - Italiano

Lo más importante es que el 50% de las ganancias de las ventas del libro serán destinadas a los programas que desarrolla Adhara en el área de la información, prevención y tratamiento del VIH/SIDA en Sevilla, España.El libro también contará con espacio para que Adhara pueda difundir toda la información que considere pertinente y relevante a través de esta publicación.Queremos que este libro venga acompañado y promovido también a través de una exposición fotográfica de al menos 20 fotografías que pueda ser llevada a algún espacio público sevillano y/o en toda Andalucía, en el que podamos continuar dando promoción, apoyo y difusión al mensaje y trabajo de Adhara.English - Française - Italiano"El colectivo de Hombres que tienen Sexo con Hombres es prioritario para los programas de prevención, especialmente el grupo entre 20 y 35 años."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España¿Qué es Adhara?Adhara  se constituyó legalmente el 29 de Junio de 2004, siendo fundada por personas afectadas o afines a la realidad del VIH/SIDA, que contaban con una extensa  experiencia en servicios de atención y apoyo a personas seropositivas en otras entidades.Adhara trabaja actualmente como centro comunitario de atención e información sobre el VIH, hepatitis virales y otras Infecciones de Transmisión Sexual (ITS), siendo la única asociación que trabaja con pacientes seropositivos/as de Sevilla y su provincia y, por tanto, la única entidad que proporciona en dicha área geográfica una atención integral a personas con VIH/Sida.Para más información sobre sus programas y alcances, visita www.adharasevilla.org

"En España la prueba del VIH es gratuita y confidencial para todos. Sin embargo, casi el 50% de las personas diagnosticadas de infección por primera vez en 2012 presentaba indicios de diagnóstico tardío."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España
¿Cómo colaborar? ¡Siempre puedes colaborar!


¡Apóyanos económicamente! No solo tendrás la satisfacción de colaborar en una campaña para prevenir la transmisión del VIH sino que te esperan interesantes recompensas por ello. Estos incentivos cambian si vives en Sevilla, o si vives fuera de Sevilla, en algún otro lugar de España o del mundo. Además: Adhara recibirá el 15% de lo recaudado para el proyecto directamente y el resto lo utilizaremos como explicamos más adelante.
¿Quieres ser modelo? ¡Apúntate a la lista de personas que aparecerán voluntariamente en el libro! Dirígete a este vínculo en nuestro blog, rellena el formulario y te contactaremos. Recuerda que estarás cediendo los derechos de uso de tu imagen tanto para el libro de Dick & Joe como para el uso de Adhara para que forme parte de sus programas y servicios.
¡Apóyanos en la producción del libro! ¿Eres estilista, maquillador, vestuarista, tienes una tienda de ropa o complementos, tienes un bar o un local de ambiente o gay friendly? ¡Tu trabajo puede acompañar este libro! Mientras más personas colaboren, menos dinero necesitaremos. Contáctanos a través de 664 244 651 y conversamos sobre cómo quieres ayudarnos a concretar este sueño...
Difunde en tus redes: comparte nuestra campaña en Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin y cualquier otra red social para que más y más personas colaboren con nosotros en este proyecto.
Y cuando terminemos el proyecto, puedes comprar el libro (el 50% de las ganancias irán para la organización), ir a la exposición y ser voluntario de Adhara. ¡No hay excusas!

Queremos recompensar adecuadamente el trabajo de los profesionales que nos acompañan en este proceso. Su trabajo es valioso y ellos también deben recibir lo adecuado a su esfuerzo. Si no logramos recaudar los fondos para el libro, lo recaudado será administrado de modo tal que podamos compensar en lo posible a quienes colaboren con la producción de este libro. En todo caso, si eres un profesional del maquillaje, el estilismo, el vestuario, o tienes una tienda de ropa o complementos; y deseas colaborar con nosotros, ¡Eres bienvenido!



English - Française - Italiano
"Durante el periodo 2007-2012 el diagnóstico tardío no ha disminuido en ninguna categoría de transmisión."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España
¿Cómo usaremos el dinero recaudado?
IMPORTANTE: El 15% del monto recaudado será destinado directamente a Adhara, de modo que garanticemos algún ingreso para la organización, sea cual sea el monto recaudado. Otro 4% iría a Indiegogo como política de funcionamiento de la plataforma de crowdfunding  y un máximo de 5% por el procesamiento de Paypal.
En resumen, esto es lo que necesitamos para lograr nuestros objetivos:
1. Campaña para el Crowdfunding: 
Lanzamiento, eventos, RRPP, Redes Sociales, Medios de Comunicación, etc. 
(10% del monto)
2. Producción fotográfica: 
Estudio fotográfico y equipos
Modelos, catering, vestuario, accesorios y complementos 
Escenografía, iluminación, maquillaje y estilismo
(30% del monto)
3. Postproducción fotográfica: 
Edición y revelado digital 
(5% del monto)
4. Diseño y maquetación del libro. 
(5% del monto)
5. Mercadeo y promoción del libro: Páginas web, redes sociales, carteles, material POP, eventos y RRPP.
 (16% del monto) 
6. Exposición fotográfica: Impresión y montaje de fotografías, curaduría, lanzamiento y promoción del evento. (10% del monto)
En el caso de que no alcancemos la cifra que esperamos, el 9% del monto que recaudemos será para Indiegogo, por lo que tendríamos que ajustar el presupuesto planteado.
Recuerden que lo importante es que el libro se venda ya que el 50% de las ganancias obtenidas serán para que Adhara siga recibiendo recursos para sus proyectos.
¡CONTAMOS CON VOSOTROS! ¡MUCHAS GRACIAS POR AYUDARNOS A LLEVAR ADELANTE ESTE PROYECTO Y A HACERLO REALIDAD!
"La tendencia de las tasas de nuevos diagnósticos de VIH en el periodo 2007-2012 aumentan claramente los en HSH, aunque las cifras podrían estar estabilizándose en niveles altos."Informe de Vigilancia Epidemiológica del VIH/SIDA en España
English - Française - Italiano

story:
Short Summary

Hello :) We are two art students from Bournemouth, UK and we have been accepted to set up an interactive arts workshop at this years Secret Garden Party festival held in Cambridgeshire this summer.

Our workshop, 'The Legend of 1000 Cranes' will provide a peaceful and spiritual place for 'Gardeners' (festival goers)  to come and take a perch, rest and to fold and decorate origami cranes. 

The ultimate purpose of our workshop will be to reach a thousand folded and decorated cranes by the end of the festival, which will entail unleash the legendary powers of the crane, spreading eternal happiness, health, longevity, peace and love over all at the festival. Over the course of the weekend, the cranes will gradually increase in number as they hang from surrounding trees and bushes, forming an installation of visual beauty and splendour.

Our concept stemmed from the ancient Japanese legend, that he/she who folds a thousand paper cranes will be granted eternal luck, health and happiness, with the legend also stating that the folder of a thousand cranes will be granted one wish. In Japanese, Chinese, and Korean tradition, cranes stand for good fortune and longevity because of its fabled life span of a thousand years, reasoning why a thousand cranes are to be made, one for every year. Shortly after the end of World War II, the folded origami cranes also came to symbolise a hope for peace through Sadako Sasaki and her unforgettable story of perseverance.

With your donations, we will be able to provide festival goers the opportunity to to come a take 5, relax and get creative, meet new friends and help us reach our target of 1000 cranes, showering all at the festival and beyond with longevity, health, love, peace and happiness. This will be a 'free' workshop, with all intent on providing a fun and creative workshop, to only heighten the festival goers experience of the entire festival.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are aiming to raise £500 in contribution to our own funding to allow us to make this workshop as great as possible. 
  • Money raised will go toward buying the arts and crafts materials like, different coloured and decorative papers, decorations like glitters, sequins, paints, glue and string, etc, along with the appropriate tools like scissors, etc. (Remember, if we are to cater for 1000 people, then we are to provide a lot of materials!)
  • We want the workshop to be a place of peace and tranquility where people can come and relax to the sound of ancient Japanese music and fold and decorate their cranes and so we will need to fashion a sheltered area forming the workshop. Money will go into sourcing materials to make our workshop shelter which we will also decorate appropriately.
  • And of course we need to be able to transport all this over to the festival site in Cambridgeshire from Bournemouth and so the money will help fund our transportation costs.

The Impact

We (Josh and Cec) are students graduating from art school and as much as we would love to fund this project entirely by ourselves, we just don't have the money to do so. As a contributor you will be making this project possible, providing all who take part a moment of peace and calm, and a chance to express their arts and crafty side, ultimately heightening their festival experience. It will not only enable us to facilitate this experience for all who attend providing them with a pleasurable activity but will also give us the self satisfaction of being part of what is a truly great festival. All that's in this for us is to have a great time sharing the and spreading the fun through our workshop   

Other Ways You Can Help

As much as we'd like you to help fund our project, we completely understand that there are many people out there such as ourselves who simply cannot afford to contribute. If this is the case then don't worry! You still CAN help us :) Share Share Share our page on Facebook and other social networks and through word of mouth! Tell your friends and family about us, and tell any of your friends who will be going to Secret Garden Party this year to come and find us!

story:
WE ARE ALL HOMELESS - COAST TO COAST

My name is Willie Baronet. I'm an artist and professor living in Dallas, TX. Since 1993 I've been buying and collecting homeless signs for the purpose of using them in art projects. This all began as a way for me to deal with my discomfort when I was confronted by a homeless person at an intersection, and it has evolved into much, much more. These signs - and this practice - have become a catalyst for conversations about the nature of home, homelessness, compassion, and how we see and treat each other as humans. It has also heightened my awareness about my own upbringing and home life.

In 2008 I began pursuing an MFA in Arts & Technology, which is where my art projects began to mature and take shape. I've produced digital compilations, installations of various types, performances involving the community, videos, photography series, quilts (in collaboration with my sister), and more.

In 2012 I gave a TEDx talk about this project, where I mentioned for the first time a coast-to-coast sign buying trip.

Now that time has come. This Indiegogo project will fund a 31-day, 24-city journey, beginning in Seattle on July 1, 2014, and ending in New York on July 31. My goal is to buy as many signs and connect with as many homeless people as I can. In addition to the art installations/projects that will result from these new signs, there will be a book and a documentary film of the entire experience. Plus, I'm partnering with the Housing Crisis Center in Dallas to raise money and awareness for their program to help homeless veterans.

Your help is critical. The more people who get involved, the more meaningful the project (and the conversation about homelessness) becomes.

What you get for helping

There are some great incentives for contributing: buttons, postcards, t-shirts, signed posters, DVDs of the documentary, books, producer credits, mentions on all our social media. For larger donations you can sponsor one day of travel, or get an original limited edition artwork. You can fly out and travel with us for a day and be in the documentary. For Patrons, I will create an art exhibit in your (or your company/organization's) name. At ANY level I am very grateful for your participation!

Here are some examples of the Perks available if you contribute:

Funders who contribute at the Companion Level ($25) and above will receive a set of five Postcards (in addition to other Perks in their respective funding level). 

Funders who donate at the Voyager level ($500) and above receive the book we are producing from our journey (as well as any other Perks associated with their level of participation).

At the Champion Level ($2500), Funders will receive their choice of one limited edition, large scale print (3 ft x 3 ft) from a series of five.


Budget

Our budget is $44,000, and includes:

  • Airfare (Dallas to Seattle and returning from New York)
  • Rental car and gas
  • Food and lodging
  • Sign purchases
  • Incentive production and fulfillment
  • Professional services (at very reduced rates) including: public relations, videography, photography, editing, layout, production (of the documentary and book), coordination, content creation for Social Media. (My good friend Tim Chumley, who is traveling with me, will shoot the documentary and handle some of the other tasks.)

We will donate 50% of all money above our budget to the programs at Housing Crisis Center for the purpose of providing housing for homeless veterans. The rest of the surplus will be used to fund art installations in as many cities and locations as possible. My dream would be to do one in EVERY city where we buy signs along the way. This can happen!

Thank you!

There is no way I can express how much my friends (and in some cases even strangers) have supported this project for many years. They have bought signs all over the world and shipped them to me, sent me supplies to hand out to the homeless, promoted my crazy ideas to their friends on social media, stood with me at busy intersections holding homeless signs and passing out information to cars passing by (thank you Tanya, Kellye, Ed, Hal, Robert, Rachael, Lisa, Cristella, Dean, John, David, Katrina, Nikki, Lacy, Gary, Don, Carl, Roby, Mona, Shellie, Sara, Shellie, Sandi, Brandy, Reagan, Greg, Laurie, Hillary, Tim, Danny, Laurie, Andy, Jeff, Kim, Amy, Hilly, Danielle, Robin, Emily, Mike, Buddy, Alisa, Dee, Reingold, Heyd, Joan,  Leah, Rachel, King, Chelsea, Stayc, Mary, Sheila, Bruce, Leslie, Kate, Kyle, Natalie, Denise, Janice, Mitzi, Jimmy, Eduardo, Diana, Brad, Donny, Cassandra, Henry, Snow, Dean, Frank, Teri, Donna, Ben, Jenny, Jordi, Muscle Nation, MKP, SMU, UTD, TCU and all the others I'm forgetting). And they have told me THEIR stories of their own interactions with the homeless, proving to me how meaningful this project is.

Please get the word out!

Regardless of whether you contribute yourself, you can also help A LOT by sharing this project with YOUR friends. We never know who might be inspired to participate, so please share this on social media, old media, smoke signals, WHATEVER. Send an email to your friends, family, co-workers. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools as well. 

I'm grateful that you've taken the time to read about this project. It is a dream of mine and I hope you (and all your friends) will get involved. And I challenge you to engage in the conversation about homelessness, make connections with people you might not normally talk to, get out of your comfort zone and engage creatively. I believe whatever you do, you've already made the world a little richer and more vibrant, just by being here. 

Thank you again, with love and blessings,

Willie

Relevant links:

The TEDx talk from 2012

The story on Fast Company blog by Katie Couric

The project featured in Yahoo! News

The project in the Huffington Post

Housing Crisis Center

We are all homeless blog

We are all homeless facebook page

We are all homeless facebook group
