story:
about

Build The Tip is a crowdfunding project by 12s and for 12s to create a lasting work of art that pays tribute to our beloved Seattle Seahawks and their amazing 2013 Super Bowl Championship season.

The vision for Build The Tip came from two die-hard Seahawks fans who believe Richard Sherman’s tipped pass to Malcolm Smith to win the NFC Championship was a moment so pivotal, awe-inspiring, and emblematic of everything great about the 2013 Seattle Seahawks team, that it should be immortalized for future generations of Seahawks fans to enjoy. The play will be captured in a magnificent bronze sculpture designed and built by local artist Kevin Pettelle. The sculpture will pay tribute to the entire Super Bowl XLVIII championship team by incorporating every 2013 Seahawk player.

Build The Tip is in discussions with the Seattle Seahawks organization, Seattle city officials, and various local property owners to choose a location for the sculpture next to CenturyLink Field which will allows fans to enjoy and interact with The Tip on their way into home games.

Every dollar raised in the Build The Tip campaign above the cost of the project will be donated to charity.

plaque of 48

We will place a plaque on The Tip called the Plaque of 48, celebrating the people who made it possible to Build The Tip. This Plaque of 48 will feature four columns of 12 names.

Donate at least $12 today and YOU are eligible to win YOUR NAME on the Plaque of 48!

prizes for donors



media coverage

"The Connection" on KUBE 93.3 FM with Emoree Martin / Radio Interview

Field Gulls / Build The Tip: It Starts Today

KOMO News / Hawks Fans Want to Build Statue of Sherman's Famous 'Tip' Play

Sports Radio 950 KJR / Build The Tip Announcement on the Dave 'Softy' Mahler Show

Seattle PI / Seattle Seahawks Fans Want to Build Statue Commemorating 'The Tip,' Richard Sherman's Famous Play

Sportspress NW / Art Thiel: Sherman's Play is the Moment for a Statue

Sports Illustrated / Seahawks Fans Want Statue Built of Final NFC Championship Game Play

Yahoo Sports / Seahawks Fans Want a Statue of the Richard Sherman - Michael Crabtree Tip

12 for 12s Radio (34:38 mark) / Interview with Organizers of Build The Tip

KISM Radio Brad & John / Interview with Organizers of Build The Tip

ESPN Radio (5:45 mark) / Max & Marcellus


frequently asked questions

Where will The Tip be located?

Our goal is to place The Tip in a location near CenturyLink Field that enables fans to enjoy and interact with the sculpture on their way into Seahawks home games.  We are looking at several potential sites and will announce the official location in an update as soon as possible.   Our vision looks like this:

Do the Seattle Seahawks support this project?

We are in discussions with the Seahawks organization about Build The Tip.  They are aware of the project and applaud the passion and spirit of the 12s, even while they remain focused on the upcoming football season.

How long will it take to finish The Tip?

It will take approximately one year to complete The Tip.  Our goal is to have an unveiling of The Tip at the start of the 2015 NFL season.

Why does it cost this much to Build The Tip?

Our $250,000 budget breaks down as follows:
  • $165,000   Sculpture design, prototypes, foundry, delivery & installation
  • $45,000     Prizes for campaign donors (note: a variable cost, can rise or fall)
  • $35,000     Fees to Indiegogo and payment processors (note: a variable cost, can rise or fall)
  • $5,000        Sculpture maintenance fund and project buffer

If you raise surplus funds, where will they go?

All funds raised in this campaign above the cost of the project will be donated to charity.  We look forward to hearing feedback from donors on which charities should benefit.

Why focus on this particular play over other great 2013 moments?

The Tip commemorates this glorious play because it was such a pivotal and memorable moment we all got to see and enjoy at home, because it sent us to Super Bowl XLVIII, and because it so beautifully represents the team's relentless determination and drive.  We intend for The Tip to celebrate the success and greatness of the entire 2013 Seattle Seahawks team.  The sculpture will include and represent all members of the championship Seahawks team.  And it will pay tribute to the 12s who have kept the faith for 38 seasons, raising their voices and believing in the team they love.

What other work has sculptor Kevin Pettelle done?

Kevin Pettelle is one of the most talented sculptors in Seattle and his work can be found across the Pacific Northwest.  See his website Soul in Bronze for more information.

How can I reach the organizers of Build The Tip with questions or feedback?  What if I want to become a corporate sponsor?

Send any questions or feedback to info@buildthetip.com, joe@buildthetip.com or chris@buildthetip.com. 

What if you don't raise all of the $250,000?  What will you do with the money you do raise?

We plan to use whatever money we raise to begin creating the sculpture.  Other art projects we researched which did not initially raise their entire goal used the funds to begin the sculpture process, which enabled them to raise the remainder of the funding through corporate sponsors.  We intend to do what it takes to complete a world-class work of art and deliver it to the 12s.

thanks to these generous companies & individuals

VMG / studio520 for building our websites and videos
Venture Arts for creating our campaign brand and presentation deck
Blueprint Consulting Services and Redmond Athletic Club for management, IT and marketing expertise
Rain City Redemption and William Cornell for making our trailer video
Jumpit Media and Joe Tafoya for media, social media and marketing expertise
Sports Radio 950 KJR AM Seattle, Dave 'Softy' Mahler and Kevin Shockey for championing and announcing our project
Tracy Legler for project management
story_txt:
about

Build The Tip is a crowdfunding project by 12s and for 12s to create a lasting work of art that pays tribute to our beloved Seattle Seahawks and their amazing 2013 Super Bowl Championship season.
The vision for Build The Tip came from two die-hard Seahawks fans who believe Richard Sherman’s tipped pass to Malcolm Smith to win the NFC Championship was a moment so pivotal, awe-inspiring, and emblematic of everything great about the 2013 Seattle Seahawks team, that it should be immortalized for future generations of Seahawks fans to enjoy. The play will be captured in a magnificent bronze sculpture designed and built by local artist Kevin Pettelle. The sculpture will pay tribute to the entire Super Bowl XLVIII championship team by incorporating every 2013 Seahawk player.
Build The Tip is in discussions with the Seattle Seahawks organization, Seattle city officials, and various local property owners to choose a location for the sculpture next to CenturyLink Field which will allows fans to enjoy and interact with The Tip on their way into home games.
Every dollar raised in the Build The Tip campaign above the cost of the project will be donated to charity.
plaque of 48

We will place a plaque on The Tip called the Plaque of 48, celebrating the people who made it possible to Build The Tip. This Plaque of 48 will feature four columns of 12 names. 
Donate at least $12 today and YOU are eligible to win YOUR NAME on the Plaque of 48!

prizes for donors




media coverage

"The Connection" on KUBE 93.3 FM with Emoree Martin / Radio Interview
Field Gulls / Build The Tip: It Starts Today
KOMO News / Hawks Fans Want to Build Statue of Sherman's Famous 'Tip' Play
Sports Radio 950 KJR / Build The Tip Announcement on the Dave 'Softy' Mahler Show
Seattle PI / Seattle Seahawks Fans Want to Build Statue Commemorating 'The Tip,' Richard Sherman's Famous Play
Sportspress NW / Art Thiel: Sherman's Play is the Moment for a Statue
Sports Illustrated / Seahawks Fans Want Statue Built of Final NFC Championship Game Play
Yahoo Sports / Seahawks Fans Want a Statue of the Richard Sherman - Michael Crabtree Tip
12 for 12s Radio (34:38 mark) / Interview with Organizers of Build The Tip
KISM Radio Brad & John / Interview with Organizers of Build The Tip
ESPN Radio (5:45 mark) / Max & Marcellus

frequently asked questions

Where will The Tip be located?
Our goal is to place The Tip in a location near CenturyLink Field that enables fans to enjoy and interact with the sculpture on their way into Seahawks home games.  We are looking at several potential sites and will announce the official location in an update as soon as possible.   Our vision looks like this:
Do the Seattle Seahawks support this project?
We are in discussions with the Seahawks organization about Build The Tip.  They are aware of the project and applaud the passion and spirit of the 12s, even while they remain focused on the upcoming football season.
How long will it take to finish The Tip?
It will take approximately one year to complete The Tip.  Our goal is to have an unveiling of The Tip at the start of the 2015 NFL season.
Why does it cost this much to Build The Tip?

Our $250,000 budget breaks down as follows:

$165,000   Sculpture design, prototypes, foundry, delivery & installation

$45,000     Prizes for campaign donors (note: a variable cost, can rise or fall)

$35,000     Fees to Indiegogo and payment processors (note: a variable cost, can rise or fall)

$5,000        Sculpture maintenance fund and project buffer



If you raise surplus funds, where will they go?
All funds raised in this campaign above the cost of the project will be donated to charity.  We look forward to hearing feedback from donors on which charities should benefit.
Why focus on this particular play over other great 2013 moments?
The Tip commemorates this glorious play because it was such a pivotal and memorable moment we all got to see and enjoy at home, because it sent us to Super Bowl XLVIII, and because it so beautifully represents the team's relentless determination and drive.  We intend for The Tip to celebrate the success and greatness of the entire 2013 Seattle Seahawks team.  The sculpture will include and represent all members of the championship Seahawks team.  And it will pay tribute to the 12s who have kept the faith for 38 seasons, raising their voices and believing in the team they love.
What other work has sculptor Kevin Pettelle done?
Kevin Pettelle is one of the most talented sculptors in Seattle and his work can be found across the Pacific Northwest.  See his website Soul in Bronze for more information.
How can I reach the organizers of Build The Tip with questions or feedback?  What if I want to become a corporate sponsor?
Send any questions or feedback to info@buildthetip.com, joe@buildthetip.com or chris@buildthetip.com. 

What if you don't raise all of the $250,000?  What will you do with the money you do raise?
We plan to use whatever money we raise to begin creating the sculpture.  Other art projects we researched which did not initially raise their entire goal used the funds to begin the sculpture process, which enabled them to raise the remainder of the funding through corporate sponsors.  We intend to do what it takes to complete a world-class work of art and deliver it to the 12s.

Rain City Redemption and William Cornell for making our trailer video

Jumpit Media and Joe Tafoya for media, social media and marketing expertise

Tracy Legler for project management

story:
Blind Reproduction

Blind Reproduction is a collaborative art and writing project between 13 artists, 13 writers, and one curator. Sometimes we like to call it Exquisite Poop, combining the names of two less elaborate surrealist party games: Exquisite Corpse and Eat Poop You Cat (the paper game), both of which play with hidden imagery. The artists were invited to contribute one of their smaller two dimensional works, and promise to make another. Images, titles, size and media information were then assigned to the writers, who were charged with describing the art as thoroughly and sincerely as possible, as if the work had been destroyed and needed to be remade, or as if it were being forged. Then, these descriptions were randomly assigned to the contributing artists, with a little tweaking to prevent artists reproducing their own work or that of someone working in media alien to them. The artists were tasked with recreating the artwork they thought the writer had described, without knowing the artist or seeing the original image.

The first stage of translation from visual to verbal varies hugely in style and focus, even given stylistic restrictions. Several different writing strategies were tried, each likely to be misinterpreted wildly depending on the artist. The artist's job is even harder and even more subject to the variations of personality and style. The resulting illustration of mis/communication varies from wondrous to farcical to tragic.


Participating artists:

Alexis Duque
Lorra Jackson
Brian Elig
Blair Kamage
Carly Bodnar
Robert Scott
Joseph Materkowski
Samuel Bjorgum
Lauren Kolesinskas
Jessica Daly
David Hollenbach
BMIP
Nick Musaelian


Participating writers: 

Casey Plett
Chris Heffernan
Allison Moore
Kaitlin Heller
Adam Kavulic
Zane Hart
Matt Keeley
Jamie T. Clark
Jon Boulier
Ammon Ford
Maddie Drake
Josh Crowley
Jenny Bhatt


Curator:
Janet Bruesselbach


Janet was inspired to do this project when she took blind gallery owner and retired professor Steve Cannon to art shows and tried to describe the art to him. She found that even conceptual work relied on an attentive visuality sorely lacking from a great deal of art writing. Not only that, but she decided that the spirit of absurd experimentation and attempt toward the art director's rare skill by a wide variety of creators would be worth building a show around. If all goes well, the 13 original pieces and the 13 reproductions, as well as the descriptions, will be shown March 10 - April 14, 2012 at Steve Cannon's space A Gathering of the Tribes.

Thus, we invite you to support our efforts to pay Mr. Cannon's rent and exhibition costs as well as giving very hard-working artists and writers their fair due. We'll also need to make and print a small catalog, and are offering affordable prints of each set of two visuals and a verbal: original, description, and reproduction. You can even get in early on buying a before and after pair of artworks, ready to hang with the description linking them. We'll even let you commission more work, in the form of either a description of the artwork of your choice, a small artwork based on a description you give, or another full iteration of one of the sets, all three artworks you then own. Pledge early to get your name in the catalog as a supporter in larger and larger font sizes depending on your contribution, as well as updates including the descriptions, images, and discussion of the process with the artists and writers. Tell everyone you know, and maybe this can become a series, with new writers and artists.

story:
You can make it happen! - a unique publication that goes beyond traditional forms of paper and digital media.

By supporting Zwykła Maps you help ingenious but little known artists from all the corners of the world.

Idea

Zwykła Maps (zwykla.com) is an initiative seeking formal choices that merge the need for knowledge and experience with expectations a contemporary man has toward traditional paper publications. The initiative aims at creating a form that draws on the potential of digital media. This potential enables low-budget creators to find an increasingly wider audience for their works and contribute to developing collective ideas not limited by space or scope. Our aim becomes a reality as two concepts of albums. The first one is a paper, large-format publication resembling a folding map. The other one is a digital album designed specifically for mobile devices and readers (such as tablets or ultrabooks), which have created a new segment in the publishing market. The idea of a digital album is based on a conscious and reasonable utilization of modern technology, which removes the limits of plain text and still images. Such innovative solutions include the simultaneous use of sound and animation, as well as the ability to refer to external sources instantly through the worldwide web.
However, the two concepts presented above are merely indirect elements of a much larger objective, as our main intention is to facilitate creation and publishing of original works that use diverse forms of content distribution. Content that is highly unusual, we should add, as it escapes defining through our everyday means of communication – our mouths.


(example of B1 size poster-map)

Financing

The budget of a project consists of donations (75%) and own contribution (25%). Zwykła Maps’ idea is to create a publications which will fund another publications.

What we need the money for:

  • printing and distribution of first two maps
  • a folding machine
  • color samplers
  • a tablet for testing purposes (testing digital publications, e.g. for the impact attached videos may have on the device’s performance)
  • fees (PayPal, indiegoo, payment cards), currency conversions, etc.

Broke but still want to help?

Share and publish on your website one of the promotional images! Don’t forget to attach a link to indegoo or directly to zwykla.com

Delivery costs

Perk prices include delivery costs.

First maps:

  • Zine “countenance” – it’s an open form of publication in which you can also have a chance to present your own works related to the subject: a countenance in hands and face. The idea just like the famous exhibition “The Family of Man” (1955) expresses something simple and universal at the same time. Something that is easier to show with an image and emotions rather than with words. Look what’s interesting for us: cotce.tumblr.com , flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21 and send us your Works!

Links

zwykla.com
facebook.com/zwykla
twitter.com/zwyklamaps
cotce.tumblr.com
zwykla-museum.tumblr.com
tauto.tumblr.com

Grâce a toi, ce sera possible de créer une maison d’édition qui dépassera toutes les limites de formes de publication en papier ou en digital.


En secourant Zwykla Maps, tu aide les créateurs geniaux mais peu connu ou meme totalement inconnus de différents coins du monde.

Idée

L’initiative de Zwykła Maps (zwykla.com) recherche des solutions formelles qui unissent la necessité des connaissances et des expériences aux attentes misent dans une publication traditionnelle papier. Le principe de l’entreprise est de créer une position éditrice qui fait appel au potentiel des médias digitaux. Grâce a ce potentiel, les créateurs sans fortune tirent profit de plus en plus souvent de la possibilité de partager leurs travaux et co-participer dans le développement des idées colléctives et illimitées. La réalisation de ces principes est accomplie a travers deux conception albumique. La premiere forme est une publication papier qui fait référence aux conventions de la carte, donc c’est un tirage a grande échelle pliés en plusieurs parties. La deuxieme est un album virtuel projeté pour lecteurs digitaux et portatifs (pe. tablet, ipad, ultrabook), qui forment une nouvelle niche dans le marché des livres. La principe de l’album est un faire-valoir raisonable et conscient des solutions téchnologiques innovantes qui dépassent les limites du texte et de l’image statique en présentant l’animation et le son de maniere simultannée ou en se référant aux matériaux accessibles dans la toile globale qui fonctionnent au dehors de la publication.

Les solutions formelles mentionnées auparavant constituent seulement un élément intermediaire par rapport aux principaux objectifs de l’entreprise. L’initiative de la maison d’édition est donc une aide a la création et a la distribution des publications d’auteurs qui mettent a profit d’une maniere différente la transmission du contenu. Cependent, c’est un contenu exeptionnel car il est difficile ou impossible a identifier en utilisant un appareil de la langue normal, utilisé quotidiennement.


Financement

Le quart des ressources vient de propre fonds. Le reste viendra de dons. L’idée es que les premiers publicacions financent les autres.

A quoi on réservera l’argent ?

  • a imprimer et envoyer deux premieres cartes,
  • a une machine pour plier le papier (une folioteuse),
  • aux modeles de couleurs,
  • a tablet pour tester des publications digitales (pe. pour vérifier si une vidéo mise en publication ne charge pas trop un appareil)
  • a payer l’ingiegogo, payapl / cartes de crédit, convertions de monnaie, etc.

Vous n’avez pas de ressources mais vous voudriez nous aider ?

Vous pouvez également copier une des images de promotion et rendez-le accesible sur votre page d’Internet avec l’adresse d’indiegogo ou directament de zwykla.com

Envoi

Les frais d'envois sont inclut dans une somme de suppléments.

Premieres cartes:

  • Zine « countenance » est une forme ouverte de publication en laquelle toi aussi tu as une chance de présenter ces travaux liés au theme : l'expression des mains et du visage. L’idée, comme une exposition tres connue « The Family of Man » (1955), donne quelque chose de simple et d' universel. Quelque chose qui est plus facile a montrer a travers des images et des émotions qu'a travers des mots. Voyez ce qui est intéressant pour nous : cotce.tumblr.com , flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21 et envoyez-nous votre travaux !

Suppléments:

  1. €20 - Zine-map colléctive « coutenance » dont le sujet est un visage et des mains d’homme. Zin est crée sur curatelle de Kamil I qui dirige le page cotce.tumblr.com et le groupe flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21. Tirage bilatérale, offset, cmyk, format B1 (environ 1000x700mm), papier mat, langue anglaise. Durée de réalisation : 2-3 mois. P.S. Vous pouvez aussi proposer votre propre travail conforme a sujet?
  2. €300 - Ouvrage quelconque de Kamil II kamil-2.tumblr.com – tirage signé 60x90, papier mat, qualité d’archiver. Durée de réalisation : 1 mois. Envoi dans tube en carton.

Initiateurs et réalisateurs :

Kamil III, Paulina Anna G., Kamil I, Kamil II

Links

zwykla.com
facebook.com/zwykla
twitter.com/zwyklamaps
cotce.tumblr.com
zwykla-museum.tumblr.com
tauto.tumblr.com
lukaszwierzbowski.com
witkovska.tumblr.com

Gracias a ti se podrá crear una editorial que va más allá que las formas tradicionales de publicación en papel o las digitales.

Apoyando Zwykla Maps ayudas a artistas geniales, sin embargo poco conocidos o incluso todavía totalmente desconocidos, de todas partes del mundo.

Idea

La editorial Zwykła Maps (zwykla.com) es una iniciativa que apuesta por unas soluciones formales que unen la necesidad del conocimiento y de la experiencia con las espectativas que hombre contemporáneo tiene en respecto a la publicación tradicional en papel. La idea que promueve la creación de la editorial es parovechar el potencial de las técnicas digitales. Gracias a ese potencial los creadores indigentes empiezan a aprovechar cada vez más de la posibilidad de compartir sus propios trabajos o de coexistir en el desarrollo de las ideas colectivas e ilimitadas. La realisación de estas suposiciones se realiza a través de dos conceptos de álbumes. El primer concepto se basa en la publicación en papel que hace referencia al formato de un mapa. Se trata pues de un impreso en tamano grande redoblado en partes. El segundo – en un albúm disenado para los lectores digitales y portátiles (pe. tablet, ipad, ultrabook) que forman un nuevo nicho en el mercado de libros. El supuesto de este albúm es de aprovechar de una manera razonable y consciente de las innovadoras soluciones técnicas que no se basan solamente en el texto y la imágen estática, sino también en la presentación simultánea de animación y sonido o en la posibilidad de las referencias inmediatas a los materiales que funcionan fuera de la publicación, pero están disponibles en la red.

No obstante, las presentadas soluciones formales constituyen solamente un elemento intermedio ante los principos objetivos de la iniciativa. La intencia del editorial es pues la ayuda en la creación y distribución de las publicaciones de autores que aprovechan de diferentes formas para transmitir contenido. Un contenido excepcional por su dificultad o imposibilidad de identificación a través del aparato de la lengua que usamos cada día.

Financiación

Una cuarta parte de los fondos procede de la contribución propia. El resto provendrá de donaciones. La idea es de crear otras publicaciones gracias al dinero ganado de las anteriores.

?Para que se destinará el dinero?

  • el impreso y el envío de los dos primeros mapas,
  • la máquina que sirva para doblar el papel (foliador),
  • los modelos de colores,
  • el tablet que sirva para testear las publicaciones digitales (pe. para probar si el vídeo puesto en la publicación digital no sobrecarga el aparato),
  • los pagos de iniegogo, paypal / las tarjetas de crédito, conversiones de moneda, etc.

?No tienes ningunos fondos pero quieres auydarnos?

Copia una de las imágenes de promoción y dales acceso en tu página web con la dirección de indiegoo o directamente de zwykla.com

Envío

El coste del envío está incluido en la cuota de los donativos.

Prímeras cartas:

  • Zine “countenance” – constituye una abierta forma de publicación en la que y tú tienes la oportunidad para presentar tus trabajos relacionados con el tema: expresión de las manos y del rostro. Esa idea, como la famosa exhibición “The Family of Men” (1955), expresa algo simple y universal. Algo, que se puede presentar más facilmentea través de imágenes y emociones que mediante palabras. Ve qué nos interesa: cotce.tumblr.com , flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21 – y envíanos tus trabajos!

Suplementos:

  1. €20 - Zine-map colectiva “Countenance” cuyo tema es la cara y las manos del hombre. Zin es creado bajo el ciudado de Kamil I qui dirige la página cotce.tumblr.com y el grupo flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21. Impresión bilateral, offset, cmyk, formato B1 (1000-700 mm), papel mate, en inglés. Tiempo de realisación: 2-3 meses.
    Y tú puedes proponer tu propio trabajo congruente al tema.
  2. €300 - Cualquier trabajo de Kamil II kamil-2.tumblr.com – impresión senalada 90x60, papel mate, cualidad d’archivo. Tiempo de realisación: 1 mes. Envío en tubo de cartón. 

Iniciadores y realizadores de la idea:

Kamil III, Paulina Anna G., Kamil I, Kamil II

Links

zwykla.com
facebook.com/zwykla
twitter.com/zwyklamaps
cotce.tumblr.com
zwykla-museum.tumblr.com
tauto.tumblr.com

L’initiative de la maison d’édition est donc une aide a la création et a la distribution des publications d’auteurs qui mettent a profit d’une maniere différente la transmission du contenu. Cependent, c’est un contenu exeptionnel car il est difficile ou impossible a identifier en utilisant un appareil de la langue normal, utilisé quotidiennement.
Financement
Le quart des ressources vient de propre fonds. Le reste viendra de dons.
L’idée es que les premiers publicacions financent les autres.
A quoi on réservera l’argent ?

a imprimer et envoyer deux premieres cartes,
a une machine pour plier le papier (une folioteuse),
aux modeles de couleurs,
a tablet pour tester des publications digitales (pe. pour vérifier si une vidéo mise en publication ne charge pas trop un appareil)
a payer l’ingiegogo, payapl / cartes de crédit, convertions de monnaie, etc.

Vous n’avez pas de ressources mais vous voudriez nous aider ?
Vous pouvez également copier une des images de promotion et rendez-le accesible sur votre page d’Internet avec l’adresse d’indiegogo ou directament de zwykla.com
Envoi
Les frais d'envois sont inclut dans une somme de suppléments.
Premieres cartes:

Zine « countenance » est une forme ouverte de publication en laquelle toi aussi tu as une chance de présenter ces travaux liés au theme : l'expression des mains et du visage. L’idée, comme une exposition tres connue « The Family of Man » (1955), donne quelque chose de simple et d' universel. Quelque chose qui est plus facile a montrer a travers des images et des émotions qu'a travers des mots. Voyez ce qui est intéressant pour nous : cotce.tumblr.com , flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21 et envoyez-nous votre travaux !

Suppléments:

€20 - Zine-map colléctive « coutenance » dont le sujet est un visage et des mains d’homme. Zin est crée sur curatelle de Kamil I qui dirige le page cotce.tumblr.com et le groupe flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21. Tirage bilatérale, offset, cmyk, format B1 (environ 1000x700mm), papier mat, langue anglaise. Durée de réalisation : 2-3 mois. P.S. Vous pouvez aussi proposer votre propre travail conforme a sujet?
€300 - Ouvrage quelconque de Kamil II kamil-2.tumblr.com – tirage signé 60x90, papier mat, qualité d’archiver. Durée de réalisation : 1 mois. Envoi dans tube en carton.

Initiateurs et réalisateurs :
Kamil III, Paulina Anna G., Kamil I, Kamil II
Links
zwykla.comfacebook.com/zwyklatwitter.com/zwyklamapscotce.tumblr.comzwykla-museum.tumblr.comtauto.tumblr.comlukaszwierzbowski.comwitkovska.tumblr.com


Gracias a ti se podrá crear una editorial que va más allá que las formas tradicionales de publicación en papel o las digitales. Apoyando Zwykla Maps ayudas a artistas geniales, sin embargo poco conocidos o incluso todavía totalmente desconocidos, de todas partes del mundo.
Idea
La editorial Zwykła Maps (zwykla.com) es una iniciativa que apuesta por unas soluciones formales que unen la necesidad del conocimiento y de la experiencia con las espectativas que hombre contemporáneo tiene en respecto a la publicación tradicional en papel. La idea que promueve la creación de la editorial es parovechar el potencial de las técnicas digitales. Gracias a ese potencial los creadores indigentes empiezan a aprovechar cada vez más de la posibilidad de compartir sus propios trabajos o de coexistir en el desarrollo de las ideas colectivas e ilimitadas. La realisación de estas suposiciones se realiza a través de dos conceptos de álbumes. El primer concepto se basa en la publicación en papel que hace referencia al formato de un mapa. Se trata pues de un impreso en tamano grande redoblado en partes. El segundo – en un albúm disenado para los lectores digitales y portátiles (pe. tablet, ipad, ultrabook) que forman un nuevo nicho en el mercado de libros. El supuesto de este albúm es de aprovechar de una manera razonable y consciente de las innovadoras soluciones técnicas que no se basan solamente en el texto y la imágen estática, sino también en la presentación simultánea de animación y sonido o en la posibilidad de las referencias inmediatas a los materiales que funcionan fuera de la publicación, pero están disponibles en la red.No obstante, las presentadas soluciones formales constituyen solamente un elemento intermedio ante los principos objetivos de la iniciativa. La intencia del editorial es pues la ayuda en la creación y distribución de las publicaciones de autores que aprovechan de diferentes formas para transmitir contenido. Un contenido excepcional por su dificultad o imposibilidad de identificación a través del aparato de la lengua que usamos cada día.
Financiación
Una cuarta parte de los fondos procede de la contribución propia. El resto provendrá de donaciones.
La idea es de crear otras publicaciones gracias al dinero ganado de las anteriores.
?Para que se destinará el dinero?

el impreso y el envío de los dos primeros mapas,
la máquina que sirva para doblar el papel (foliador),
los modelos de colores,
el tablet que sirva para testear las publicaciones digitales (pe. para probar si el vídeo puesto en la publicación digital no sobrecarga el aparato),
los pagos de iniegogo, paypal / las tarjetas de crédito, conversiones de moneda, etc.

?No tienes ningunos fondos pero quieres auydarnos?
Copia una de las imágenes de promoción y dales acceso en tu página web con la dirección de indiegoo o directamente de zwykla.com
Envío
El coste del envío está incluido en la cuota de los donativos.
Prímeras cartas:

Zine “countenance” – constituye una abierta forma de publicación en la que y tú tienes la oportunidad para presentar tus trabajos relacionados con el tema: expresión de las manos y del rostro. Esa idea, como la famosa exhibición “The Family of Men” (1955), expresa algo simple y universal. Algo, que se puede presentar más facilmentea través de imágenes y emociones que mediante palabras. Ve qué nos interesa: cotce.tumblr.com , flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21 – y envíanos tus trabajos!

Suplementos:

€20 - Zine-map colectiva “Countenance” cuyo tema es la cara y las manos del hombre. Zin es creado bajo el ciudado de Kamil I qui dirige la página cotce.tumblr.com y el grupo flickr.com/groups/1622167@N21. Impresión bilateral, offset, cmyk, formato B1 (1000-700 mm), papel mate, en inglés. Tiempo de realisación: 2-3 meses.Y tú puedes proponer tu propio trabajo congruente al tema.
€300 - Cualquier trabajo de Kamil II kamil-2.tumblr.com – impresión senalada 90x60, papel mate, cualidad d’archivo. Tiempo de realisación: 1 mes. Envío en tubo de cartón. 

Iniciadores y realizadores de la idea:
Kamil III, Paulina Anna G., Kamil I, Kamil II
Links
zwykla.comfacebook.com/zwyklatwitter.com/zwyklamapscotce.tumblr.comzwykla-museum.tumblr.comtauto.tumblr.com

story:
I am about to begin a training program with Shiloh Sophia McCloud called "The Color of Women".  The purpose of the training is for me to learn Shiloh's method of Intentional Creativity and then be able to go into my community and teach workshops based on her method but with my own themes and content.  Intentional Creativity is about helping each person to take a transformational journey into their own creativity. The process starts with an inner journey, a meditation, to connect to you inner self.  Questions are asked of the self and journaling begins.  Sketches put the symbols and ideas onto paper.  The painting process then begins and the image given in the journey begin to take form.

In Shiloh's own words:

"The Color of Woman Method 13 Step Painting process is at the heart of our work which is a method of painting that allows for anyone to create a painting. The process leads you on a journey through your own soul story and layer by layer reveals insight and healing. It isn’t based on skill, because it draws from within instead of referencing external images. The Color of Woman Training is designed to connect you with what truly lights you up and activates you towards creating a life that expresses your innermost longing and desires. This training is designed to give you access to … you!
To show you how to find and express your own information.

I have already completed on painting myself using Shiloh's method and can confirm the power of the process.  I had an unexpected and powerful experience.  In the next 6 months I will be continuing this journey as I undertake the training.

I feel very strongly that art can be used to heal. I began making art using clay over 15 years ago when I was in my late 30's. I had not been encouraged to be an artist when I  was younger. I became so passionate about art that I returned to college and earned a BFA and an MFA in ceramics as an older student..  My intention was to become a college professor and professional artist.  After graduating and beginning teaching at local colleges, I have found that something is still missing.  My spiritual life and my teaching life seemed disconnected.  I was searching for an answer that would allow me to make art and also help others discover and connect to their own creativity, especially people who do not feel that they are creative.  I was led  by Spirit to Shiloh Sophia McCloud this past fall.  I knew instantly that what Shiloh was teaching was what I was looking for. Her training gives me a framework to use to help others tap into their innate creativity and transform and heal their lives. I am about to begin her Color of Women training this spring.  I am anxious to bring this to the women in my community and have plans to hold workshops for women of all ages.  This method can be used to facilitate healing and it lends itself to many themes.  I am hoping to work with women who have been abused and women who have had breast cancer. Our planet and the people on it need so much healing at this point in time and I believe very strongly in the use of art to accomplish this. The training is expensive so I am asking for help to cover the tuition and materials.  I am hoping to raise $6000 to cover the bulk of the training. I would appreciate any help that you are able to give. I am offering some of my ceramic art as gifts if you donate and I am also offering a chance to pre-book workshops at a reduced price if you live near me in the Lawrence, KS or Kansas City area. It would also be a big help if you could spread the word about my campaign to your friends and families! 

Please watch the attached video!  It shows the painting process and also has images of the perks!

story:
My name is Arlee Woodworth, and I am a painter. I will be the Artist in Residence at AS220 in Providence, Rhode Island for the month of January.  

My goal for the residency is to create one painting a day for the whole month. At the end of the month I will have thirty oil paintings, ranging in size from 8"x8" to 10"x12". 

My work floats between the representational landscape world to the abstract painting realm. I want the viewer to move between what is real and what is intangible. I experiment with this idea by playing with foreground and background. A rush from the foreground to the distance fundamentally changes the relationship to the scene by physically juxtaposing different spaces. I pick out pieces of the landscape - certain colors and shapes. I interpret my paintings as I work; I make decisions and put paint down. Each mark reacts to the next - adding, subtracting, inserting, overlapping - keeping in mind that the painting is always an object first. 

I hope to fund this project by selling my paintings in advance. All the money raised will help me with materials and food during my residency. For each pledge of $100, you will receive one original oil painting from my time at AS200. Funders will also receive weekly updates on my project via email. I am excited to mail you a painting!

To see more of my work, please visit arleewoodworth.blogspot.com

story:
I have been artist for more than fifty years with a record of exhibitions both nationally and internationally  Throughout this time I have had an continuing interest in myth and the people and objects that symbolize them.

Zeus as a rap star? Why not? Both stereotypes are short tempered, throw
thunderbolts, chase far too many women and have an arrogance of … mythic proportions. Gaea, the Earth Mother with a
silicon enhanced, but abused body? Atlas as a weary soldier on his third
deployment (to Mt. Olympus… or its 21st century equivalent). Many of the
myths we automatically associate with Greece have their roots in other
cultures, Zeus is also Ra, the Sun God and Shango in the Yoruba culture. I am
working with all of these elements in this current series.

My recent work follows in the tradition of artists, over the centuries,
revisiting myths, their universal messages and re-envisioning them in a
contemporary form. A great many cultures around the world both past and
present, assign the hero, heroines and gods found in their myths with
surprisingly human traits leading inevitably to conflict, jealousies and even
death. Infidelity, kidnapping, incest and a variety of forms of killing seem to
occupy myths as much as they do the tabloid headlines. Figures such as Zeus
have almost exact counterparts in myths worldwide. All this considered, it’s no wonder myths are revisited by artists time and
again

This exhibition is designed to bring the importance of the sketch to the creative process and the ongoing impact of the relevancy of myths to a 21st century audience and your help is vitally needed in making this exhibition a success.

The funds that we raise will be used in two areas, preparation for mounting the exhibition (including framing, and gallery signage) and the production of a catalogue featuring images of works in the exhibition and a short essay on the power of sketching and myths.

There are many ways that you can assist and for doing so there are many ways that we can thank you. They range from an autographed invitation to the exhibition to your receiving a painting a year for five years. Please read the perks listed here!

I hope you will join with me in making this exhibition a success both creatively and by increasing the appreciation of myths and the sketch. Please pass this on to other who you think would enjoy being part of this adventure. Thank you.

story:
Free the Artist

  • Maria Coletsis has been working with photography since her teens, her high school had a dark room and this inspired her creative process. She continued to study photography, first at Vancouver’s Emily Carr Institute of Art and Design and then the graduate program at the San Francisco Institute of Art and Design where she received her Master of Fine Arts Degree. She has had 15 solo art exhibitions and has been included in over 20 international group shows. 

  • While working free lance in London UK, Maria developed a friendship with a London-based Dominatrix, as she got to know her better she realized this woman was in a very unique position of power within this subculture community. This was in line with her continuing investigation of societies’ layered interpretations versus self-expression of feminine identities; the idea of the book was born. Maria realized that to make this a strong social document she would need to look at this profession from a global perspective.

    Maria undertook the task and overcame the challenges to gather the material necessary to create this unique visual social document. After five years of planning 13 worldwide interviews and photo shoots, she was ready to create the book. After a year of hard work designing, editing and laying out the book, she was ready to publish. After months of frustration approaching publishers, Maria reached an agreement with a Toronto publisher who would handle the distribution and she would finance the printing.

  • Maria met some of the world’s most prominent Dominas, and gained access to areas of their lives very few see. For the reader these women open themselves to talk about their emotional lives which accompany the profession of Domination. This book is a testimony to not only Maria's ability as an artist but also to her warm personality to draw out her subjects from their otherwise hidden dungeons in such cities as London, Paris, Tokyo, Sydney and Las Vegas. It is a strong and unique visual social document of contemporary attitudes towards sexuality.

  • About me, I am a hard working guy who loves the outdoors, over the last 15 years I have been helping artists create a web presence. Maria has been my friend for over 20 years, I have watched her work hard, investing time and money to create art.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to sell out the print run, recoup Maria's financial investment in this project. Your support will enable Maria to reinvest in her current works, and make room to work in her studio.

  • We have set a goal of $10,000. All funds will go directly to Maria, all perks will be shipped by Maria within 7 business days.
  • Your Perks

    •                   

  • Behind the Whip Photography Book: 200 pages 9" x 12" full colour, printed hardcover with dust jacket, shipping included.
  • Digital download of the 30 minute documentary of the making of the book.
  • The Book Plus one 8" x 10" print you pick from the print gallery.
  • 1 of 10 limited edition Latex on Vinyl Prints 24" x 24" Plus the Book.
  • Latex on Vinyl print 36" x 36", "Mistress Vanessa Latex Hood" Plus the Book.
  • Click here to view the print gallery

  • View of book launch and multimedia exhibition at the De Luca Gallery in Toronto, Canada. For more information, visit www.behindthewhip.com 

  • click here to view the print gallery

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Folks please make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Maria thanks you for your support.

Maria's Homepage

story:
Short Summary

I'm a fifteen year old homeschooled girl and I've been running my own business in traditional art mediums for the past two years (or so), have had several commissions, and have been to several local art events. I love creating. Painting, drawing, writing, photography... However, I'm only able to take pictures with my phone camera, and while it's still something, I can't pursue the artform fully without an actual camera.

I've always, always loved photography, but never had the funds to pursue it. Ever since I was little, I've loved taking pictures of my cats, architecture, and especially the outdoors. Recently I've been very burned out on creating something on paper or canvas, and I can't bring myself to create there, but as usual, I can spend hours snapping away pictures from my phone.

Photography is a dream of mine, something I've wanted to do since I was a kid, and have always admired, but the funds were just never there. It would be absolutely amazing to make this happen. ♥

What I Need & What You Get

I'm setting the funding goal at $700, so it covers the following:

  • Nikon D3100 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm VR lens
  • Memory card for the camera
  • Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 4, for editing
  • 5 Reflector Discs for lighting effect
  • IndieGoGo fees

If I don't reach the $700 goal by the time this ends, I'll buy what I can, and then work my way up to getting the other items. 

 

The Impact

Like I stated in the Summary above, I've always loved photography and have always held a high admiration for it. I love expressing creativity, and in my paintings I enjoy expressing emotion and often darker meanings. Photography would enable me to do just that, only better. I want to bring out a deeper level of emotion combined with a sense of dream-like cloudiness, surrealism, and wonder. Over the last few years, I've kept thinking of concepts for several series of art, that I would only be able to capture behind a camera, and I would finally be able to bring that dream into reality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can donate money, but even a share to your favourite social networks, such as Facebook and Twitter would be greatly appreciated. Every little bit helps. ♥

 

~ Destynnie Hall

I love creating. Painting, drawing, writing, photography... However, I'm only able to take pictures with my phone camera, and while it's still something, I can't pursue the artform fully without an actual camera.
I've always, always loved photography, but never had the funds to pursue it. Ever since I was little, I've loved taking pictures of my cats, architecture, and especially the outdoors. Recently I've been very burned out on creating something on paper or canvas, and I can't bring myself to create there, but as usual, I can spend hours snapping away pictures from my phone.
Photography is a dream of mine, something I've wanted to do since I was a kid, and have always admired, but the funds were just never there. It would be absolutely amazing to make this happen. ♥


What I Need & What You Get
I'm setting the funding goal at $700, so it covers the following:

Nikon D3100 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm VR lens
Memory card for the camera
Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 4, for editing
5 Reflector Discs for lighting effect
IndieGoGo fees

If I don't reach the $700 goal by the time this ends, I'll buy what I can, and then work my way up to getting the other items. 
 


The Impact
Like I stated in the Summary above, I've always loved photography and have always held a high admiration for it. I love expressing creativity, and in my paintings I enjoy expressing emotion and often darker meanings. Photography would enable me to do just that, only better. I want to bring out a deeper level of emotion combined with a sense of dream-like cloudiness, surrealism, and wonder. Over the last few years, I've kept thinking of concepts for several series of art, that I would only be able to capture behind a camera, and I would finally be able to bring that dream into reality.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can donate money, but even a share to your favourite social networks, such as Facebook and Twitter would be greatly appreciated. Every little bit helps. ♥
 
~ Destynnie Hall

story:
My love for abandoned buildings and it's haunted history has always intrigued me, Years ago, I used to write articles for readjunk.com about my adventures and ghost stories from these places. The article writing soon led to photography in these places. Either just the buildings, or covering my friends up in blood and doing horror themed photo shoots.
Still, ten years later, I get at least 10 emails a week regarding my articles. People asking where these places are, or just asking more about the history of these places.  The idea came to me that I should just write a book about my experiences, as well as include my photography. I've always wanted to publish my photos in book form, and write a book anyways, so why not do this!
I'm just about half way done with it, and looking to fund the publishing part.
I'll be doing a full release at Pensacon 2016, and purchasing enough books to sell at the convention will end up being costly unless I do it in bulk, so this campaign is to help get the finished copies of the book, as well as paying to find a set publisher so that one day it can be sold in stores, and not just through amazon or through me.
Photography and writing are my passions. Throw in abandoned buildings and ghost stories and it's what I do love doing more than anything.
This book means the world to me, and has been a long time coming.
Thanks for reading all this, and if you donate, THANK YOU!! :)

story:
WHO WE ARE

Can Can Wonderland founders are Christi Atkinson, Rob Clapp, Chris Pennington, and Jennifer Pennington.  We are the people behind such seminal Twin Cities art projects as Walker Artist Designed Mini golf, the Ten Second Film Festival and Soap Factory’s Haunted Basement.  But we would not be Can Can Wonderland without the artists, fabricators and professionals that are joining together to create this unique arts destination. To-date, Can Can Wonderland has a population of 71 collaborators, and we are growing every day.

(our rockstar founders pictured above; below is a gathering of some of our artist collaborators presenting their mini golf holes!)


WHAT IS CAN CAN WONDERLAND?

Can Can Wonderland is a mini golf course.  We didn’t design it though.  We asked the mini golf enthusiasts of the world to do that.  We sent out a call for artists asking “What is the mini golf hole you have always wanted to play?” We received over 200 proposals from all over the country and as far away as Australia. A jury of talented architects, visual artists, fabricators, and electrical engineers helped us select the 18 mini golf holes to be built for our course, and we believe they are spectacular!

But Can Can Wonderland isn’t just mini golf; it’s a wonderland full of arts-based fauna and flora for you to explore and delight in! Our boardwalk is full of attractions and amusements (created by/with artists). Our two stages offer a wide array of local and regional talents.  We have beer. We have noshes! We even have a few unicorns.


BUILDING A NATIONAL TREASURE AIN'T CHEAP!

“I’m sick of following my dreams. I’m just going to ask them where they’re going and hook up with them later. “  - Mitch Hedberg

WHAT WE NEED

We have been dreaming about mini golf for ages, and we have a big vision for this project. We are creating an arts-immersive environment that includes mini golf, a boardwalk of amusements, two stages, a restaurant, bar, and a cafe and old fashioned soda fountain.

Of course, this project needs money to get off the ground, and crowdfunding is a nice way to help do that, but to us, the most important part of crowdfunding is the crowd part.  What’s worth more than money?  Energy!  People believing in the project.  People wanting to help see it through.  Can Can Wonderland needs the love and support of the community to make the engine turn over. A contribution in ANY amount is the vote of confidence that we need.  The dollars are gas in the tank.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $40,000 from the community. The monies raised here are ear marked for two purposes: to complete the mini golf course and build the boardwalk of amusements. Stay tuned and we will be releasing a new video in the coming weeks so you can get to know our artists!


THE IMPACT

The Twin Cities is a diverse region, yet most places are mono-culture. Studies show that diverse audiences come together for fun, recreational activities, for unique experiences. We aim to create an arts-immersive place that has something for everyone.

We are using a new business model. Because we are for profit we will be consumer-driven to survive. What attracts people? Fun! But we don't want this to be cookie-cutter. We want the scrappiness, edginess, whimsy, joy, imagination, vision to create something that would be difficult to replicate, that is uniquely an arts place in St. Paul, that will become a national treasure.

We became one of the first public benefit corporations in Minnesota because we have specific values that we want to support. To be an economic engine for the arts means that we will build new audiences for the arts and provide ongoing paid opportunities for artists. We are also exploring ways to expand those paid opportunities through profit sharing. Treating artists well also translates to treating our employees well - not every employee will start out at a living wage initially, but they will all start out above minimum wage, and it is our goal to move all employees into a living wage.


WHAT YOU GET (i.e. PERKS!)

Beside that epic feeling of helping something you believe in grow we wanted to come up with some #cancantastic perks that you will be proud to rep. As we noodled on this piece of the puzzle we reached out to our community and man is it  good to have old friends who will help you in your hour of need.  Especially when they are kick ass artists! Check out the column to the right to see all the treasures that are available. As a little extra incentive we are making some rad Can Can Wonderland buttons that are free for the first 100 contributors!

Here is a sampling of the goodies coming at you:

Renowned jewelry designer (Super) Karin Jacobson has created a mini golf inspired, visually edible set of rings exclusively for Can Can Wonderland crowdfunding efforts!  We only wish we had more fingers.


Put A Ring On It - $25 perk, Minneapolis treasure maker, Karin Jacobson, designed this exclusive set of three rings


#CANCANTASTIC- $40, Add some bling to those tweeting fingers! Karin's back with this exclusive set of 5 whimsical rings -diamond, flying saucer, heart, star, and #CANCANTASTIC!

DIY design magnates Aesthetic Apparatus crafted our stellar logo/brand and have created a limited edition art print that you can wear right out the front door!  (Strut Your Can Can - $30, a small batch run of AA designed t-shirts, made just for our Indiegogo crew!


Prepare for your garage to start turning heads when internationally known muralist John Grider of Broken Crow makes a house call you won’t soon forget.

Garage D'Or - $850 A rare and wonderful opportunity for you to bling out that garage of yours with original art by John Grider of Broken Crow.

We have lots of other perks design to help you and crew get first dibs on taking over our space, from mini golf passes you can use any day we are open (May The Fore Be With You -$50, for 4 folks to play) to a family membership that lets you swing your clubs any time you like for an entire year!! (No More Chuck E. Cheese! - $250, Unlimited mini golf for a year for 2 adults & 2 kids)

If you like to PARTY you can join us at our opening event (Wonder Party Golden Ticket - $100, come celebrate our opening with one ticket that covers food, drinks, mini golf, and artist entertainment- whoop whoop!) OR BOOK YOUR OWN barn raiser; Birthday boys and girls: Be early birds, save the date, get a discounted rate! (They Say It's Your Birthday - $300, Two hour private room rental with pizza, drinks, and mini golf passes for 12 people) Brides and Grooms:  Golly gee do we have a room for you! Book it before anyone knows it exists! Or throw a twist in the boring annual office party!

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We’re not going to lie; this project is big, but doable! It’s true - much of what we are trying has never been done before and that is what makes it so exciting.  For instance, we are the first Public Benefit Corporation in the state of Minnesota and the only one (to date) with an arts focus. We think large, but we work hard to innovate and make our ideas come to life.

We are creating a new platform for artists to work and earn a living.  We are taking the corporate model and imbuing it with the soul of a non-profit. (Imagine if that idea takes off)? Because we are on the front edge, our business model is very new.  We have built an incredible team of talented people, and have secured the support of many established organizations including Creative Enterprise Zone, Hamline Midway Coalition, Midway Chamber of Commerce, Hamline University, Visit Saint Paul, Forecast Public Art, and the Soap Factory among others.

Our first investment came in the form of a competitive grant in the amount of $350,000 from ArtPlace America. Their investment in us was a tremendous vote of confidence and seed money to develop and execute our ambitious project. 

We were also fortunate to be selected to be part of Fredrikson & Byron's Public Benefit Cultivator program which includes consulting services from The Improve Group.

Our past projects speak to our ability to realize a dream for the greater good! We believe in us and invite you to too!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You don’t need $$$ to help the cause.  Sending an email to a friend who might connect with our project is more than enough. You never know!

Beyond contributing, consider signing up to volunteer at Can Can Wonderland!  This summer will be a hive of activity. Work side my side with amazing artists and fabricators.  There are a million skilled and unskilled jobs that need to be done, and we could use your elbow grease. Volunteering also has its perks! Visit us on Facebook for more information. #yeswecancan

story:
As emerging curators, we (Benjamin Copping and Wilhemina Madeley) need your help to realise an ambitious and innovative exhibition set in a disused diamond warehouse at 84 Hatton Garden in London.

http://thewaitingroom.org.uk/About-Us


About the exhibition:

The exhibition, entitled ‘Dimension(s) Variable’ (April 24th – May 15th) focuses on one of the most hotly contested, debated and controversial topics in contemporary art: the explosion and prominence of the internet and the advancement of affordable consumer technology.

With a vast list of established and emerging artists we are keen to do this project justice, allowing it to reach its full potential.

The exhibitors are:

Catherine Hughes (Bloomberg New Contemporaries 2013)

HaYoung Kim (Emerging Artists Program, Seoul Museum of Art 2014)

Natasha Peel (New Sensations 2012)

Michael Pybus (upcoming solo exhibition at Evelyn Yard, London)

Antonio Marguet (Catlin Art Guide 2012)

Rebecca Scheinberg (Catlin Art Guide 2015)

Paul Schneider (Catlin Art Guide 2015)

Verity Birt (commissioned sculpture by Somerset House 2016)

Goro Shimano (designer of Special Olympics Fukoka 2014 poster)

Ebae (upcoming residency at The Composing Rooms, Berlin)

Bruce Ingram (Arts Council England Individual artist’s award 2004 & 2009)

James Jessiman (part of Friday Late exhibition at V&A 2013)

HaYoung Kim, 'CCTV 1', 2014

Catherine Hughes, 'Into the Fold; Range Rover Autobiography Black 40th Anniversary Limited Edition', 2012

Antonio Marguet, 'Remote Crocodile Tears' 2012-2013

Verity Birt, 'Common Era II', 2015


Install shots:



Why us?

We have a shared ambition and love of art. We held our first show ‘Unknown & Unseen’ in January 2015 featuring 12 emerging artists and we were amazed and inspired by its success. More than 100 people attended the opening and the gallery received unexpectedly high numbers of visitors.

http://thewaitingroom.org.uk/UnknownUnseen

Impressed with the success of the exhibition, our dedication and innovation, we have been asked for a second time to organise an exhibition in the space before it is gutted and made into flats.

Invigorated by our achievements, we want to curate another exhibition that is bigger, bolder and more ambitious than the last. This time we want large-scale works and a united theme. We want to give more artists the opportunity to showcase their talents.

Praise for 'The Unknown & Unseen':

'The Unknown & Unseen' was a profoundly clever exhibition, willing to break the boundaries between different artistic disciplines. It played with form, function and the unique space it was housed in – an old diamond warehouse – to ask questions of what we take for granted when we engage with the world.'

-Felix Danczak


The Unknown & Unseen install shots:


Why we need you:

Having built on what we’ve learnt from the first exhibition we are confident that your funding will allow us to take this project from an amateur pop-up to a professionally run operation.

Without your funding, we simply cannot afford to do everything we want to do to ensure that this complex exhibition is as successful, innovative and explosive as we have conceived it to be.

Fortunate as we are to have the exhibition in a space spanning two floors, which gives us the freedom to display large-scale works (some of which are more than 4 meters in length) this comes with a unique set of challenges.

Not wanting to jeopardise the quality of the works in the exhibition or limit the artists we are hosting means that our insurance premium is much higher than for our last exhibition. It is very important to us that the space is protected and that the artists feel comfortable that their works are safe.

Your funding would also help us pay for basic but essential items to allow the exhibition’s installation to run smoothly. This includes the transportation of the artwork, materials for the install and de-install, drinks for the opening and expenses for the volunteers who are an essential component in ensuring the space is secure.

Any donation towards this project will be greatly appreciated.


Who we are:

Ben and Wilhemina represent two sides of the art industry. Ben, a recent photography graduate from Manchester School of Art has helped realise four pop-up projects in the space of 4 months (also at 84 Hatton Garden) for roving independent curator, Marcelle Joseph. Having witnessed the practical necessities of curating an exhibition Ben was invited by the owner of 84 Hatton Garden, Steven Saleh to curate his own exhibition.

Wilhemina has extensive knowledge in gallery, editorial and press relation systems having previously interned for arts focused firm Sutton PR and The Serpentine gallery among others. After she graduated from UCL with a BSc in Anthropology, Wilhemina continued her studies at The Courtauld Institute of Art undertaking an MA in Contemporary Chinese Art, shortly after which she started as an archivist at Michael Werner gallery in London.

Ben and Wilhemina began working together in December 2014 keen to build on their shared ethos: to give artists from a wide range of professional and educational backgrounds, a platform to fulfil their vision. The duo avidly support artists who are not represented by a gallery – giving them a place at the table to articulate their concepts and proposals.

For associated press about the artists or for further information about our project, please visit the following links:

http://thewaitingroom.org.uk/

http://www.newcontemporaries.org.uk/artists/catherine-hughes

http://paper-journal.com/rebecca-scheinberg/

http://www.dazeddigital.com/artsandculture/article/11305/1/converse-emerging-artists-award-bruce-ingram

http://www.juxtapoz.com/current/illustration-and-design-by-james-jessiman

http://hayoungkim.com/site/press_16_RAMagazine.html

http://dontdoitmag.co.uk/issue-8-noise/harnessing-abundance-an-interview-with-michael-pybus/

http://www.aestheticamagazine.com/blog/interview-with-ruskin-graduate-natasha-peel/

http://www.apollo-magazine.com/catlin-art-prize-shortlist-2015/

http://www.wonderlandmagazine.com/2012/09/emerging-antonio-marguet/

http://www.veritybirt.co.uk/

http://ebae.cheap/

http://goro.cc/

Thank you for considering our pledge.

Ben and Wilhemina.

of the art industry. Ben, a recent photography graduate from Manchester School
of Art has helped realise four pop-up projects in the space of 4 months (also
at 84 Hatton Garden) for roving independent curator, Marcelle Joseph. Having
witnessed the practical necessities of curating an exhibition Ben was invited by the owner of 84
Hatton Garden, Steven Saleh to curate his own exhibition. 
Wilhemina has extensive knowledge in
gallery, editorial and press relation systems having previously interned for arts
focused firm Sutton PR and The Serpentine gallery among others. After she
graduated from UCL with a BSc in Anthropology, Wilhemina continued her studies
at The Courtauld Institute of Art undertaking an MA in Contemporary Chinese
Art, shortly after which she started as an archivist at Michael Werner gallery
in London.
Ben and Wilhemina began working
together in December 2014 keen to build on their shared ethos: to give artists from
a wide range of professional and educational backgrounds, a platform to fulfil
their vision. The duo avidly support artists who are not represented by a
gallery – giving them a place at the table to articulate their concepts and
proposals.
For associated press about the artists
or for further information about our project, please visit the following links:
http://thewaitingroom.org.uk/
http://www.newcontemporaries.org.uk/artists/catherine-hughes
http://paper-journal.com/rebecca-scheinberg/
http://www.dazeddigital.com/artsandculture/article/11305/1/converse-emerging-artists-award-bruce-ingram
http://www.juxtapoz.com/current/illustration-and-design-by-james-jessiman
http://hayoungkim.com/site/press_16_RAMagazine.html
http://dontdoitmag.co.uk/issue-8-noise/harnessing-abundance-an-interview-with-michael-pybus/
http://www.aestheticamagazine.com/blog/interview-with-ruskin-graduate-natasha-peel/
http://www.apollo-magazine.com/catlin-art-prize-shortlist-2015/
http://www.wonderlandmagazine.com/2012/09/emerging-antonio-marguet/
http://www.veritybirt.co.uk/
http://ebae.cheap/
http://goro.cc/
Thank you for considering our pledge.

Ben and Wilhemina.

story:
Short Summary

I have great passion for coloring from young age. 

I did my Masters in Mass Communication in Nanyang Technological University, Singapore and Masters in English Literature in India. 

From young I have been drawing and coloring. I always wanted to educate others and impart my knowledge on how coloring has helped me all these years.

Coloring has the great power to give the same effects as meditation. 

Many years of experience and thought over coloring has made me experiment coloring.

In one research, I found scent in the room enhanced the relief with coloring. I tried several methods to bring the scent effects to the coloring experience. 

After many years, we conceptualised the idea of scented color pencils. 

We found scented colored pencils will enhance your coloring experience further.

What We Need & What You Get

We will need 8000 backers to back our idea and bring this to every adult who need a relief from the routine life.
You will get a 25 pages A-3 sized coloring book with $25 perk.  We are giving away 12 pieces scented colored pencils FREE for your support during this campaign.

The Impact

Benefits of coloring

Coloring is not just an activity for keeping kids occupied; we only associate it with children. In reality, coloring books and coloring pages for adults are also extremely therapeutic and can help generate wellness, quietness, mindfulness and the exact same benefits which meditation imparts  on the brain.

Let us study the top 10 benefits of coloring pages for adults in details.

1. Coloring pages for adults help de-stress

One of the earliest scientists to have studied the therapeutic benefits of coloring pages for adults was Carl Jung. He studied coloring of Mandalas as early as the first half of the 20th century. He often used Mandalas (which have concentric circles and geometrical patterns in them) for his patients and found that it helped them become calmer and witness lesser stress.

2. Coloring activities activate both parts of the cerebral hemisphere

According to psychologist Gloria Martinez Ayala, the action of coloring involves both logic and creativity. When we use logic to pick up a color for a particular shape or pattern, we activate the analytical part of the brain. On the other hand, when we choose to mix and match colors, we activate the creative side of the brain. This helps incorporate both areas of the cerebral cortex which control vision and help with coordination and fine motor skills.

3. Coloring pages for adults take them back to childhood

When an adult colors, s/he is transported back to the stress free days of childhood. Getting back those happy memories helps one relax and even feel optimistic and energetic for the future.

4. Coloring is like meditation

Meditation is the art of doing nothing. It is also the art of ‘de-concentrating’ which helps relax and reduce the chatter of a restless mind. While most people find it difficult to meditate, coloring pages and books for adults easily help induce the same meditative state. It is no wonder that many publishers in UK, France and USA have come up with coloring books just for adults. Coloring Mandalas are especially relaxing since coloring of the round and round patterns and concentric circles of these ancient designs relax the mind and make a person more mindful. It also keeps him/her focused on the present moment-just like meditation!

5. Coloring for adults helps reduce anxiety

Anxiety is a common mental condition affecting hundreds of adults. Anxiety and panic attacks cause many symptoms including: thoughts of death or dying, excessive worry, nausea, headaches, chills, fever, insomnia, etc. By using coloring pages for adults, therapists help their adult patients relax. The artistic expression helps patients go deeper into a relaxed state making other forms of therapy more effective. Research has now proven that coloring pages and books for adults can be used as prelude to regular or conventional therapy for many mental disorders.

6. Coloring for adults helps them re-discover themselves

Adults often find themselves stuck in a rut managing jobs, housework etc. Coloring pages can help one get out of this routine, making them feel more comfortable and relaxed at the end of a long day. This activity can also help one be with his/her thoughts. Many an adult has rediscovered him/herself through coloring pages for adults online and offline. You can even download free coloring apps or coloring printables and relax with this wonderful activity at the end of a long day.

7. Coloring for adults is a perfect therapy for many diseases

Coloring books for adults are ideal for patients -especially those battling health issues like epilepsy. Take the example of Cari Schofield, 38, from Stockbridge, Georgia who, due to her epilepsy, had several limitations. Since she started coloring, she finds she easily calms down and relax which, in turn, helps alleviate epileptic attacks. Due to her jerky hand movements, she used to experience difficulty holding a pen or pencil for drawing. But, by using coloring books for adults, she has started enjoying this activity again.

8. Coloring for adults helps spark creativity

One of the most important benefits of coloring books for adults is that they help ignite creativity which adults continue to experience in several other facets of their lives. Adults who color regularly find that they become great at picking colors for their clothes, their interiors etc. Coloring books and pages also help people become more creative in their jobs, analytical thinking activities and several other aspects of work and play.

9. Coloring helps adults reconnect with their Inner Child

Inner Child healing therapy is a popular therapy for disturbed adults who tend to be very harsh with themselves. As adults, we often have certain areas in our lives that need working on and all those areas are connected to certain issues which we carry forward from our past. When one reconnects with his/her inner child, a child full of innocence and love, one can actually become better as an adult. Such inner child healing especially helps break negative thinking patterns. It helps one love him/herself more-unconditionally. This, in turn, helps one become one’s best self-a confidant, radiant person who is ready to take on the world without fear.

10. Coloring books for adults help transport one to a time and place faraway

If, at the end of the day, you really wish to relax and get away from it all-simply bring out your crayons and download some coloring pages. This will surely help you get out and away from it all and help you relax and unwind. It is like taking a vacation without going anywhere!

Benefits of scented color pencils

1. Lavender can help you sleep. - Purple #800080

2. Cinnamon can sharpen your mind. - Golden Yellow #F6E120

3. Pine can alleviate stress. - Aqua Green #5BD2C0

4. Fresh-cut grass can make you more joyful. - Dark Brown #514E49

5. Citrus can help you feel more energized. - Orange #FF8000

6. Vanilla can elevate your mood. - Yellow #F6EB20

7. Pumpkin can serve as an aphrodisiac. - Red Orange #D84E09

8. Peppermint may boost concentration. - Bronze Yellow #A78B00

9. Jasmine may ease depression. - White #FFFFFF

10.Apples may mitigate a migraine. - Red #C91111

11.Olive oil can satisfy your appetite. - Jade Green #7E9156

12.Coffee can activate your brain - Gray #808080

Risks & Challenges

We want to bring the coloring with scented pencils all over the world. Your funding is really important to us. Without you we can't reach out to everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please support us by giving $1. Your comments will help us to improve too.

story:
About me and my art show


Hy everybody!
I'm Georgia Belletti, half italian and half greek, I'm a tattoo apprentice at the Body Decorators Tattoo Studio (Since 1988) and an illustrator in Bologna, Italy.
Art has always been an important part of my life, thanks to my parents and my passion.

Work is really difficult now because of the economic crisis, right now I wish to show my artistic identity throw this first art exhibition .

My intent in this exhibition is to deconstruct the canons of manga though my own personality and through mixed techniques.
The anime/manga that gave me inspiration is Neon Genesis Evangelion, where the "enemies" are angels; the drawings that I am doing represent each one of them, reinterpreting their form and using less or more abstract backgrounds.

A lot of people, friends, relatives, and strangers have already appreciated the first five (out of seventeen) illustrations I've made.

A friend, that is studying to become a filmmaker, will record the event to advertise it.


Ciao a tutti!
Sono Georgia Belletti, italo-greca, sono apprendista tatuatrice presso il Body Decorators Tattoo Studio (Since 1988) e illustratrice a Bologna, Italia. L'arte è sempre stata una parte importante della mia vita, grazie ai miei genitori e alla mia passione.

Il lavoro è molto difficile ora a causa della crisi economica, ma desidero mostrare la mia identità artistica attraverso questa mia prima mostra.

Il mio intento in questa mostra è quello di decostruire  i canoni del manga attraverso la mia personalità e utilizzando tecniche miste.
L'anime/manga dal quale ho tratto ispirazione é Neon Genesis Evangelion, nel quale i "nemici" affrontati sono angeli; Le tavole che sto disegnando rappresentano singolarmente ciascuno di loro, reinterpretando la loro forma e utilizzando contesti più o meno astratti.

Molte persone, amici, parenti e sconosciuti, hanno già apprezzato i primi cinque (di diciassette) pezzi che ho già realizzato.

L'evento sarà ripreso da un amico che studia per diventare regista, affinchè venga pubblicizzato.


About the donations

The entire amount of the donations will be used for the exhibition , more specifically:

  • Art supplies;
  • Canvas and promo items;
  • Merchandise.

L'intero ammontare delle donazioni verrà utilizzato per la mostra, più specificatamente:
  • Materiali artistici;
  • Cornici e oggetti promozionali;
  • Merchandise.


The Impact

Through your donation you will help me to make my dream come true and begin an artistic carrier.
Thank you for believing in me!

Attraverso la vostra donazione mi aiuterete a rendere il mio sogno realtà e a cominciare una carriera artistica.
Grazie per aver creduto in me!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate you can share or tell a friend, thank you for your attention!

Se non potete donare potete condividere o parlarne and un amico. Grazie per la vostra attenzione!

story:
GCW teams up with Orange Crush to present "Fight Forever".  A historic event to benefit Independent Wrestlers who have seen their work and income disappear throughout the pandemic.

Fight Forever is a 24 Hour continuous streaming professional wrestling event that will air LIVE and FREE on GCW's YouTube account starting on January 29th at 8pm Eastern Standard Time! www.youtube.com/GameChangerWrestlingVideo

Fans can support the cause by donating to this campaign.

Brought to you by Fat Kid Deals, Fite TV, And TOY VOMIT!

100% of the proceeds goes to the wrestlers!

 

Full event details being updated via PWPONDERINGS http://www.pwponderings.com/2021/01/22/gcw-figh...
