story:
MORE ABOUT CANVS:

With the CANVS app you're able to locate and interact with street art in different cities:

✭ Find street art through our interactive map
✭ Read full artist biographies and mural descriptions 
✭ Bookmark murals to view later
✭ Enter Mural-Hunt mode to be notified of murals within 150 feet of your location!
✭ Highlight your favorite murals and share with friends!

 

 

WHO DO WE SUPPORT:


We are elevating street art culture by making it more accessible and interactive. We do this by partnering with artists, cities, and communities to take the street art experience to the next level.


01 // General public – Imagine being able to find all of the street art in your favorite city, purchase artwork at a local venue and learn about the culture of that community. This is the future we are painting with CANVS!

02 // Artists – Artists often times struggle to find opportunities and gain exposure for their work. With CANVS we'll be able to put a spotlight on artists and share their work across the world

03 // Cities and communities – We are giving the tools to better understand how street art shapes their cities. From tourism, real estate, cultural growth and commerce. Our platform will help stimulate the creative equity of cities across the world!

 

 

OUR PLAN:

We’ve made some great strides over the past several months but there's a limit to how much we can build. We have taken all the feedback we’ve received from our thousands of users around the world and incorporated it into this new version.

Here are some of the new features we'll be building through your support:

Follow your favorite artists – You will be able to follow and support your favorite artist and receive notifications when a new mural hits the map. Furthermore, you will be the first to hear about local events, popups, and news related to that artist.

Create your own mural collections –
Share the murals you find with your friends by building your collections.

Augmented reality – Immerse yourself into the culture of street art through augmented reality. Watch art come to life!
 


In addition to these features, we will curate rich, off-app experiences to push the culture behind street art, exposing more people to its transformative power. We are working with every member of this community (artists, cities, and fans) to create impactful and memorable experiences around street art.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

We can’t do this alone. Our scope is the entire world, and that starts with people from every walk of life joining this interactive street art journey. It starts with you! Therefore, we are asking for interested supporters to back our dream here. 

We've got cool perks below that allows you to share your enthusiasm for Street art and CANVS around the world!

  • $10 // Gesture of Support
  • $25 // CANVS Sticker Pack
  • $25 // CANVS Tote Bag
  • $50 // CANVS Collective T-Shirt
  • $125 // Cold Lavender Sweatshirt
  • $200 // Private CANVS-Led Street Art Tour

 

The more you share this campaign, the more backers come in and the more impact we can have on the future of street art and support the community! Please share the link, let your friends know and use the Indiegogo share tools to push this out to all of your social media outlets.

Let's shape the future of street art together!

For more information contact us:
futureofstreetart@canvsart.com

 

 

------

For more information contact us:
futureofstreetart@canvsart.com

story:
Where do you go to escape? Maybe it’s to your favorite cafe, or losing yourself in a good book, or maybe even hiding away in a cozy pillow fort you built yourself. Dreamers know you don’t have to go far- or anywhere in fact- to escape into your own world. So what about your favorite Animal Crossing character? Where would they go to escape?

Over the past few months, 11 artists came together to craft dreamy illustrations of everyone’s favorite Animal Crossing characters. The result was a beautiful collection filled with soft feelings, and imaginative snapshots of these characters' personal getaways.

https://deardaydreamerkit.tumblr.com/

Meet our professional dreamers, a talented group of illustrators, and designers. From experience in designing merchandise, colorful illustration and animation, their crafting skills know no bounds!

  • Alexia Mohabir
  • Aliana
  • bokchois
  • daseul
  • Jen Chan
  • Kuuroppi
  • leo  
  • Nicole Kim
  • Noni
  • Wendy Chan
  • Yushin Kato

  • 3 Letter Sets 5x7” (2 Envelopes & 3 Sheets per Design)
  • 3 Postcards 4x6”
  • 3 Sticker Sheets 4x6”
  • 1 Memo Pad 3x8”
  • 2 Washi (15mmx10m)

The Dear Daydreamer bundle kit is a treat for lovers of Animal Crossing and stationery everywhere! With beautifully designed letter sheets, matching fully printed envelopes, dreamy mailable postcards, sticker sheets with a wonderful array of designs to choose from, adorable custom washi tapes, AND the cutest memo pad you can imagine (... imagine), the kit has everything you need to decorate and send your messages out to pen-pals all over the world.

 

*Merchandise shown are mock-ups and may be subject to change. Actual colors may vary. This is due to the fact that every computer monitor has a different capability to display colors and that everyone sees these colors differently.​

  • September: Pre-Orders Open
  • October: Production
  • November: Packing & Shipping

These dates are estimates and are subject to change. If any delays do occur, we will keep you updated with a revised schedule!

First and foremost, we would like to cover production costs. Once packaging and production costs are covered, the rest of the finances help support the artists who made this project a reality.
  • 75% Production Costs
  • 15% Eco-friendly Packaging, Shipping & Indiegogo Fees
  • 10% Supporting the Artists~


Though this is our first Crowdfunded project, the mods are a team of artists with professional experience in stationery, merchandise, and zine production. We know how to work with vendors and are aware of the trials/reality of product development.

Please keep in mind that we are a very small team. Hence, packing and shipping could take up to a month. Nonetheless, we will do our utmost best to send everything out as fast as possible!

Some risk & challenges include:

  • Production Delays
  • Shipping Delays

These issues may occur due to the Pandemic and would be out of our hands. However, if delays do occur, we will keep you updated!

  
   

Help us spread the word! Share with all your fellow Island Representatives, Camp Managers and Mayors. Let's have a pen-pal extravaganza!

  • Support Artists by giving a Tip!
  • Share the project on Social Media!
  • Buy the Dream Team Perk for you and a buddy <3
  • Do it for Isabelle!!

P.S. We are not affiliated, associated, authorized, endorsed by, or in any way officially connected with Nintendo. We are simple fans who have come together to create something dedicated to what we all love and adore: Animal Crossing.
story_txt:
Where do you go to escape? Maybe it’s to your favorite cafe, or losing yourself in a good book, or maybe even hiding away in a cozy pillow fort you built yourself. Dreamers know you don’t have to go far- or anywhere in fact- to escape into your own world. So what about your favorite Animal Crossing character? Where would they go to escape?
Over the past few months, 11 artists came together to craft dreamy illustrations of everyone’s favorite Animal Crossing characters. The result was a beautiful collection filled with soft feelings, and imaginative snapshots of these characters' personal getaways.
https://deardaydreamerkit.tumblr.com/
Meet our professional dreamers, a talented group of illustrators, and designers. From experience in designing merchandise, colorful illustration and animation, their crafting skills know no bounds!

Alexia Mohabir
Aliana
bokchois
daseul
Jen Chan
Kuuroppi

leo  
Nicole Kim
Noni
Wendy Chan
Yushin Kato

story:
I make paintings using found photographs as source material. I'm drawn to inane moments, awkward expressions, and uncomfortable interactions that can be captured objectively by a camera. After painting the image realistically, I add abstract visual elements to create a disruption and spark an emotional response. The intrusions in my paintings evoke different responses in individual viewers; comings and goings, presence and absence, privacy and exposure, reality and memory. 

Check out my website for more images of my artwork!

I show my paintings one or two times a year in the Bay Area, at a variety of venues including galleries, community spaces, and local businesses. I also regularly participate in Open Studios. All of these opportunities have been local to the SF Bay Area, and the next big step for my career is attaining meaningful exposure in new cities. I've set my sights on Los Angeles, and the stARTup Art Fair!

stARTup Art Fair LA is a unique and exciting opportunity for myself and the other artists who have been invited! The Kinney Venice Beach is hosting the 2018 LA-based fair. Over the course of the three-day event, over 50 artists will each take over one room of this stylish hotel in Venice Beach. Most art fairs function as trade shows for well-established galleries, which can tend to exclude emerging and unrepresented artists like myself. stARTup Art Fair's mission is to provide a professional exhibition venue for independent artists where they can present and sell their work on their own terms, and the public can acquire amazing artwork from some of the best independent artists working today. The event is juried by a group of excellent curators, gallery owners, collectors and business owners; I'm incredibly honored to have been selected.

What I need & what you get!

One of the biggest challenges to participating at stARTup Art Fair is the cost. During the final home stretch until the show (just one month left!) I need to focus on finishing paintings, organizing my additional supplies, and packing up for the journey. $5000 is the amount I am hoping to raise with this funding campaign! The vast majority of that amount will cover the base participation fees, which total $4000. The remaining $1000 will be used for logistics and sundry supplies such as packing materials, and to cover Indiegogo fees and perk fulfillment costs.

Of course I would love to exceed my funding goal, but I feel the amount I've set my sights on strikes a  balance between the cost of the event and an attainable goal.

It was important to me to offer perks for backing my campaign that are unique! Many of the perks  are one-of-a-kind opportunities to get custom artwork from me, and I won't offer them again. I'm also offering high-quality prints of my work at a steep discount from the price I typically sell them, as huge THANK YOU for backing my project. If you've wanted a print or original of my work before now, this is the time to jump at the opportunity!

Challenges

As with any opportunity as an artist, there is no guarantee that I will "break even" via art sales, or make that perfect fit connection to a gallery or venue at this art fair. Accepting this risk, my goal for this show is purely wider exposure, and I trust that other opportunities and advancements will happen organically as a result. 

When I participated in stARTup San Francisco earlier this year, I met a lot of enthusiastic art fans and had some great conversations but didn't close the fair with any concrete leads. Since then, I've gotten follow-ups about some exciting new opportunities, and it allowed me to connect with Root Division and join their Studio Artist program as of July. These connections were an invaluable result of participating in that show, and I have faith that the Los Angeles version will provide similar chances for my career.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be immensely grateful for any support you can offer, whether you want to claim one of the top tier perks, chip in a few dollars, or even just share my campaign to your network. Indiegogo has sharing tools for social websites; I also have a page on Facebook or Instagram that you can link to or tag.

Every little bit of attention will help me reach my goal of expanding my artistic exposure and making new awesome artwork! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Agnieszka Robak and I am multidisciplinary artist based in London. 

I have graduated in 2012 from Limerick School of Art and Design in Ireland with first class Honours in Ceramics. Since then I have been working for artists and designers in Poland, Germany and UK.

I am strongly drawn to contrasts, especially between order and chaos, repetition and accidents.

In my show I am planning to explore those concepts by producing installations of multiples and mixed media collages. 

To achieve my goals and best showcase my creativity I need your help to fund the materials.

 

What I Need:

  • large format prints on poliester $310
  • ink toners for prints on paper  $60
  • paper $50
  • roll of acetate $50
  • Paper boxes $60
  • wire, tapes, threads $50
  • magnets, adhesives $80
  • jesmonite, resin,silicone $340

ALL FUNDS WILL GO TOWARDS MATERIALS

 

The Impact

Husk is a community space run by London's Mission.

It is a place that brings together people from all walks of life, backgrounds and believes.

I had a chance to lead few art workshops here and it was a great experience to share my skills with others.

The exhibition will bring another chance to meet and get engaged with art.

story:
SUMMARY 

Now in its 9th year, FIGMENT Boston is run by volunteers, and funded by contributions from private donors. As an entirely crowdfunded, free, public art event, we also open the doors of the project submission process to any and all community members - whether they think of themselves as artists or not. The gift of FIGMENT Boston can only happen when the community comes together to make it so, both financially, artistically, and energetically. We need your help to make FIGMENT Boston 2017 a reality!

WHAT WE NEED 

It costs about $12,500 to produce FIGMENT Boston each summer. We need to fundraise especially for FIGMENT Boston (see budget below). This includes tents, Generators and Boston City permits. FIGMENT is a rain or shine event - tents ensure artists are not subject to any of the elements. Many of our projects need power to move or illuminate your mind and to do all this we need permits before any art is placed on the Greenway.

To raise these needed funds, we are asking for your contribution to this Indiegogo campaign. As an added incentive to the FIGMENT Boston team Firefly Arts Collection and Boston Decompression will each match up to $1,000 in donations ….. We implore you, our fans, to help us reach our goal!

WE – FIGMENT Boston, are a completely volunteer group. Every dime of your donation (after obligatory fees) goes directly to event expenses.


WHAT YOU GET

By supporting FIGMENT 2017, you ensure that accessible, interactive public art continues this summer on the Greenway.  Additionally, we have some great perks, including admission to the “Kick off The Call” party for folks local to MA!

FIGMENT 2017 Expenses

  • Insurance           $1,500
  • Infrastructure   $8,000
  • Permits               $1,000
  • Signage               $200
  • T-shirts               $500
  • Promotion         $350
  • Transport          $300
  • Misc supplies   $150
  • Indiegogo fees $500

Total $12,500

FIGMENT 2017 Fundraising Targets

  • FIGMENT 100   $5,000
  • Indiegogo           $5,500
  • Match                  $2,000

Total $12,500

THE IMPACT 

FIGMENT invites individuals and groups from all walks of life to imagine a project, and then bring it to life. Because each project must be interactive in nature, FIGMENT events become an interwoven landscape of engaged participants and artists, placemaking together. This allows new connections between people to be forged, new perspectives to be grown, and inspiration to strike. We believe that everyone who participates in FIGMENT Boston either as an artist, volunteer or attendee leaves changed.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

In the current climate in America, access to public outlets of expression is even more critical. Without free, low threshold events like FIGMENT Boston, our communities lose an opportunity to have their voices heard in a public forum. It is also critically important for communities to have places where they can come together and play - and learn from one another - and leave changed. FIGMENT Boston offers that to all.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

Spread the word about FIGMENT and this campaign!

Bring your art! Our call for art opens on April 15th Submit HERE once the call opens

Consider volunteering to be a part of making FIGMENT happen! Sign up to volunteer here

Join the FIGMENT 100 and give a small monthly donation that doesn’t break the bank, but adds up over time! With 100 people donating $10 a month, we can pay for our main summer event in Boston and put funds towards art grants, long term installations and other ways of growing FIGMENT.

story:
Meet Brian Baity, aka. Creation Crib

I have been sculpting collectibles and toys for clients for the past 15 years as a freelancer under the name Creation Crib. Now, I'm ready to start telling my own stories using my own designs. 

Daycare Dropouts are the most famous monsters during their most terrible twos. 

Where The Toys are Now

The initial costs for production such as tooling and sampling are covered. The toys are now entering the production phase and the first order will be shipped out later this year. I've also started to move forward with planning out other color way editions, all limited small runs. These toys stand about 6" tall and come nestled in a blister inside a cardboard packaging.

If you back this campaign, you will receive the first round of the original color way.

During our Kickstarter, I offered lower than retail pricing. Same thing applies here.

​Risks & Challenges

Producing a toy to the quality we want to achieve comes with some high costs. I've already covered the initial set up costs, tooling costs and paid for prototypes and the first production run. We are on target for a late Q4 delivery, but there could be unforeseen delays. We will do the best we can to stay on track, but toy production is a process and we have to respect the process. That’s a rule.

I've partnered with a reputable vendor with demonstrated history of making great toys. We are already thrilled with our prototypes and tooling is completed. Now we are waiting on the production line to begin. These toys are going to be killer.

Shipping these toys also has risks as most of the world’s oceans are filled with sea monsters. There’s a lot of mystery in that unexplored deep blue. To navigate these waters, we have a broker to help manage the importation and delivery.

My team and I have a combined history of 35+ years making toys. We’ve done this work for other people and companies, and now we’re doing it for ourselves.

Other ways you can help

Getting the word out is a great help! As an independent maker, every share counts!

-Thanks for your support!

story:
If you've come to Toronto, you know our mayor. If you live in Toronto, you wish you didn't know our mayor. In our supposedly progressive city, the mayor's voice is overpowering, and his supporters show their views in one of the city's major newspapers: The Toronto Sun. This is not news. The Toronto Sun is not news. Rascism, sexism, ageism, ect. This is not news. 

 

 

I am asking for funding to produce SOCIALLY CONSCIOUS art, made to post around the city and share with friends. More than funding though, I am asking for support and awareness.



THIS IS NOT NEWS.

This is the war on MISINFORMATION. 

 

Funders and friends alike: my product is your product so expect stickers, pins, ect. 

 

ONE LOVE

story:
La Leblanc intro

En 2011 se déroula la 1ère édition du Concours d'oeuvres d'art «L'Art au parfum».
Le lancement de la 2e édition sera annoncé sous peu et je travaille déjà sur la 3e édition qui sera bonifiée.  C'est d'ailleurs pour la préparation de cette superbe édition que je fais appel à votre support.

Mais qu'est-ce que le Concours L'Art au parfum?
Il s'agit d'un concours auquel les artistes en arts visuels, professionnels et non-professionnels, soumettent une oeuvre inspirée d'un parfum proposé.
L'odorat est un sens qui nous fait voyager dans le temps, qui fait ressurgir des images du présent, du passé ou complètement inventées et qui assurément, est un moteur d'inspiration inépuisable. La 1ère édition reçu un accueil chaleureux et certains artistes y ayant participé m'en parlent encore!

Qui dit parfum dit Grasse!
Pour la 3e édition du Concours prévu en 2016, j'ai la folle idée de créer un partenariat avec la capitale mondiale de la parfumerie soit la belle et charmante ville de Grasse, située dans le sud de la France.

L'objectif est de tenir le Concours à la fois en France et au Québec et de faire voyager les oeuvres finalistes d'un continent à l'autre.

Je vous invite à consulter la page Facebook de la première édition :
www.facebook.com/Artauparfum


Qui est Leblanc?

Isabelle Leblanc, directrice de Signé Leblanc, passionnée de gestion d'événements, impliquée dans le milieu culturel québécois depuis 5 ans, folle (le mot est faible) de l'univers du parfum et artiste peintre fièrement représentée par La Galerie Le Chien d'Or à Québec depuis 2012.

Pour plus amples informations à propos de Leblanc :
Signé Leblanc
Leblanc l'artiste


Leblanc a besoin de...

La préparation de cette édition demande d'aller à la rencontre des élus de la ville de Grasse et des futurs partenaires. L'objectif de financement est de 1000 $, montant qui couvrira les dépenses reliées aux déplacements et à l'hébergement.

Que mon objectif soit atteint ou pas, le voyage se fera quand même car je suis convaincue de la viabilité du projet et du rayonnement qu'il aura pour les artistes d'ici et d'ailleurs. Si par bonheur l'objectif se voit dépassé, le surplus sera versé dans les bourses qui seront remis aux artistes récipiendaires de la prochaine édition (2015).

Ha oui... le départ est déjà fixé, je décolle le 26 septembre 2014!


Parlez-en!

Merci, merci, merci à l'avance de partager cette levée de fonds avec votre entourage et auprès des amoureux des arts.
story_txt:
La Leblanc intro
En 2011 se déroula la 1ère édition du Concours d'oeuvres d'art «L'Art au parfum». Le lancement de la 2e édition sera annoncé sous peu et je travaille déjà sur la 3e édition qui sera bonifiée.  C'est d'ailleurs pour la préparation de cette superbe édition que je fais appel à votre support.Mais qu'est-ce que le Concours L'Art au parfum? Il s'agit d'un concours auquel les artistes en arts visuels, professionnels et non-professionnels, soumettent une oeuvre inspirée d'un parfum proposé. L'odorat est un sens qui nous fait voyager dans le temps, qui fait ressurgir des images du présent, du passé ou complètement inventées et qui assurément, est un moteur d'inspiration inépuisable. La 1ère édition reçu un accueil chaleureux et certains artistes y ayant participé m'en parlent encore!Qui dit parfum dit Grasse!Pour la 3e édition du Concours prévu en 2016, j'ai la folle idée de créer un partenariat avec la capitale mondiale de la parfumerie soit la belle et charmante ville de Grasse, située dans le sud de la France. L'objectif est de tenir le Concours à la fois en France et au Québec et de faire voyager les oeuvres finalistes d'un continent à l'autre.Je vous invite à consulter la page Facebook de la première édition : www.facebook.com/ArtauparfumQui est Leblanc?

Isabelle Leblanc, directrice de Signé Leblanc, passionnée de gestion d'événements, impliquée dans le milieu culturel québécois depuis 5 ans, folle (le mot est faible) de l'univers du parfum et artiste peintre fièrement représentée par La Galerie Le Chien d'Or à Québec depuis 2012. Pour plus amples informations à propos de Leblanc :Signé LeblancLeblanc l'artiste

Leblanc a besoin de...
La préparation de cette édition demande d'aller à la rencontre des élus de la ville de Grasse et des futurs partenaires. L'objectif de financement est de 1000 $, montant qui couvrira les dépenses reliées aux déplacements et à l'hébergement.
Que mon objectif soit atteint ou pas, le voyage se fera quand même car je suis convaincue de la viabilité du projet et du rayonnement qu'il aura pour les artistes d'ici et d'ailleurs. Si par bonheur l'objectif se voit dépassé, le surplus sera versé dans les bourses qui seront remis aux artistes récipiendaires de la prochaine édition (2015).
Ha oui... le départ est déjà fixé, je décolle le 26 septembre 2014!


Parlez-en!
Merci, merci, merci à l'avance de partager cette levée de fonds avec votre entourage et auprès des amoureux des arts.

story:
EXHIBITION UPDATE: 

To any of you who have contributed, words can not express the gratitude for your help. Our regrets to inform you that the designated gas station location and date will no longer be in place. The owners of the gas station added unreasonable demands to the agreement and therefore priced out. This outcome was unforeseeable and unjustified, and we apologize for any inconvenience. 

The show must go on, so details on the new location soon.

We will refund your money unless you email us at phurmedia@gmail.com. As the series still needs help with costs associated with the series (costs of production and editing) as well as getting a small run magazine printed, so any contributions you can provide would be greatly appreciated. 

Thank you so much for your support!!! 

<3 PHURMEDIA



THE JERSEY PROJECT POP-UP LAUNCH

Taking place in a soon-to-be-demolished gas station off the Bellville Turnpike, the location is both a reminder of what remains since the automobile industry collapse, and of the ways to bring art and discussion to an otherwise dormant space. The Jersey Project launch will highlight artists responding to the idea of Jersey as a state of place and will include site-specific installation video works and previews of The Jersey Files documentary series. After the pop-up, the videos will be posted online in a soon-to-be-expanded series. THIS IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY to discuss the ways in which we can change space and how space can change us. 


Artists will include:
Dana Caputo
Cody Comrie
Crystal Gwyn
Annie Frame
Kathryn Love
Lee Puckett
Alina Negoita
Kimi Selfridge
Yeliz Secerli
Jessica Yatrofsky
Ebru Yildiz

ABOUT THE ARTISTS
PHUR Media presents a roster of artists who aim to push boundaries in gender, media and social conventions. They have been exhibited in Signal, Caprious, Leslie Lohman and published in Brooklyn Magazine, NYLON, FADER, Tokion, Surface and Dazed and Confused.



ABOUT THE JERSEY FILES
The Jersey Files is an ongoing documentary project investigating the culture of New Jersey. The series will consist of interviews with store owners, city officials and locals shaping their community through local activism; perfecting their trade, each making the state legendary.

COSTS
As the remote location is essential to removing the New York crowd from the hustle of the city, funding will be needed for transportation to the site via shuttle bus (two evenings; two smaller shuttles for the opening, and a larger bus for the closing night.)

SITE REHABILITATION
Lighting Restructuring
Concrete/Cleanup/Site Rehabilitation
Interior Paint
Security
Site Insurance

EDITOR
Jersey Files documentary projects
(Even though we have shot most of the footage, it needs someone to give it the post production special loving for your ultimate viewing)

CONTINUATION
We would like to expand upon the gallery pop-up with a printed magazine containing the artists work, which will also require funding. With this initial pop-up, we are hoping to raise money to extend the reach of this exhibition to print and media, but can not do it without your help!

We appreciate any contribution you can make to help the project grow!

xoxo
PHUR TEAM

story:
Since I was a young girl I have enjoyed many aspects of performance. I have held many roles in musicals and plays, but once I got into college, the opportunity for performance never presented itself much until about a year and a half ago. I was given the opportunity to model a body paint for an event and on that day, I found my new performance niche! Body Art has given me the chance in my adult life to do what I love, perform! I have also been graced with a sense of self confidence that is sometimes hard to find as an adult searching for a place in the world. It is such a privilege and honor to be able to bring to life the vision behind the art of the artist! Now, don't be fooled in thinking that being a body paint model is just a bunch of standing around looking nice. It is much more complex of an experience. It requires extreme self discipline, ability to take part when needed in the creative process, stamina, positive attitude, ability to perform during extreme pressure, among a loooong list of other attributes needed to be an outstanding human canvas! Every time that I am given the opportunity to model for an artist, I am excited to be able to improve as a model and performer. Working with different artists provides many great challenges and rewards as an emerging body paint model. Since then I have gone on to perform in many performance based body art shows and competitions in the US.  Being a LIVING canvas has also pushed me to learn new performance techniques such as Hula Hooping, Aerial Silks, Lyra and Chinese Silk Fans!

The opportunity has now presented itself for me to join an amazing artist and friend as her model for the World Body Paint Competition in Austria!! 

Our team (Artist: Brittany Pelloquin, Assistant: Kimberly Davis, and Model: Me :D) Will be leaving this coming Sunday, June 28th for our 10 day journey to Austria for the biggest Body Paint Competition in the WORLD!!! 

I know that it is last minute, but what a better time than now to help out a group of ladies that have the biggest heart, the most positive attitudes and the most outstanding desire to WIN!!! 

Should you decide to help us out, the funds will go to housing while we are there, meals, general travel expenses and supplies needed for competition. I appreciate anything that you so kindly donate toward our trip!! 

The time is upon us, so act NOW and help make dreams become reality!!

THANK YOU KINDLY, FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART!!

<3 Kallie

story: New Generation Dance Company, Founded by one of New York most sought after instructors/Choreographers, Master Dardo Galletto, is comprised of his most dedicated students along with some Argentina and New York's top professional dancers. The Prestigious Jacobs Pillow "in-out Festival" has invited them to perform for their community. With the upmost excitement and anticipation, the dancers have committed themselves diligently so they can deliver this honorable request and even exceed the festivals expectations by giving an unmatched performance. With your generosity and support in any capacity, NGDC will able to accept this beautiful opportunity to share their talent, dedication & passion for Argentine Tango with level of professionalism they deserve and have worked so hard for.

story:
Who we are

We are a coalition of over 140 outfitters, outdoor businesses, conservation organizations, and sportsmen’s clubs who have decided that enough is enough. We want our elected officials to stop ridiculous talk of selling off our federal public lands.

We need your help to reach more sportsmen, pressure more politicians, and to take back our sporting heritage.

Here's what we’re up against

The plot to sell-off America’s public lands began as a whisper in the back halls of state legislatures across the West. Earlier this year, American sportsmen and women would have scoffed in the face of this proposition. Annex our sporting heritage? Sell-off our birthright as Americans? Impossible.


But the threat to our public land is very real. Since January, state lawmakers in nine Western states have introduced legislation that would encourage the sell off of our federal public lands. In states like Utah and Alaska, state legislatures have demanded that the federal government release their public lands “or else.”

Now, the fight has moved to Washington.

Recently, the U.S. Senate passed a non-binding budget resolution that encourages Congress to “sell, or transfer to, or exchange with, a state or local government any Federal land that is not within the boundaries of a National Park, National Preserve, or National Monument…” The amendment passed 51-49.

Your access to quality fish and game habitat on U.S. Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management lands could be lost forever. Your sporting heritage could be sold off to the highest bidder.

This isn’t just about the West any more. This is a threat to every American who cherishes our public-lands heritage.

We are building a movement.

With the help of our coalition, we’ve been able to hold off the threat in many Western states. We’ve helped defeat “sell off” legislation in eight state legislatures. We’ve also rallied thousands of sportsmen at four state capitals across the West and delivered over 115,000 letters to elected officials across the country.

But it’s clear that we need to make our movement bigger. We need to get louder. We need more sportsmen.

There are two ways you can help to fight the threat to sell off our public lands right now:

  1. If you haven’t already, sign the Sportsmen’s Access petition at sportsmensaccess.org. Then share it with all of your friends and family.

  2. Support our work to help us reach even more people. Every dollar raised goes directly toward mobilizing sportsmen in states across the country.


Don't get locked out

Stop the seizure of YOUR public lands

Sign the petition today!

story:
Free Ceramics Studio Art Center is a space for community events and creating. The building is a former funeral home that contains a striking Gothic style chapel turned performance space now known as 'The Great Room.'

During the transfer of ownership, the stained glass window was removed, leaving a large Gothic shaped void behind the stage. 'The Paper Window' will re-illuminate the performance space by filling the void with an intricate paper-cut stage backdrop.

The goal of this project is to create a piece of art that will enhance the experience of those who gather here for years to come. The success of this project is reliant upon the generosity of the community and art lovers around the world.

Please help me make 'The Paper Window' a reality. 

 

*UNVEILING PARTY*

For all of you in the Helena, Montana area- Please join me for the unveiling party on June 10th at 8pm.  Los Marvelitos will be breaking in the new performance space with their funky Latin tunes.

Refreshments will be provided. $10 suggested donation at the door

story:
Art changes lives and is a powerful tool for change.Art has always been part of my life and I knew early on that creativity was what I wanted to work with. I also realised that I’ve been healing my own broken self by using art as therapy when growing up. 

Early 2016 I will be working with Art Relief International in Chang Mai, an artistic outreach organisation that works with a wide range of social groups and humanitarian organisations. I will have the opportunity to work with various groups including Burmese refugees, indigenous hill tribe groups, children and adults with intellectual and / or physical disabilities and children from local orphanages, to name a few. I will also work with children from various 'Temple' (Government) Schools across Chiang Mai which are unable to offer art as part of their curriculum. 

I am looking for contributions towards the project fee of £1000. You can simply donate but also help out by buying my art as all sales will go towards this project. Even the smallest amount will be incredibly helpful.

My background

I’ve studied art in Sweden and London and have worked as an artist and workshop facilitator for over 10 years mostly with vulnerable groups. I have also studied Psychology and have a diploma in Art Therapy from Metafora, Barcelona and certificates from London Art Therapy Centre. I believe that creativity has no boundaries and I am truly passionate about the positive impact it can have when using creativity as a development and well-being tool.

About Art Relief and Cultural Canvas

Art Relief is a professional placement with research and development opportunities rather than traditional volunteering so I am likely to come home with new insights and ideas on how to further improve the lives of Londoners through art. There will also be a need for a translator as many groups won’t have had much education if any and my basic Thai lessons will only stretch so far. Art Relief is part of Cultural Canvas Thailand, a non-profit, non-government organisation. $1799 is the full amount for the placement covering. We’ve already covered $300 of that to secure the placement and it works out as the same amount as the fundraising fee of 5%. The cost of my flights and internal transport to reach Chang Mai has already kindly been donated. Check out their websites for more thorough info.

Here is the breakdown of the project fee:

4% - Administrative: website development and management, postage and correspondence with organizations and universities

4% - Outreach: website development and management, postage and correspondence with organizations and universities

Program Costs - 82%

19% - Housing

10% - Food

9% - Transportation

6% - Insurance: travel insurance for the duration of placement

12% - Placement Coordination: pre-departure costs of communication, postage, handbooks, screening, AND in-coutry support and orientation, in-country staff,

17% - Program Development and Management: research and selection of volunteer placement, in-country director and staff, ongoing program management, postage and communication costs associated with recruiting volunteers

7% - Host Organization Support: $100 is contributed to your partner project

2% - Miscellaneous: fees, unforeseen costs associated with volunteer consumption

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone can’t contribute and it’s a week before Christmas (if you’re “doing” Christmas) but you can still help.

Help me get the word out by sharing this! Make some noise! Promote my website and my art.www.lindaskoglund.co.uk/shop.html - clicking on any art image will take you directly to my online shop on Etsy. ALL SALES will go towards this project.

Thanks for reading!

All the love

Linda

story: Hello, everyone! My name's Alicia Mello and I am a student at Shasta College. Since the Fall of 2013, I have attended art classes (either for transfer or just for fun). It is now April 2015 and eventually, I'll be transferring out of the college. Well, I wanted to do something to pay my respects to the art department (since I'm a BIIIIIG fan of the department, let alone the staff members are very nice). I wanted to somehow donate money for a good cause. Since the Student Art Exhibit is coming up, it would be a great idea to give funds for it. I hope the amount I put will be raised. If not, that's totally fine! Thank you to those that're reading this and have a great day!

story:
Hi, I'm Emmie.

I like to draw things. I also like to write things. I especially like things that combine those first two things, which is where this little project first started.

I've spent the last 3 years pondering, doodling, (and perhaps procrastinating on)  haikus. What began as a frivolous side project, steadily became a mission with a very real end goal: publish an art book. Now, I've collated the best of the bunch and am ready to get printing! But as with most art graduates, I'm a little bit broke and need your help to make it happen.

It will cost £500 to print, produce, package and ship the first batch of 60 books.

A lot of the funds raised will actually be going towards the packaging and shipping, since the real world sucks and logistics are more expensive than you'd think. Not to mention, these fancy rewards aren't gonna fund themselves!

BUT, you'll get a book that is:

  • 140mm x 140mm - the perfect size for your coffee table (I promise!)
  • Hard back, matte, printed cover (Ooh! Aah!)
  • Digital full colour print on silk 135 gsm paper (fancy, shiny, good quality stuff!)
Plus a warm, fuzzy feeling in your heart, of course.
 

Risks & Challenges

I'll be using an independent, UK based printer. If we're successful in reaching the goal amount, I'll be sending for a sample print, and making final adjustments. This could take a little time, but once everything is perfect, we'll be good to go!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can still help out!

Tell your friends, family, dogs, cats, or estranged lovers about the project. Get to social media and share the link to this campaign wherever you can!

Hi, I'm Emmie.
I like to draw things. I also like to write things. I especially like things that combine those first two things, which is where this little project first started.
I've spent the last 3 years pondering, doodling, (and perhaps procrastinating on)  haikus. What began as a frivolous side project, steadily became a mission with a very real end goal: publish an art book. Now, I've collated the best of the bunch and am ready to get printing! But as with most art graduates, I'm a little bit broke and need your help to make it happen.
It will cost £500 to print, produce, package and ship the first batch of 60 books.

A lot of the funds raised will actually be going towards the packaging and shipping, since the real world sucks and logistics are more expensive than you'd think. Not to mention, these fancy rewards aren't gonna fund themselves!
BUT, you'll get a book that is:

140mm x 140mm - the perfect size for your coffee table (I promise!)
Hard back, matte, printed cover (Ooh! Aah!)
Digital full colour print on silk 135 gsm paper (fancy, shiny, good quality stuff!)

Plus a warm, fuzzy feeling in your heart, of course. 
Risks & Challenges
I'll be using an independent, UK based printer. If we're successful in reaching the goal amount, I'll be sending for a sample print, and making final adjustments. This could take a little time, but once everything is perfect, we'll be good to go!

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute? You can still help out!
Tell your friends, family, dogs, cats, or estranged lovers about the project. Get to social media and share the link to this campaign wherever you can!

story:
About this project

Now, for the first time Unicorn Publishing presents a deck of Hand-Drawn Playing Cards with US Government officials. Meet the President Donald Trump Cabinet and Administration - the team of highest–ranked executives in the United States of America.

Donald John Trump - a real estate developer-turned-reality television star was elected the 45th president of the United States in a stunning culmination of an explosive campaign. He is the very definition of an American success story. His main promise is to “Make America Great Again”.

Some people are very excited about Donald Trump victory. Some people hate it. All we want to say: This project has nothing to do with politics. We do not support nor condemn anybody here. Please do not shoot the pianist! (c)Oscar Wilde  :)

If you want to know faces of the new members of the United States  Cabinet and Administration - this deck is for you!

 IMPORTANT:

1) If you want to see YOUR FAVORITE POLITICIAN included in this Deck you’ll have a chance to submit a vote for him. Please read carefully information about additional jokers’ poll in “Jokers” section below.

2) If you want to see YOUR OWN IMAGE on a card among others in this Deck please read carefully information on how to bid for a Special pledge in - "Wild" Card section below.

3) As our contribution to PROMOTION OF THE NEW US GOVERNMENT WORLDWIDE we plan to send a deck to each leader of the Government of every 193 countries – members of the United Nations (if such shipment is legally permitted from the United States) and to all people from the Time magazine list “The 100 Most Influential People” 2016. If you have any other suggestions please let us know! We’ll be happy to hear from you!

4) OUR IMPORTANT STATEMENT: Any card rank, color, suit, etc., does not represent the importance of the particular person or importance of the Government position in the State hierarchy.

Features   

DESIGN

Trump Shuffle is an art-rich 60+ card poker deck, featuring President Trump Cabinet and Administration members.

Every card in the Trump Shuffle deck is obsessively detailed, hand-drawn and hand-painted watercolor artwork throughout. The original drawings and paintings as well as Limited edition prints may be available for purchase (Please ask us if you are interested.)

DECKS

        Classic Edition Deck Blue/ Red (Gold with a stretch goal)

Highest quality, casino - grade cards paper stock, matt finish;

Blue or Red back (you will be able to choose the one you like);

Option for Classic Edition Gold - stretch goal;

Gilded cards edges for Classic Edition Gold - stretch goal;

Custom tuck seal - stretch goal;

Deluxe metal foiled/embossed tuck boxes for Classic Edition Gold - stretch goal;

More perks with each deck with higher tier pledges;

  Platinum Edition Deck

Highest quality Linen Finish cards paper stock;

Blue or Red back (you will be able to choose the one you like);

Deluxe metal foiled/embossed tuck boxes. Artwork on all sides;

Custom tuck seal;

More perks with each deck with higher tier pledges;

Each deck consists of

52 classic cards;

2 + X Jokers (You can vote for 3 of them – see below);

1 “Wild” card (You can bid for it - See Special Pledge);

CARDS

Besides the President of the United States Cards are presenting you the following (not necessarily in this order):

Members of the Cabinet

  • Vice President of the United States
  • Secretary of State
  • Secretary of Department of the Treasury
  • Secretary of Department of Defense
  • Attorney General - Department of Justice
  • Secretary of Department of the Interior
  • Secretary of Department of Agriculture
  • Secretary of Department of Commerce
  • Secretary of Department of Labor
  • Secretary of Department of Health and Human Services
  • Secretary of Department of Housing and Urban Development
  • Secretary of Department of Transportation
  • Secretary of Department of Energy
  • Secretary of Department of Education
  • Secretary of Department of Veterans Affairs
  • Secretary of Department of Homeland Security
  • Positions with the status of Cabinet-rank:
  • White House Chief of Staff
  • Administrator Environmental Protection Agency
  • Director of Office of Management & Budget
  • Ambassador - United States Trade Representative
  • Ambassador - United States Mission to the United Nations
  • Chairman of Council of Economic Advisers
  • Administrator of Small Business Administration
  • Other key members of the Administration.

President

Vice President

Secretary of State

Secretary of Department of the Treasury

Secretary of Department of Defense

Secretary of Department of Education

Ambassador to the UN

JOKERS

In our Deck jokers are the people who don’t have an official position in the Cabinet and Administration at the moment but may have a significant influence on the President's decisions and policies.

First and Second Ladies obviously are two of them. But we also include more than usual two jokers’ cards in our deck.

For three extra candidates for joker cards you’ll be able to vote. Please stand by for updates! We plan to start the poll very soon!

Full list is going to be our secret for now – you’ll find out who they all are when you get your deck! ;)

"WILD" CARD

As our special “Thank you” for helping us to bring this project to life we reserve one “Wild” Card for the highest bidder on the Special pledge. If you want to see your image on the card among others please follow the link to participate in the auction. The Link will be available in this section soon. For compliance reasons we are doing this outside of Kickstarter. Stand by for updates.

 Distribution

As our contribution to promotion of our new Government worldwide besides making the cards available through usual distribution channels we plan to send a deck to each leader of the Governments of every 193 countries – members of the United Nations (if such shipment is legally permitted from the United States) and to all people from the Time magazine list “The 100 Most Influential People” 2016.

Timeline

This Deck could be a perfect gift for January 20, 2017 – the date of Inauguration of the 25th President of the United States Donald J Trump but… Many positions in the Cabinet require the US Senate approval. That’s why we can start the Deck production only after this happens. We assume that approval takes no more than 2 month. Another 6 weeks (maximum) we need to complete the design (some candidates can be replaced and our designers we’ll need to make new cards), print decks and ship them to our distribution warehouse. So we plan that no later than June 2017 (or sooner) we’ll be able to start shipping first pledges

Concept: June - December 2016

Funding: January 2017

Design completion: February - March 2017

Production: April 2017

Shipping: June 2017

About us

Unicorn Publishing is a truly inclusive organization. We generate most of our titles in-house and in most cases our books are manufactured by local printers. Nevertheless, we are always open to collaborate with all professionals, artists, and writers from around the country and worldwide. We are concentrating our efforts on creating best content that is interesting, educational, and fun to read/watch/play with.

story:
Short Summary

This is a year-end BLOWOUT where you can get some awesome stuff while directly supporting an independent working artist!

Having completed TWO successful Indiegogo campaigns to publish JAPAN 365 and Life Is Sweet, I thought why not try it for prints, cool shirts and custom artwork, too?

With YOUR contribution to this campaign today, I can keep the creative wheels turning as we dive into a CRAZY new year together. With your support now, you'll guarantee that colorful and inspiring murals keep popping up all over town. AND you get yourself a sweet T-shirt, print, book, and/or a custom piece for your home or office. Don't need it? GIVE any or all as one-of-a-kind super-awesome GIFTS this holiday season!

 

ABOUT THE ARTIST - J MUZACZ

If you don't know me already or aren't familiar with my work, I'm originally from Houston, currently living and working in Austin as a muralist, artist and Urban Painting instructor for the City of Austin's Totally Cool Totally Art teen program. 

Having lived abroad in Korea, Japan, Australia and New Zealand, I draw from my cultural experiences, often depicting different cultures, wildlife from the region, plants, flowers, food, and whatever else my imaginative colleagues or clients can dream up.

Here are links to my books published after successful Indiegogo campaigns not unlike this one:

JAPAN 365 - http://amzn.to/2fIyJhq

Life Is Sweet - http://amzn.to/2gtBUuQ

 

What You Get!

Now HERE is the fun part!

YOU get to select from a plethora of perks: Prints, Tees, Books, Custom Artwork, even a MURAL.

Limited Edition "GIVE" T-Shirts!

  • American Apparel soft, 100% cotton, hand-printed at Industry Print Shop right here in Austin, TX
  • Black with White design on Men's
  • Ivory (Cream) with Gold design on Women's
  • Yuki is wearing a women's M size, and I have on a men's L, so they run slightly small

Print proof specs:

 

BOOKS!

  • Japan 365: A Drawing-A-Day Project - 432 pages in black and white, smooth matte cover, 365 ball pen drawings, bilingual in English and Japanese with an index and glossary of useful Japanese terms, great as a coffee table book!
  • Life Is Sweet: The Story of a Sugarcane Field, 60 pages in full-color, hardcover, bilingual in English and Japanese, an entertaining and educational children's story!

 

Fine Art Prints!

Large format prints are 12"x 16" horizontal layout (Classic Pink, Emerald Afterglow) or 11"x 17" vertical layout (Diego, Frida, Cesar) with 1 in. white border, signed. Standard sizes for easy matting, framing, etc., 100# CMYK color high-quality prints.

Custom Artwork!

  • 12" x 12" or similar wood panel painting with a single main image of your choice
  • 3' x 4' Large stretched canvas painting or similar (pick up or delivery in Austin)                           

Custom Mural!

  • 4'x8' on plywood mini-mural with content of your choosing (pick-up or delivery in Austin area TBD)
  • 10'x10' mural or approximate size on your wall of choice, surface texture somewhat determines content capability, but open to your ideas for custom design of any kind (Austin area)

**Same deal applies for murals NOT in Austin area as long as travel costs are covered separately!

Basically, to cover costs of printing or painting and shipping to you, the perks are priced so the producers are paid, YOU get high-quality custom products, and I can make room for fresh new work and keep doing what I do. YOUR SUPPORT IS CRUCIAL!!

And if I don't reach my goal, your individual contribution will still go toward fulfilling your desired perks as promised. No worries. 

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign is my residual inspiration to sustain a creative lifestyle, always pushing my limits and developing styles unique to every environment and situation. Making art for the now, as well as creating classic works for the future is a huge commitment that I am able to make, thanks in large part to YOUR support over the years. 

Risks & Challenges

I put myself out there when starting big walls, or even attempting to grab ideas in someone's head when working on their commissions. There is a great deal of risk involved, not only of falling off a scaffold to the death, but also of public opinion. Though hardly calloused, I take every utterance to heart and it motivates me to work harder and push forward. 

If you are reading this, I hope you realize what a significant impact the actions you take have on my life and so many others. Today is the day, now is the time, let's really make it count!

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you just can't contribute, there are still ways you can help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise! A share on Facebook with a personal note to your people helps a lot. A quick email direct to friends and family is even better. A post on your blog or elsewhere is awesome. And talking to people in REAL LIFE is also great!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! It is so easy, just takes a second and goes a long way.
  • And that's all there is to it :)

Thank you THANK YOU THANK YOU!!

Happy Holidays to you all and I wish you the very best in the NEW YEAR!

Let's KEEP UP THE ART!!

-J Muzacz

Please get the word out and make some noise! A share on Facebook with a personal note to your people helps a lot. A quick email direct to friends and family is even better. A post on your blog or elsewhere is awesome. And talking to people in REAL LIFE is also great!
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! It is so easy, just takes a second and goes a long way.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nathalie Jean. I have been a tattoo artist in Montréal for 25 years. During the pandemic I have been drawing and designing paper doll crafts of celebrities and characters that I admire and sharing them online to give people a distraction. I managed to publish my first volume of paper doll coloring crafts in a book called «  Not Maintream » with the help of a crowd fund and pre order last spring. Now, with your help, I am trying to gather funds for the publishing of my second and hopefully my third book which I have drawn during the quarantine. I would like to this by offering preorders of my second book « Heartthrob ». This money would allow me to order and publish my second coloring book and hopefully my third book called « FIERCE » which is a collection of female icons that I love.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise 3000.00$ to help with the printing costs of my paper doll coloring books. With these pre orders from buyers I can get some help to raise money to make my books happen. This money will cover printing as well as individual shipping costs.

The Impact

Everyone’s contributions are very appreciated. I started drawing these dolls for fun and decided to share them online and give them to people for something to pass the time with.I began to receive positive emails from Europe and other countries and I have even made some new connections and friendships through my last book crowd funding. Creating these books have given me joy and helped me pass the time during quarantine. They are a way for me to connect with people and hopefully give something fun for them to do and share. The celebrities and characters I chose in my doll books are not necessarily ones that we would typically find in such crafts books and their legacy is important to me. Hopefully they bring joy to other fans or help people discover new things.

THANK YOU 

MERCI
